1471

360-degree feedback

4G

href="addexample:nineoneone_xg_1">◆</xhtml:a></xsymb><label-g-blk>(<label-g><geo-blk><geo e_id="nineoneone_geo_1" geo="n_am"><xhtml:a href="x:911">911</xhtml:a>.<xhtml:br></xhtml:br><chn><fthzmark></fthzmark>拨 911 报警。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></sn-g></sn-blk-nolist></sn-gs></h-g>
</>
99
<head><link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="oalecd9.css" /><script src="oalecd9.js" charset="utf-8" type="text/javascript" language="javascript"></script></head><h-g><top-g> <h e_id="99_h_1">99</h><infl e_id="99_infl_1"></infl><pron-gs wd="99"><pron-g-blk><brelabel><xhtml:a href="help:bre">BrE</xhtml:a></brelabel> <pron-g><xhtml:a href="help:phonetics"><phon-blk>/<phon>ˌnaɪntiˈnaɪn</phon>/</phon-blk></xhtml:a></pron-g></pron-g-blk><pron-g-blk><xhtml:br></xhtml:br><namelabel><xhtml:a href="help:name">NAmE</xhtml:a></namelabel> <pron-g><xhtml:a href="help:phonetics"><phon-blk>/<phon>ˌnaɪntiˈnaɪn</phon>/</phon-blk></xhtml:a></pron-g></pron-g-blk></pron-gs><label-g-blk> (<label-g><geo-blk><geo e_id="99_geo_1" geo="br"><xhtml:a href="helpg:br"><brelabel>BrE</brelabel></xhtml:a></geo></geo-blk></label-g>) </label-g-blk></top-g><sn-gs><sn-blk-nolist><sn-g eid=""><def neh="n" noblk="y"><xhtml:a href="d:an">an</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:ice">ice</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:cream">cream</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:in">in</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:a">a</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:cone">cone</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:with">with</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:a">a</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:stick">stick</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:of">of</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:chocolate">chocolate</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:in">in</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:the">the</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:top">top</xhtml:a><chnsep> </chnsep><chn><fthzmark></fthzmark>巧克力棒蛋卷冰淇淋</chn></def></sn-g></sn-blk-nolist></sn-gs></h-g>
</>
999
<head><link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="oalecd9.css" /><script src="oalecd9.js" charset="utf-8" type="text/javascript" language="javascript"></script></head><h-g eid="999_hg_1"><top-g> <h e_id="13cbac68492.43da">999</h><pron-gs source="gl2019" wd="999"><pron-g-blk><brelabel><xhtml:a href="help:bre">BrE</xhtml:a></brelabel> <pron-g><xhtml:a href="help:phonetics"><phon-blk>/<phon>ˌnaɪn -able

e_id="13cbab9c8f4.15c6" eid="able_drg_2"><drtri><xhtml:a href="adddr:13cbab9c8f4.15c6">▸</xhtml:a></drtri> <top-g><dr-l eid="able_drl_2"><dr-blk><dr e_id="13cbab9c8f4.15c9" eid="able_dr_3">-ably</dr>, </dr-blk><dr-blk><dr e_id="13cbab9c8f4.15ca" eid="able_dr_4">-ibly</dr> </dr-blk></dr-l></top-g><sn-gs eid="able_sngs_4"><sn-blk-nolist><sn-g eid="able_sng_6"><use-blk noblk="y"> (<use><xhtml:a eid="able_xg_14"><xsymb><xhtml:a href="addexample:13cbab9c8f4.15cf">◆</xhtml:a></xsymb><x e_id="13cbab9c8f4.15d0" e_inline="y" eid="able_x_14" status="6" tranid="13"><xhtml:a href="x:noticeably">noticeably</xhtml:a><xhtml:br></xhtml:br><chn><fthzmark></fthzmark>显著地</chn></x></x-g-blk><x-g-blk e_id="13cbab9c8f4.15d1" eid="able_xg_15"><xsymb><xhtml:a href="addexample:13cbab9c8f4.15d1">◆</xhtml:a></xsymb><x e_id="13cbab9c8f4.15d2" e_inline="y" eid="able_x_15" status="3" tranid="14"><xhtml:a href="x:incredibly">incredibly</xhtml:a><xhtml:br></xhtml:br><chn><fthzmark></fthzmark>令人难以置信</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></sn-g></sn-blk-nolist><unbox type="grammar" Name="can / could / be able to / manage" eid="can_hm1_unbox_2" e_id="13cbabb1a08.41ba"><body eid="can_hm1_body_2" e_id="13cbabb1a08.41bb"><title eid="can_hm1_h1_2" e_id="13cbabb1a08.41bc" e_inline="y"><titled tranID="28" status="1">can / could / be able to / manage</titled></title><ul eid="can_hm1_ul_2" class="bullet" e_id="13cbabb1a08.41bd"><li eid="can_hm1_li_3" e_id="13cbabb1a08.41be" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>Can</eb>  is used to say that somebody knows how to do something.<chnsep> * </chnsep><chn>can 表示懂得做</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="can_hm1_xgs_17" e_id="13cbabb1a08.41c0"><x-g-blk eid="can_hm1_xg_38"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="can_hm1_x_38" e_id="13cbabb1a08.41c2" e_inline="y" tranID="3" status="6">Can you play the piano?<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>你会弹钢琴吗？</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs><und margined="y"> It is also used with verbs of seeing, noticing, etc.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>该词亦与表示看见、注意到等的动词连用</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="can_hm1_xgs_18" e_id="13cbabb1a08.41c3"><x-g-blk eid="can_hm1_xg_39"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="can_hm1_x_39" e_id="13cbabb1a08.41c5" e_inline="y" tranID="5" status="6">I can hear someone calling.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>我听见有人在呼叫。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs><und margined="y">and with passive infinitives.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>并与不定式的被动形式连用</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="can_hm1_xgs_19" e_id="13cbabb1a08.41c6"><x-g-blk eid="can_hm1_xg_40"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="can_hm1_x_40" e_id="13cbabb1a08.41c8" e_inline="y" tranID="29" status="3">The podcast can be downloaded here.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>播客可在此下载。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li eid="can_hm1_li_4" e_id="13cbabb1a08.41c9" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>Can</eb>  or  <eb>be able to</eb>  are used to say that something is possible or that somebody has the opportunity to do something.<chnsep> * </chnsep><chn>can 或 be able to 表示某事情有可能或某人有机会做某事</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="can_hm1_xgs_20" e_id="13cbabb1a08.41cc"><x-g-blk eid="can_hm1_xg_41"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="can_hm1_x_41" e_id="13cbabb1a08.41ce" e_inline="y" tranID="9" status="6">Can you/are you able to come on Saturday?<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>你星期六能来吗？</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li eid="can_hm1_li_5" e_id="13cbabb1a08.41cf" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">You use  <eb>be able to</eb>  to form the future and perfect tenses and the infinitive.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>用 be able to 构成将来时、完成时和动词不定式</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="can_hm1_xgs_21" e_id="13cbabb1a08.41d1"><x-g-blk eid="can_hm1_xg_42"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="can_hm1_x_42" e_id="13cbabb1a08.41d3" e_inline="y" tranID="11" status="6">You'll be able to get a taxi outside the station.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>在车站外可搭乘出租车。</chn></x></x-g-blk><x-g-blk eid="can_hm1_xg_43"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="can_hm1_x_43" e_id="13cbabb1a08.41d5" e_inline="y" tranID="13" status="6">I haven't been able to get much work done today.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>我今天未能干多少工作。</chn></x></x-g-blk><x-g-blk eid="can_hm1_xg_44"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="can_hm1_x_44" e_id="13cbabb1a08.41d7" e_inline="y" tranID="15" status="6">She'd love to be able to play the piano.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>她很希望能弹钢琴。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li eid="can_hm1_li_6" e_id="13cbabb1a08.41d8" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>Could</eb>  is used to talk about what someone was generally able to do in the past.<chnsep> * </chnsep><chn>could 表示过去通常能做</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="can_hm1_xgs_22" e_id="13cbabb1a08.41da"><x-g-blk eid="can_hm1_xg_45"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="can_hm1_x_45" e_id="13cbabb1a08.41dc" e_inline="y" tranID="17" status="6">Our daughter could walk when she was nine months old.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>我们的女儿九个月大就会走路了。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li eid="can_hm1_li_7" e_id="13cbabb1a08.41dd" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">You use  <eb>was/were able to</eb>  or  <eb>manage</eb>  (but not  <eb>could</eb>) when you are saying that something was possible on a particular occasion in the past.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>关于在过去特定情况下可能的事用 was/were able to 或 manage，但不用 could</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="can_hm1_xgs_" e_id="13cbabb1a08.41e1"><x-g-blk eid="can_hm1_xg_46"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="can_hm1_x_46" e_id="13cbabb1a08.41e3" e_inline="y" tranID="19" status="6">I was able to/managed to find some useful books in the library.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>我总算在图书馆找到了一些有用的书。</chn></x></x-g-blk><x-g-blk eid="can_hm1_xg_47"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><wx eid="can_hm1_wx_1" e_id="13cbabb1a08.41e5">I could find some useful books in the library.</wx></x-g-blk></x-gs><und margined="y"> In negative sentences,  <eb>could not</eb>  can also be used.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>否定句也可用 could not</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="can_hm1_xgs_24" e_id="13cbabb1a08.41e7"><x-g-blk eid="can_hm1_xg_48"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="can_hm1_x_47" e_id="13cbabb1a08.41e9" e_inline="y" tranID="22" status="6">We weren't able to/didn't manage to/couldn't get there in time.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>我们未能及时赶到那儿。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs><und margined="y">  <eb>Could</eb>  is also used with this meaning with verbs of seeing, noticing, understanding, etc.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>亦可用 could 加表示看见、注意到、明白等的动词表示此义</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="can_hm1_xgs_25" e_id="13cbabb1a08.41eb"><x-g-blk eid="can_hm1_xg_49"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="can_hm1_x_48" e_id="13cbabb1a08.41ed" e_inline="y" tranID="24" status="6">I could see there was something wrong.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>我发觉出事了。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li eid="can_hm1_li_8" e_id="13cbabb1a08.41ee" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>Could have</eb>  is used when you are saying that it was possible for somebody to do something in the past but they did not try.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>表示过去有可能做某事但没有做，用 could have</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="can_hm1_xgs_26" e_id="13cbabb1a08.41f0"><x-g-blk eid="can_hm1_xg_50"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="can_hm1_x_49" e_id="13cbabb1a08.41f2" e_inline="y" tranID="26" status="6">I could have won the game but decided to let her win.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>我本可以赢得那场比赛，但还是决定让她赢了。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li></ul></body></unbox></sn-gs></dr-g></dr-g-blk></dr-gs></h-g>
</>
(a) brave new world
<head><link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="oalecd9.css" /><script src="oalecd9.js" charset="utf-8" type="text/javascript" language="javascript"></script></head><idm-g e_id="13cbabb1a08.-4c73" </>
(a) fat chance (of sth/doing sth)

href="helpr:ironic">ironic</xhtml:a></reg></reg-blk></label-g>) </label-g-blk><chnsep> </chnsep><chn>活到 102／23 岁高龄（常作反语）</chn></und></li><li eid="age_li_28" e_id="13cbab9c8f4.7728" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>be/become/be getting/be going</eb>  senile <label-g-blk>(<label-g><reg-blk><q>often</q> <reg reg="iron"><xhtml:a href="helpr:ironic">ironic</xhtml:a></reg></reg-blk></label-g>) </label-g-blk><chnsep> </chnsep><chn>变得衰老（常作反语）</chn></und></li><li eid="age_li_29" e_id="13cbab9c8f4.772c" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>die (peacefully)/pass away</eb>  in your sleep/after a brief illness<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>在睡梦中／患病不久（平静地）离开人世</chn></und></li></ul></body></unbox></sn-gs></h-g>
</>

(all) grist to the/sb's mill

(and) about time (too)
<head><link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="oalecd9.css" /><script src="oalecd9.js" charset="utf-8" type="text/javascript" language="javascript"></script></head><idm-g e_id="13cbac5155c.4109" eid="time_idmg_1"><top-g><idm-l eid="time_idml_1"><idm-blk e_id="13cbac5155c.410c" eid="time_idm_1"><xsymb><xhtml:a href="addid:13cbac5155c.410c">●</xhtml:a></xsymb><idm e_id="13cbac5155c.410c" eid="time_idm_1">(<xhtml:a href="xi:and">and</xhtml:a>) <xhtml:a href="xi:about">about</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="xi:time">ˈtime</xhtml:a> (<xhtml:a href="xi:too">ˈtoo</xhtml:a>)</idm></idm-blk><idm-blk e_id="13cbac5155c.410d" eid="time_idm_2"><xsymb><xhtml:a href="addid:13cbac5155c.410d">●</xhtml:a></xsymb><idm e_id="13cbac5155c.410d" eid="time_idm_2">(<xhtml:a href="xi:and">and</xhtml:a>) <xhtml:a href="xi:not">not</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="xi:before">before</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="xi:time">ˈtime</xhtml:a></idm></idm-blk></idm-l></top-g><sn-gs eid="time_sngs_6"><sn-blk><sn-g eid="time_sng_13" n=""><def neh="n" noblk="y"><xhtml:a href="d:used">used</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:to">to</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:say">say</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:that">that</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="help:sth">sth</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:should">should</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:have">have</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:happened">happened</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:before">before</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:now">now</xhtml:a><chnsep> </chnsep><chn><fthzmark></fthzmark>早该发生；早该如此</chn></def></sn-g></sn-blk></sn-gs></idm-g><div class="seealso">See also <a href="entry://entry://time">time</a></div>
</>
(and) not before time
<head><link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="oalecd9.css" /><script src="oalecd9.js" charset="utf-8" type="text/javascript" language="javascript"></script></head><idm-g e_id="13cbac5155c.4109" eid="time_idmg_1"><top-g><idm-l eid="time_idml_1"><idm-blk e_id="13cbac5155c.410c" eid="time_idm_1"><xsymb><xhtml:a href="addid:13cbac5155c.410c">●</xhtml:a></xsymb><idm e_id="13cbac5155c.410c" eid="time_idm_1">(<xhtml:a href="xi:and">and</xhtml:a>) <xhtml:a href="xi:about">about</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="xi:time">ˈtime</xhtml:a> (<xhtml:a href="xi:too">ˈtoo</xhtml:a>)</idm></idm-blk><idm-blk e_id="13cbac5155c.410d" eid="time_idm_2"><xsymb><xhtml:a href="addid:13cbac5155c.410d">●</xhtml:a></xsymb><idm e_id="13cbac5155c.410d" eid="time_idm_2">(<xhtml:a href="xi:and">and</xhtml:a>) <xhtml:a href="xi:not">not</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="xi:before">before</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="xi:time">ˈtime</xhtml:a></idm></idm-blk></idm-l></top-g><sn-gs eid="time_sngs_6"><sn-blk><sn-g eid="time_sng_13" n=""><def neh="n" noblk="y"><xhtml:a href="d:used">used</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:to">to</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:say">say</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:that">that</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="help:sth">sth</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:should">should</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:have">have</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:happened">happened</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:before">before</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:now">now</xhtml:a><chnsep> </chnsep><chn><fthzmark></fthzmark>早该发生；早该如此</chn></def></sn-g></sn-blk></sn-gs></idm-g><div class="seealso">See also <a href="entry://entry://time">time</a></div>

-ant
<head><link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="oalecd9.css" /><script src="oalecd9.js" charset="utf-8" type="text/javascript" language="javascript"></script></head><h-g eid="ant_hg_2"><top-g> <h e_id="13cbaba1a9a.-23e1">-ant</h><hcomma>, </hcomma> <h e_id="13cbaba1a9a.-23de">-ent</h><pos-g eid="ant_posg_2"> <pos-blk><pos><xhtml:a eid="ant_sng_3" n=""><use-blk noblk="y"> (<use><xhtml:a href="d:in">in</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:adjectives">adjectives</xhtml:a><chnsep> </chnsep><chn>构成形容词</chn></use>) </use-blk><def neh="n" </chnsep><chn><fthzmark></fthzmark>是…的；做…的</chn></def><x-gs eid="ant_xgs_2"><x-g-blk e_id="13cbaba1a9a.-23d3" eid="ant_xg_3"><xsymb><xhtml:a href="addexample:13cbaba1a9a.-23d3">◆</xhtml:a></xsymb><x e_id="13cbaba1a9a.-23d2" e_inline="y" eid="ant_x_3" status="6" tranid="3"><xhtml:a href="x:significant">significant</xhtml:a><xhtml:br></xhtml:br><chn><fthzmark></fthzmark>有意义的</chn></x></x-g-blk><x-g-blk e_id="13cbaba1a9a.-23d1" eid="ant_xg_4"><xsymb><xhtml:a href="addexample:13cbaba1a9a.-23d1">◆</xhtml:a></xsymb><x e_id="13cbaba1a9a.-23d0" e_inline="y" eid="ant_x_4" status="3" tranid="4"><xhtml:a href="x:different">different</xhtml:a><xhtml:br></xhtml:br><chn><fthzmark></fthzmark>不同的</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></sn-g></licontent></xhtml:li></xhtml:ol></sn-blk><sn-blk shcut="n"><xhtml:ol start="2"><xhtml:li><licontent><sn-g eid="ant_sng_4" n=""><use-blk noblk="y"> (<use><xhtml:a href="d:in">in</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:nouns">nouns</xhtml:a><chnsep> </chnsep><chn>构成名词</chn></use>) </use-blk><def neh="n" noblk="n"><xhtml:a href="d:a">a</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:person">person</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:or">or</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:thing">thing</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:that">that</xhtml:a><chnsep> </chnsep><chn><fthzmark></fthzmark>…人；…事物</chn></def><x-gs eid="ant_xgs_3"><x-g-blk e_id="13cbaba1a9a.-23cb" eid="ant_xg_5"><xsymb><xhtml:a href="addexample:13cbaba1a9a.-23cb">◆</xhtml:a></xsymb><x e_id="13cbaba1a9a.-23ca" e_inline="y" eid="ant_x_5" status="6" tranid="7"><xhtml:a href="x:inhabitant">inhabitant</xhtml:a><xhtml:br></xhtml:br><chn><fthzmark></fthzmark>居民</chn></x></x-g-blk><x-g-blk e_id="13cbaba1a9a.-23c9" eid="ant_xg_6"><xsymb><xhtml:a href="addexample:13cbaba1a9a.-23c9">◆</xhtml:a></xsymb><x e_id="13cbaba1a9a.-23c8" e_inline="y" eid="ant_x_6" status="3" tranid="8"><xhtml:a href="x:deterrent">deterrent</xhtml:a><xhtml:br></xhtml:br><chn><fthzmark></fthzmark>威慑因素</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></sn-g></licontent></xhtml:li></xhtml:ol></sn-blk><unbox type="which_word" Name="answer / reply" eid="answer_unbox_1" e_id="13cbaba1a9a.-2497"><body eid="answer_body_1" e_id="13cbaba1a9a.-2496"><title eid="answer_h1_1" e_id="13cbaba1a9a.-2495" e_inline="y"><titled tranID="22" status="1">answer / reply</titled></title><h2 eid="answer_h2_1" e_id="13cbaba1a9a.-2494" e_inline="y" tranID="2" status="6">Verbs<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>动词</chn></h2><ul eid="answer_ul_1" class="bullet" e_id="13cbaba1a9a.-2493"><li eid="answer_li_1" e_id="13cbaba1a9a.-2492" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>Answer</eb>  and  <eb>reply</eb>  are the most common verbs used for speaking or writing as a reaction to a question, letter, etc.<chnsep> * </chnsep><chn>answer 和 reply 为口语或书面语中表示回答问题、复信等最通用的动词。</chn></und></li><li eid="answer_li_2" e_id="13cbaba1a9a.-248f" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">Note that you  <eb>answer</eb>  a person, question or letter, not <ei eid="answer_ei_1" e_id="13cbaba1a9a.-248d">answer to</ei> them, but you  <eb>reply to</eb>  somebody or something.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>表示回答或回复时，answer 后不用 to，宾语可以是人，也可以是问题或信，而 reply 后要用 to</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="answer_xgs_15" e_id="13cbaba1a9a.-248b"><x-g-blk eid="answer_xg_42"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="answer_x_42" e_id="13cbaba1a9a.-2489" e_inline="y" tranID="5" status="6">I'm writing to answer your questions.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>特此函复贵方提问。</chn></x></x-g-blk><x-g-blk eid="answer_xg_43"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="answer_x_43" e_id="13cbaba1a9a.-2487" e_inline="y" tranID="7" status="6">I'm writing to reply to your questions.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>特此函复贵方提问。</chn></x></x-g-blk><x-g-blk eid="answer_xg_44"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><wx eid="answer_wx_1" e_id="13cbaba1a9a.-2485">I'm writing to answer to your questions.</wx></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li eid="answer_li_3" e_id="13cbaba1a9a.-2484" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>Answer</eb>  can be used with or without an object.<chnsep> * </chnsep><chn>answer 既可带宾语，也可不带宾语</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="answer_xgs_16" e_id="13cbaba1a9a.-2482"><x-g-blk eid="answer_xg_45"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="answer_x_44" e_id="13cbaba1a9a.-2480" e_inline="y" tranID="10" status="6">I haven't answered her email yet.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>我还没有回复她的电邮。</chn></x></x-g-blk><x-g-blk eid="answer_xg_46"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="answer_x_45" e_id="13cbaba1a9a.-247e" e_inline="y" tranID="12" status="6">I knocked on the door but nobody answered.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>我敲了门，但无人应答。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs><und margined="y">  <eb>Reply</eb>  is often used with the actual words spoken.<chnsep> * </chnsep><chn>reply 常带直接引语</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="answer_xgs_17" e_id="13cbaba1a9a.-247c"><x-g-blk eid="answer_xg_47"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="answer_x_46" e_id="13cbaba1a9a.-247a" e_inline="y" tranID="14" status="6">'I won't let you down,' he replied.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>“我不会让你失望的。” 他回答说。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li eid="answer_li_4" e_id="13cbaba1a9a.-2479" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>Respond</eb>  is less common and more formal.<chnsep> * </chnsep><chn>respond 较少用，且较正式</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="answer_xgs_18" e_id="13cbaba1a9a.-2477"><x-g-blk eid="answer_xg_48"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="answer_x_47" e_id="13cbaba1a9a.-2475" e_inline="y" tranID="16" status="6">The directors were unwilling to <ebi>respond to</ebi> questions.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>董事们不愿意回答问题。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li eid="answer_li_5" e_id="13cbaba1a9a.-2473" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">You can only  <eb>answer</eb>  a door or a phone.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>应门或接电话只能用 answer。</chn></und></li></ul><xr-gs xt="see"><xrhead><xhtml:a href="helpxr:see"> <arrow>➡</arrow>  see also</xhtml:a></xrhead><xr-g-blk><xr-g> <xh><xhtml:a href="xid:13cbac3027d.4670">rejoin</xhtml:a></xh><xhm e_id="u4cdebea65f7df6b4.22e47478.145b5220125.72bb">2</xhm></xr-g></xr-g-blk><xr-g-blk>, <xr-g> <xh><xhtml:a href="xid:13cbac3647b.-61c2">retort</xhtml:a></xh></xr-g></xr-g-blk><xr-g-blk>, <xr-g> <xh><xhtml:a href="xid:13cbabe3564.-295b">get back to sb</xhtml:a></xh></xr-g></xr-g-blk></xr-gs><h2 eid="answer_h2_2" e_id="13cbaba1a9a.-246a" e_inline="y" tranID="19" status="6">Nouns<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>名词</chn></h2><ul eid="answer_ul_2" class="bullet" e_id="13cbaba1a9a.-2469"><li eid="answer_li_6" e_id="13cbaba1a9a.-2468" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">Note the phrases  <eb>in answer to</eb>  and  <eb>in reply to</eb>.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>注意 in answer to 和 in reply to 的用法</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="answer_xgs_19" e_id="13cbaba1a9a.-2465"><x-g-blk eid="answer_xg_49"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="answer_x_48" e_id="13cbaba1a9a.-2463" e_inline="y" tranID="21" status="6">I'm writing in answer to your letter.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>特此函复。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li></ul><xr-gs xt="see"><xrhead><xhtml:a href="helpxr:see"> <arrow>➡</arrow>  see eid="cooking_li_1"><und margined="n"> <eb>prepare</eb>  a dish/a meal/a menu/dinner/the fish<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>准备一道菜／一顿饭／一份菜单／正餐／鱼</chn></und></li><li e_id="13cbabc0139.69e" e_inline="y" eid="cooking_li_7"><und margined="n"> <eb>remove/discard</eb>  the bones/seeds/skin<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>去骨；去籽；去皮</chn></und></li><li e_id="13cbabc0139.6aa" e_inline="y" eid="cooking_li_8"><und margined="n"> <eb>blend/combine/mix (together)</eb>  the flour and water/all the ingredients<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>把面粉和水／所有的食材和在一起</chn></und></li><li e_id="13cbabc0139.6ac" e_inline="y" eid="cooking_li_9"><und margined="n"> <eb>beat/whisk</eb>  the cream/eggs/egg whites<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>搅打奶油／鸡蛋／鸡蛋清</chn></und></li><li e_id="13cbabc0139.6ae" e_inline="y" eid="cooking_li_10"><und margined="n"> <eb>knead/shape/roll (out)</eb>  the dough<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>揉捏／定型／擀平面团</chn></und></li></ul><h2 e_id="13cbabc0139.6b0" e_inline="y" eid="cooking_h2_2" status="2" tranid="43">Cooking<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>烹饪</chn></h2><ul class="bullet" e_id="13cbabc0139.6b1" eid="cooking_ul_2"><li e_id="13cbabc0139.6b2" e_inline="y" eid="cooking_li_11"><und margined="n"> <eb>heat</eb>  the oil in a frying pan<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>在平底煎锅里将油烧热</chn></und></li><li e_id="13cbabc0139.6b4" e_inline="y" eid="cooking_li_12"><und margined="n"> <eb>preheat/heat</eb>  the oven/<label-g-blk>(<label-g><geo-blk><geo geo="br"><xhtml:a href="helpg:br"><brelabel>BrE</brelabel></xhtml:a></geo></geo-blk></label-g>) </label-g-blk> the grill/<label-g-blk>(<label-g><geo-blk><geo geo="n_am"><xhtml:a href="helpg:am"><namelabel>NAmE</namelabel></xhtml:a></geo></geo-blk></label-g>) </label-g-blk> the broiler<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>将烤箱／烤架预热／加热</chn></und></li><li e_id="13cbabc0139.6ba" e_inline="y" eid="cooking_li_13"><und margined="n"> <eb>bring to</eb> <label-g-blk>(<label-g><geo-blk><geo geo="br"><xhtml:a href="helpg:br"><brelabel>BrE</brelabel></xhtml:a></geo></geo-blk></label-g>) </label-g-blk> the boil/<label-g-blk>(<label-g><geo-blk><geo geo="n_am"><xhtml:a href="helpg:am"><namelabel>NAmE</namelabel></xhtml:a></geo></geo-blk></label-g>) </label-g-blk> a boil<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>使沸腾</chn></und></li><li e_id="13cbabc0139.6c0" e_inline="y" eid="cooking_li_14"><und margined="n"> <eb>stir </eb>  constantly/gently with a wooden spoon<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>用木勺子不停地／轻轻地搅拌</chn></und></li><li e_id="13cbabc0139.6c2" e_inline="y" eid="cooking_li_15"><und margined="n"> <eb>reduce</eb>  the heat<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>把温度调低</chn></und></li><li e_id="13cbabc0139.6c4" e_inline="y" eid="cooking_li_16"><und margined="n"> <eb>simmer</eb>  gently for 20 minutes/until reduced by half<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>用文火炖 20 分钟／炖到量减少一半</chn></und></li><li e_id="13cbabc0139.6c6" e_inline="y" eid="cooking_li_17"><und margined="n"> <eb>melt</eb>  the butter/chocolate/cheese/sugar<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>使黄油／巧克力／奶酪／糖融化</chn></und></li><li e_id="13cbabc0139.6c8" e_inline="y" eid="cooking_li_18"><und margined="n"> <eb>brown</eb>  the meat for 8–20 minutes<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>把肉加热 8 至 20 分钟使之成棕色</chn></und></li><li e_id="13cbabc0139.6ca" e_inline="y" eid="cooking_li_19"><und margined="n"> <eb>drain</eb>  the pasta/the water from the pot/in a colander<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>把意大利面滤干；把水从锅里滤出来／滤到滤器里</chn></und></li><li e_id="13cbabc0139.6cc" e_inline="y" eid="cooking_li_20"><und margined="n"> <eb>mash</eb>  the potatoes/banana/avocado<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>把土豆／香蕉／油梨捣碎</chn></und></li></ul><h2 e_id="13cbabc0139.6ce" e_inline="y" eid="cooking_h2_3" status="6" tranid="23">Ways of cooking<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>烹饪方式</chn></h2><ul class="bullet" e_id="13cbabc0139.6cf" eid="cooking_ul_3"><li e_id="13cbabc0139.6d0" e_inline="y" eid="cooking_li_21"><und margined="n"> <eb>cook</eb>  food/fish/meat/rice/pasta/a Persian dish<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>烹饪食物／鱼／肉／米饭／意大利面食／波斯菜</chn></und></li><li e_id="13cbabc0139.6d2" e_inline="y" eid="cooking_li_22"><und margined="n"> <eb>bake</eb>  (a loaf of) bread/a cake/<label-g-blk>(<label-g><geo-blk><geo geo="n_am"><q>especially</q> <xhtml:a href="helpg:am"><namelabel>NAmE</namelabel></xhtml:a></geo></geo-blk></label-g>) </label-g-blk> cookies/<label-g-blk>(<label-g><geo-blk><geo geo="br"><xhtml:a href="helpg:br"><brelabel>BrE</brelabel></xhtml:a></geo></geo-blk></label-g>) </label-g-blk> biscuits/a pie/potatoes/fish/scones/muffins<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>烤（一条）面包／一个蛋糕／曲奇饼／小甜饼／馅饼／土豆／鱼／司康饼／小松糕</chn></und></li><li e_id="13cbabc0139.6d8" e_inline="y" eid="cooking_li_"><und margined="n"> <eb>boil</eb>  cabbage/potatoes/an egg/water<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>煮洋白菜／土豆／鸡蛋；烧开水</chn></und></li><li e_id="13cbabc0139.6da" e_inline="y" eid="cooking_li_24"><und margined="n"> <eb>fry/deep-fry/stir-fry</eb>  the chicken/vegetables<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>煎／油炸／炒鸡肉／蔬菜</chn></und></li><li e_id="13cbabc0139.6dc" e_inline="y" eid="cooking_li_25"><und margined="n"> <eb>grill</eb>  meat/steak/chicken/sausages/a hot dog<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>烧烤肉／牛排／鸡肉／香肠／热狗</chn></und></li><li e_id="13cbabc0139.6de" e_inline="y" eid="cooking_li_26"><und margined="n"> <eb>roast</eb>  potatoes/peppers/meat/chicken/lamb<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>烘烤土豆／甜椒／肉／鸡肉／羊羔肉</chn></und></li><li e_id="13cbabc0139.6e0" e_inline="y" eid="cooking_li_27"><und margined="n"> <eb>sauté</eb>  garlic/mushrooms/onions/potatoes/vegetables<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>炒大蒜／蘑菇／洋葱／土豆／蔬菜</chn></und></li><li e_id="13cbabc0139.6e2" e_inline="y" eid="cooking_li_28"><und margined="n"> <eb>steam</eb>  rice/vegetables/spinach/asparagus/dumplings<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>蒸米饭／蔬菜／菠菜／芦笋／饺子</chn></und></li><li e_id="13cbabc0139.6e4" e_inline="y" eid="cooking_li_29"><und margined="n"> <eb>toast</eb>  bread/nuts<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>烤面包／坚果</chn></und></li><li e_id="13cbabc0139.6e6" e_inline="y" eid="cooking_li_30"><und margined="n"> <eb>microwave</eb>  food/popcorn/<label-g-blk>(<label-g><geo-blk><geo geo="br"><xhtml:a href="helpg:br"><brelabel>BrE</brelabel></xhtml:a></geo></geo-blk></label-g>) </label-g-blk> a ready meal<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>用微波炉烹调（或加热）食物／爆米花／预制餐</chn></und></li></ul><h2 e_id="13cbabc0139.6ea" e_inline="y" eid="cooking_h2_4" status="6" tranid="34">Serving<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>上菜</chn></h2><ul class="bullet" e_id="13cbabc0139.6eb" eid="cooking_ul_4"><li e_id="13cbabc0139.6ec" e_inline="y" eid="cooking_li_31"><und margined="n"> <eb>serve</eb>  in a glass/on a bed of rice/with potatoes<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>盛在玻璃杯里上；上盖饭；和土豆一起上</chn></und></li><li e_id="13cbabc0139.6ee" e_inline="y" eid="cooking_li_32"><und margined="n"> <eb>arrange</eb>  the slices on a plate/in a layer<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>把切片在盘子里摆好／铺成一层</chn></und></li><li e_id="13cbabc0139.6f0" e_inline="y" eid="cooking_li_33"><und margined="n"> <eb>carve</eb>  the meat/lamb/chicken/turkey<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>把肉／羊羔肉／鸡肉／火鸡肉切成块</chn></und></li><li e_id="13cbabc0139.6f2" e_inline="y" eid="cooking_li_34"><und margined="n"> <eb>dress/toss</eb>  a salad<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>给色拉加调味酱；拌色拉</chn></und></li><li e_id="13cbabc0139.6f4" e_inline="y" eid="cooking_li_35"><und margined="n"> <eb>dress with/drizzle with</eb>  olive oil/vinaigrette<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>浇上橄榄油／色拉调味汁</chn></und></li><li e_id="13cbabc0139.6f6" e_inline="y" eid="cooking_li_36"><und margined="n"> <eb>top with</eb>  a slice of lemon/a scoop of ice cream/whipped cream/syrup<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>上面放一片柠檬／一勺冰淇淋／搅打好的奶油／糖浆</chn></und></li><li e_id="13cbabc0139.6f8" e_inline="y" eid="cooking_li_37"><und margined="n"> <eb>garnish with</eb>  a sprig of parsley/fresh basil leaves/lemon wedges/a slice of lime/a twist of orange<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>用一小枝欧芹／新鲜的罗勒叶／柠檬角／一片酸橙／一卷橘子皮做饰菜</chn></und></li><li e_id="13cbabc0139.6fa" e_inline="y" eid="cooking_li_38"><und margined="n"> <eb>sprinkle with</eb>  salt/sugar/herbs/parsley/freshly ground black pepper<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>洒上盐／糖／香草／欧芹／刚磨碎的黑胡椒</chn></und></li></ul></body></unbox></sn-gs></idm-g><div class="seealso">See also <a href="entry://entry://bold">bold</a></div>
</>
(as) bright as a button
<head><link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="oalecd9.css" /><script src="oalecd9.js" charset="utf-8" type="text/javascript" language="javascript"></script></head><idm-g e_id="13cbabb1a08.-3343" eid="bright_idm_2">(<xhtml:a href="xi:as">as</xhtml:a>) <xhtml:a href="xi:bright">bright</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="xi:as">as</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="xi:a">a</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="xi:button">ˈbutton</xhtml:a></idm></idm-blk></top-g><sn-gs eid="bright_sngs_5"><sn-blk><sn-g eid="bright_sng_9" n=""><label-g-blk>(<label-g><geo-blk><geo e_id="13cbabb1a08.-333d" href="d:quick">quick</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:to">to</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:understand">understand</xhtml:a><chnsep> </chnsep><chn><fthzmark></fthzmark>机灵的；聪颖的</chn></def></sn-g></sn-blk><unbox e_id="13cbabf24c9.3852" eid="intelligent_unbox_1" name="intelligent" type="synonyms"><body e_id="13cbabf24c9.3853" eid="intelligent_body_1"><title e_id="13cbabf24c9.3854" e_inline="y" eid="intelligent_h1_1"><titled status="1" tranid="23">intelligent</titled></title><inlinelist><und margined="n">smart</und> ◇ <und margined="n">clever</und> ◇ <und margined="n">brilliant</und> ◇ <und margined="n">bright</und></inlinelist><p e_id="13cbabf24c9.385a" e_inline="y" eid="intelligent_p_1"><und margined="n">These words all describe people who are good at learning, understanding and thinking about things, and the actions that show this ability.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>以上各词均形容人有才智、悟性强、聪明。</chn></und></p><ul class="deflist" e_id="13cbabf24c9.385b" eid="intelligent_ul_2"><li e_id="13cbabf24c9.385c" e_inline="y" eid="intelligent_li_5"><unsyn>intelligent</unsyn> <und margined="n">good at learning, understanding and thinking in a logical way about things; showing this ability<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>指有才智的、悟性强的、聪明的</chn>：</und><x-gs e_id="13cbabf24c9.385e" eid="intelligent_xgs_4"><x-g-blk eid="intelligent_xg_5"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x e_id="13cbabf24c9.3860" e_inline="y" eid="intelligent_x_5" status="6" tranid="5">He's a <ebi>highly intelligent</ebi> man.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>他是一个很有才智的人。</chn></x></x-g-blk><x-g-blk eid="intelligent_xg_6"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x e_id="13cbabf24c9.3863" e_inline="y" eid="intelligent_x_6" status="6" tranid="7">She asked a lot of intelligent questions.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>她问了许多机智的问题。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li e_id="13cbabf24c9.3864" e_inline="y" eid="intelligent_li_6"><unsyn>smart</unsyn> <und margined="n"><label-g-blk>(<label-g><geo-blk><geo geo="n_am"><q>especially</q> <xhtml:a href="helpg:am"><namelabel>NAmE</namelabel></xhtml:a></geo></geo-blk></label-g>) </label-g-blk> quick at learning and understanding things; showing the ability to make good business or personal decisions<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>指聪明的、机敏的、精明的</chn>：</und><x-gs e_id="13cbabf24c9.3868" eid="intelligent_xgs_5"><x-g-blk eid="intelligent_xg_7"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x e_id="13cbabf24c9.386a" e_inline="y" eid="intelligent_x_7" status="6" tranid="9">She's smarter than her brother.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>她比她哥哥聪明。</chn></x></x-g-blk><x-g-blk eid="intelligent_xg_8"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x e_id="13cbabf24c9.386c" e_inline="y" eid="intelligent_x_8" status="6" tranid="11">That was a smart career move.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>那是个人事业发展上的明智之举。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li e_id="13cbabf24c9.386d" e_inline="y" eid="intelligent_li_7"><unsyn>clever</unsyn> <und margined="n"><label-g-blk>(<label-g><reg-blk><q>sometimes</q> <reg reg="disappro"><xhtml:a href="helpr:disappro">disapproving</xhtml:a></reg>, </reg-blk><geo-blk><geo geo="br"><q>especially</q> <xhtml:a href="helpg:br"><brelabel>BrE</brelabel></xhtml:a></geo></geo-blk></label-g>) </label-g-blk> quick at learning and understanding things; showing this ability<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>指聪明的、聪颖的</chn>：</und><x-gs e_id="13cbabf24c9.3872" eid="intelligent_xgs_6"><x-g-blk eid="intelligent_xg_9"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x e_id="13cbabf24c9.3874" e_inline="y" eid="intelligent_x_9" status="6" tranid="13">How clever of you to work it out!<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>你解决了这个问题真是太聪明了。</chn></x></x-g-blk><x-g-blk eid="intelligent_xg_10"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x e_id="13cbabf24c9.3876" e_inline="y" eid="intelligent_x_10" status="6" tranid="15">He's <ebi>too clever by half</ebi>, if you ask me.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>恕我直言，他未免聪明过头了。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs><un e_id="13cbabf24c9.3878" un="note"> <boxtag>NOTE</boxtag> <und margined="n">People use  <eb>clever</eb>  in the phrase <ei>Clever boy/girl!</ei> to tell a young child that they have learnt or done sth well. When used to or about an adult  <eb>clever</eb>  can be disapproving.<chnsep> * </chnsep><chn>clever 用于短语 Clever boy/girl!（多么聪颖的男孩／女孩！）表示孩子学习悟性强、做事聪明伶俐。clever 用于成年人可能含贬义。</chn></und></un></li><li e_id="13cbabf24c9.387e" e_inline="y" eid="intelligent_li_8"><unsyn>brilliant</unsyn> <und margined="n">extremely intelligent or skilful<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>指聪颖的、技艺高的</chn>：</und><x-gs e_id="13cbabf24c9.3880" eid="intelligent_xgs_8"><x-g-blk eid="intelligent_xg_12"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x e_id="13cbabf24c9.3882" e_inline="y" eid="intelligent_x_12" status="6" tranid="20">He's a brilliant young scientist.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>他是一个才华横溢的青年科学家。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li e_id="13cbabf24c9.3883" e_inline="y" eid="intelligent_li_9"><unsyn>bright</unsyn> <und margined="n">intelligent; quick to learn<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>指聪明的、悟性强的</chn>：</und><x-gs e_id="13cbabf24c9.3885" eid="intelligent_xgs_9"><x-g-blk eid="intelligent_xg_13"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x e_id="13cbabf24c9.3887" e_inline="y" eid="intelligent_x_13" status="6" tranid="22">She's probably the brightest student in the class.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>她大概是班里最聪明的学生。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs><un e_id="13cbabf24c9.3888" un="note"> <boxtag>NOTE</boxtag> <und margined="n"> <eb>Bright</eb>  is used especially to talk about young people. Common collocations of  <eb>bright</eb>  include <ei e_id="13cbabf24c9.388b" eid="intelligent_ei_2">girl</ei>, <ei e_id="13cbabf24c9.388c" eid="intelligent_ei_3">boy</ei>, <ei e_id="13cbabf24c9.388d" eid="intelligent_ei_4">kid</ei>, <ei e_id="13cbabf24c9.388e" eid="intelligent_ei_5">student</ei>, <ei e_id="13cbabf24c9.388f" eid="intelligent_ei_6">pupil</ei>.<chnsep> * </chnsep><chn>bright 主要用于年轻人，常与之搭配的词有 girl、boy、kid、student、pupil 等。</chn></und></un></li></ul><h3 e_id="13cbabf24c9.3890" e_inline="y" eid="intelligent_h3_1" status="1" tranid="34">Patterns</h3><ul class="bullet" e_id="13cbabf24c9.3891" eid="intelligent_ul_3"><li e_id="13cbabf24c9.3892" e_inline="y" eid="intelligent_li_10"><und margined="n">clever/brilliant  <eb>at</eb>  sth</und></li><li e_id="13cbabf24c9.3894" e_inline="y" eid="intelligent_li_11"><und margined="n">a(n) intelligent/smart/clever/brilliant/bright  <eb>child/boy/girl/man/woman</eb> </und></li><li e_id="13cbabf24c9.3896" e_inline="y" eid="intelligent_li_12"><und margined="n">a(n) intelligent/smart/clever/brilliant  <eb>thing to do</eb> </und></li></ul></body></unbox></sn-gs></idm-g><div class="seealso">See also <a href="entry://entry://bright">bright</a></div>
</>
(as) clear as day
<head><link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="oalecd9.css" /><script src="oalecd9.js" charset="utf-8" type="text/javascript" language="javascript"></script></head><idm-g e_id="13cbabb88d0.21fc" eid="clear_idmg_2"><top-g><idm-blk e_id="13cbabb88d0.21fe" eid="clear_idm_2"><xsymb><xhtml:a href="addid:13cbabb88d0.21fe">●</xhtml:a></xsymb><idm e_id="13cbabb88d0.21fe" eid="clear_idm_2">(<xhtml:a href="xi:as">as</xhtml:a>) <xhtml:a href="xi:clear">clear</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="xi:as">as</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="xi:day">ˈday</xhtml:a></idm></idm-blk></top-g><sn-gs eid="clear_sngs_16"><sn-blk><sn-g eid="clear_sng_18" n=""><def neh="n" noblk="y"><xhtml:a href="d:easy">easy</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:to">to</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:see">see</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:or">or</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:understand">understand</xhtml:a><chnsep> </chnsep><chn><fthzmark></fthzmark>显而易见；容易理解</chn></def></sn-g></sn-blk></sn-gs></idm-g><div class="seealso">See also <a href="entry://entry://clear">clear</a></div>
</>
(as) clear as mud
<head><link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="oalecd9.css" /><script src="oalecd9.js" charset="utf-8" type="text/javascript" language="javascript"></script></head><idm-g e_id="13cbabb88d0.2202" eid="clear_idmg_3"><top-g><idm-blk e_id="13cbabb88d0.2204" eid="clear_idm_3"><xsymb><xhtml:a href="addid:13cbabb88d0.2204">●</xhtml:a></xsymb><idm e_id="13cbabb88d0.2204" eid="clear_idm_3">(<xhtml:a href="xi:as">as</xhtml:a>) <xhtml:a href="xi:clear">clear</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="xi:as">as</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="xi:mud">ˈmud</xhtml:a></idm></idm-blk></top-g><sn-gs eid="clear_sngs_17"><sn-blk><sn-g eid="clear_sng_19" n=""><label-g-blk>(<label-g><reg-blk><reg e_id="13cbabb88d0.2208" reg="infml"><xhtml:a href="helpr:infml">informal</xhtml:a></reg>, </reg-blk><reg-blk><reg e_id="13cbabb88d0.2209" reg="humor"><xhtml:a href="helpr:humor">humorous</xhtml:a></reg></reg-blk></label-g>) </label-g-blk><def neh="n" noblk="y"><xhtml:a href="d:not">not</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:clear">clear</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:at">at</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:all">all</xhtml:a>; (as) cool as a cucumber

(as) dead as a doornail

(as) dead as a/the dodo

e_id="13cbac587f0.-3f54" e_inline="y" eid="trip_p_1"><und margined="n">These are all words for an act of travelling to a place.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>以上各词均指旅行、旅游。</chn></und></p><ul class="deflist" e_id="13cbac587f0.-3f53" eid="trip_ul_2"><li e_id="13cbac587f0.-3f52" e_inline="y" eid="trip_li_7"><unsyn>trip</unsyn> <und margined="n"> an act of travelling from one place to another, and usually back again<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>通常指往返的旅行</chn>：</und><x-gs e_id="13cbac587f0.-3f50" eid="trip_xgs_3"><x-g-blk eid="trip_xg_9"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x e_id="13cbac587f0.-3f4e" e_inline="y" eid="trip_x_9" tranid="7">a five-minute trip by taxi<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>五分钟的出租车车程</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li e_id="13cbac587f0.-3f4b" e_inline="y" eid="trip_li_8"><unsyn>journey</unsyn> <und margined="n"> an act of travelling from one place to another, especially when they are a long way apart<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>尤指长途旅行</chn>：</und><x-gs e_id="13cbac587f0.-3f49" eid="trip_xgs_4"><x-g-blk eid="trip_xg_11"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x e_id="13cbac587f0.-3f47" e_inline="y" eid="trip_x_11" status="6" tranid="9">a long and difficult journey across the mountains<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>漫长而艰难的翻山旅行</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li></ul><h3 e_id="13cbac587f0.-3f46" e_inline="y" eid="trip_h3_1" status="6" tranid="10">trip or journey?<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>用 trip 还是 journey？</chn></h3><p e_id="13cbac587f0.-3f45" e_inline="y" eid="trip_p_2"><und margined="n">A  <eb>trip</eb>  usually involves you going to a place and back again; a  <eb>journey</eb>  is usually one-way. A  <eb>trip</eb>  is often shorter than a  <eb>journey</eb>, although it does not have to be.<chnsep> * </chnsep><chn>trip 通常为往返旅行，journey 通常为单程旅行。trip 的行程常较 journey 短，但并非一定如此</chn>：</und><x-gs e_id="13cbac587f0.-3f40" eid="trip_xgs_5"><x-g-blk eid="trip_xg_12"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x e_id="13cbac587f0.-3f3e" e_inline="y" eid="trip_x_12" status="6" tranid="12">a trip to New York<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>去纽约的旅行</chn></x></x-g-blk><x-g-blk eid="trip_xg_13"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x e_id="13cbac587f0.-3f3c" e_inline="y" eid="trip_x_13" status="6" tranid="14">a round-the-world trip<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>环球旅行</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs><und margined="y">It is often short in time, even if it is long in distance.  <eb>Journey</eb>  is more often used when the travelling takes a long time and is difficult. In North American English  <eb>journey</eb>  is not used for short trips.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>即使距离远，trip 所花时间常常不长。如果旅程长且艰难较常用 journey。在美式英语中，journey 不用以指短途旅行</chn>：</und><x-gs e_id="13cbac587f0.-3f37" eid="trip_xgs_6"><x-g-blk eid="trip_xg_14"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><label-g-blk>(<label-g><geo-blk><geo geo="br"><xhtml:a like?<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>你上班的路程如何？</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></p><ul class="deflist" e_id="13cbac587f0.-3f34" eid="trip_ul_3"><li e_id="13cbac587f0.-3f33" e_inline="y" </chnsep><chn>巴伐利亚之旅</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li e_id="13cbac587f0.-3f2e" e_inline="y" eid="trip_li_10"><unsyn>expedition</unsyn> <und margined="n"> an organized journey with a particular purpose, especially to find out about a place that is not well known<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>指远征、探险、考察</chn>：</und><x-gs e_id="13cbac587f0.-3f2c" eid="trip_xgs_8"><x-g-blk e_id="13cbac587f0.-3f25" e_inline="y" eid="trip_x_17" status="6" tranid="22">We went on an all-day excursion to the island.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>我们到岛上去游览了一整天。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li e_id="13cbac587f0.-3f24" e_inline="y" eid="trip_li_12"><unsyn>outing</unsyn> <und margined="n"> a short trip made for pleasure or education, usually with a group of people and lasting no more than a day<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>指集体出外游玩或学习，通常不超过一天</chn>：</und><x-gs e_id="13cbac587f0.-3f22" eid="trip_xgs_10"><x-g-blk eid="trip_xg_18"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x e_id="13cbac587f0.-3f20" e_inline="y" eid="trip_li_13"><unsyn>day out</unsyn> <und margined="n"> a trip to somewhere for a day, especially for pleasure<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>指一日游</chn>：</und><x-gs e_id="13cbac587f0.-3f1d" (as) deaf as a post

journey？</chn></h3><p e_id="13cbac587f0.-3f45" e_inline="y" eid="trip_p_2"><und margined="n">A  <eb>trip</eb>  usually involves you going to a place and back again; a  <eb>journey</eb>  is usually one-way. A  <eb>trip</eb>  is often shorter than a  <eb>journey</eb>, although it does not have to be.<chnsep> * </chnsep><chn>trip 通常为往返旅行，journey 通常为单程旅行。trip 的行程常较 journey 短，但并非一定如此</chn>：</und><x-gs e_id="13cbac587f0.-3f40" eid="trip_xgs_5"><x-g-blk eid="trip_xg_12"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x e_id="13cbac587f0.-3f3e" e_inline="y" eid="trip_x_12" status="6" tranid="12">a trip to New York<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>去纽约的旅行</chn></x></x-g-blk><x-g-blk eid="trip_xg_13"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x e_id="13cbac587f0.-3f3c" e_inline="y" eid="trip_x_13" status="6" tranid="14">a round-the-world trip<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>环球旅行</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs><und margined="y">It is often short in time, even if it is long in distance.  <eb>Journey</eb>  is more often used when the travelling takes a long time and is difficult. In North American English  <eb>journey</eb>  is not used for short trips.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>即使距离远，trip 所花时间常常不长。如果旅程长且艰难较常用 journey。在美式英语中，journey 不用以指短途旅行</chn>：</und><x-gs e_id="13cbac587f0.-3f37" eid="trip_xgs_6"><x-g-blk eid="trip_xg_14"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><label-g-blk>(<label-g><geo-blk><geo geo="br"><xhtml:a href="helpg:br"><brelabel>BrE</brelabel></xhtml:a></geo></geo-blk></label-g>) </label-g-blk><x e_id="13cbac587f0.-3f35" e_inline="y" eid="trip_x_14" status="2" tranid="37">What is your journey to work like?<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>你上班的路程如何？</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></p><ul class="deflist" e_id="13cbac587f0.-3f34" eid="trip_ul_3"><li e_id="13cbac587f0.-3f33" e_inline="y" eid="trip_li_9"><unsyn>tour</unsyn> <und margined="n"> a journey made for pleasure during which several different places are visited<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>指游览多地的旅行、旅游</chn>：</und><x-gs e_id="13cbac587f0.-3f31" eid="trip_xgs_7"><x-g-blk eid="trip_xg_15"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x e_id="13cbac587f0.-3f2f" e_inline="y" eid="trip_x_15" status="6" tranid="18">a tour of Bavaria<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>巴伐利亚之旅</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li e_id="13cbac587f0.-3f2e" e_inline="y" eid="trip_li_10"><unsyn>expedition</unsyn> <und margined="n"> an organized journey with a particular purpose, especially to find out about a place that is not well known<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>指远征、探险、考察</chn>：</und><x-gs e_id="13cbac587f0.-3f2c" eid="trip_xgs_8"><x-g-blk eid="trip_xg_16"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x e_id="13cbac587f0.-3f2a" e_inline="y" eid="trip_x_16" status="6" tranid="20">the first expedition to the South Pole<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>首次去南极的探险</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li e_id="13cbac587f0.-3f29" e_inline="y" eid="trip_li_11"><unsyn>excursion</unsyn> <und margined="n"> a short trip made for pleasure, especially one that has been organized for a group of people<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>尤指集体远足、短途旅行</chn>：</und><x-gs e_id="13cbac587f0.-3f27" eid="trip_xgs_9"><x-g-blk eid="trip_xg_17"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x e_id="13cbac587f0.-3f25" e_inline="y" eid="trip_x_17" status="6" tranid="22">We went on an all-day excursion to the island.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>我们到岛上去游览了一整天。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li e_id="13cbac587f0.-3f24" e_inline="y" eid="trip_li_12"><unsyn>outing</unsyn> <und margined="n"> a short trip made for pleasure or education, usually with a group of people and lasting no more than a day<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>指集体出外游玩或学习，通常不超过一天</chn>：</und><x-gs e_id="13cbac587f0.-3f22" eid="trip_xgs_10"><x-g-blk eid="trip_xg_18"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x e_id="13cbac587f0.-3f20" e_inline="y" eid="trip_x_18" status="6" tranid="24">The children were on a day's outing from school.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>孩子们离校游览了一天。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li e_id="13cbac587f0.-3f1f" e_inline="y" eid="trip_li_13"><unsyn>day out</unsyn> <und margined="n"> a trip to somewhere for a day, especially for pleasure<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>指一日游</chn>：</und><x-gs e_id="13cbac587f0.-3f1d" eid="trip_xgs_11"><x-g-blk eid="trip_xg_19"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x e_id="13cbac587f0.-3f1b" e_inline="y" eid="trip_x_19" status="6" tranid="26">We had a day out at the beach.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>我们在海滩玩了一天。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li></ul><h3 e_id="13cbac587f0.-3f1a" e_inline="y" eid="trip_h3_2" status="1" tranid="38">Patterns</h3><ul class="bullet" e_id="13cbac587f0.-3f19" eid="trip_ul_4"><li e_id="13cbac587f0.-3f18" e_inline="y" eid="trip_li_14"><und margined="n">a(n)  <eb>foreign/overseas</eb>  trip/journey/tour/expedition</und></li><li e_id="13cbac587f0.-3f16" e_inline="y" eid="trip_li_15"><und margined="n">a  <eb>bus/coach/train/rail</eb>  trip/journey/tour</und></li><li e_id="13cbac587f0.-3f14" e_inline="y" eid="trip_li_16"><und margined="n">to  <eb>go on</eb>  a(n) trip/journey/tour/expedition/excursion/outing/day out</und></li><li e_id="13cbac587f0.-3f12" e_inline="y" eid="trip_li_17"><und margined="n">to  <eb>set out/off on</eb>  a(n) trip/journey/tour/expedition/excursion</und></li><li e_id="13cbac587f0.-3f10" e_inline="y" eid="trip_li_18"><und margined="n">to  <eb>make</eb>  a(n) trip/journey/tour/expedition/excursion</und></li></ul></body></unbox></sn-gs></idm-g><div class="seealso">See also <a href="entry://entry://deaf">deaf</a></div>
</>
(as) drunk as a lord

(as) dull as ditchwater
<head><link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="oalecd9.css" /><script src="oalecd9.js" charset="utf-8" type="text/javascript" language="javascript"></script></head><idm-g e_id="13cbabce420.343a" eid="dull_idmg_1"><top-g><idm-blk e_id="13cbabce420.343c" eid="dull_idm_1"><xsymb><xhtml:a href="addid:13cbabce420.343c">●</xhtml:a></xsymb><idm e_id="13cbabce420.343c" eid="dull_idm_1">(<ftindex context="(as) dull as ˈditchwater" itemid="13cbabce420.343c" type="id" word="as"></ftindex><xhtml:a href="xi:as">as</xhtml:a>) <ftindex context="(as) dull as ˈditchwater" itemid="13cbabce420.343c" geo="usa"><xhtml:a href="helpg:us"><em>US</em></xhtml:a></geo></geo-blk></label-g></label-g-blk><v-blk><v>(<ftindex context="(as) dull as ˈdishwater" itemid="" type="id" word="as"></ftindex><xhtml:a itemid="" type="id" word="as"></ftindex><xhtml:a href="xi:as">as</xhtml:a> <ftindex context="(as) dull as ˈdishwater" itemid="" type="id" word="ˈdishwater"></ftindex><xhtml:a href="xi:dishwater">ˈdishwater</xhtml:a></v></v-blk></v-g></v-g-blk></v-gs>) </v-gs-blk></top-g><sn-gs eid="dull_sngs_10"><sn-blk><sn-g eid="dull_sng_10" n=""><def neh="n" noblk="y"><xhtml:a href="d:extremely">extremely</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:boring">boring</xhtml:a><chnsep> </chnsep><chn><fthzindex contents="索然无味；无聊透顶" encontext="" type="d"></fthzindex>索然无味；无聊透顶</chn></def></sn-g></sn-blk><unbox e_id="13cbabce420.-65cf" eid="disgusting_unbox_1" name="disgusting" type="synonyms"><body e_id="13cbabce420.-65ce" eid="disgusting_body_1"><title e_id="13cbabce420.-65cd" e_inline="y" eid="disgusting_h1_1"><titled status="1" tranid="27">disgusting</titled></title><inlinelist><und margined="n">foul</und> ◇ <und margined="n">revolting</und> ◇ <und margined="n">repulsive</und> ◇ <und margined="n">offensive</und> ◇ <und margined="n">gross</und></inlinelist><p e_id="13cbabce420.-65c6" e_inline="y" eid="disgusting_p_1"><und margined="n">These words all describe sth, especially a smell, taste or habit, that is extremely unpleasant and often makes you feel slightly ill<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>以上各词形容某物（尤指气味、味道或习惯）令人很不舒服而且常令人恶心。</chn></und></p><ul class="deflist" e_id="13cbabce420.-65c5" eid="disgusting_ul_2"><li e_id="13cbabce420.-65c4" e_inline="y" eid="disgusting_li_6"><unsyn>disgusting</unsyn> <und margined="n">extremely unpleasant and making you feel slightly ill<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>指令人不快的、使人厌恶的、令人恶心的、使人作呕的</chn>：</und><x-gs e_id="13cbabce420.-65c2" eid="disgusting_xgs_3"><x-g-blk eid="disgusting_xg_5"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x e_id="13cbabce420.-65c0" e_inline="y" eid="disgusting_x_5" status="6" tranid="5">What a disgusting smell!<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>这气味真难闻！</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li e_id="13cbabce420.-65bf" e_inline="y" eid="disgusting_li_7"><unsyn>foul</unsyn> <und margined="n">dirty, and tasting or smelling bad<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>指肮脏恶臭的、难闻的、恶心的</chn>：</und><x-gs e_id="13cbabce420.-65bd" eid="disgusting_xgs_4"><x-g-blk eid="disgusting_xg_6"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x e_id="13cbabce420.-65bb" e_inline="y" eid="disgusting_x_6" status="6" tranid="11">She could smell his foul breath.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>她闻得到他的口臭。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li e_id="13cbabce420.-65ba" e_inline="y" eid="disgusting_li_8"><unsyn>revolting</unsyn> <und margined="n">extremely unpleasant and making you feel slightly ill<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>指令人不快的、使人厌恶的、令人恶心的、使人作呕的</chn>：</und><x-gs e_id="13cbabce420.-65b8" eid="disgusting_xgs_5"><x-g-blk eid="disgusting_xg_7"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x e_id="13cbabce420.-65b6" e_inline="y" eid="disgusting_x_7" status="6" tranid="7">The stew looked revolting.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>这煨菜看上去令人作呕。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li></ul><h3 e_id="13cbabce420.-65b5" e_inline="y" eid="disgusting_h3_1" status="6" tranid="8">disgusting or revolting?<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>用 disgusting 还是 revolting？</chn></h3><p e_id="13cbabce420.-65b4" e_inline="y" eid="disgusting_p_2"><und margined="n">Both of these words are used to describe things that smell and taste unpleasant, unpleasant personal habits and people who have them. There is no real difference in meaning, but  <eb>disgusting</eb>  is more frequent, especially in spoken English.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>以上两词均指气味、味道、个人习惯和有这些习惯的人令人恶心、使人厌恶，在含义上没有实质的区别，只是 disgusting 更常用，尤其是在口语中。</chn></und></p><ul class="deflist" e_id="13cbabce420.-65b2" eid="disgusting_ul_3"><li e_id="13cbabce420.-65b1" e_inline="y" eid="disgusting_li_9"><unsyn>repulsive</unsyn> <und margined="n"><label-g-blk>(<label-g><reg-blk><q>rather</q> <reg reg="fml"><xhtml:a href="helpr:fml">formal</xhtml:a></reg></reg-blk></label-g>) </label-g-blk> extremely unpleasant in a way that offends you or makes you feel slightly ill<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>指使人厌恶的、令人反感的、十分讨厌的</chn></und><un e_id="13cbabce420.-65ae" un="note"> <boxtag>NOTE</boxtag> <eb>Repulsive</eb>  usually describes people, their behaviour or habits, which you may find offensive for physical or moral reasons.<chnsep> * </chnsep><chn>repulsive 通常指人或其行为习惯刺激感官或有违道德而令人厌恶。</chn></un></li><li e_id="13cbabce420.-65ac" e_inline="y" eid="disgusting_li_10"><unsyn>offensive</unsyn> <und margined="n"><label-g-blk>(<label-g><reg-blk><reg reg="fml"><xhtml:a href="helpr:fml">formal</xhtml:a></reg></reg-blk></label-g>) </label-g-blk> (especially of smells) extremely unpleasant<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>尤指气味令人不适的、令人恶心的、使人厌恶的</chn></und></li><li e_id="13cbabce420.-65a9" e_inline="y" eid="disgusting_li_11"><unsyn>gross</unsyn> <und margined="n"><label-g-blk>(<label-g><reg-blk><reg reg="infml"><xhtml:a href="helpr:infml">informal</xhtml:a></reg></reg-blk></label-g>) </label-g-blk> (of a smell, taste or personal habit) extremely unpleasant<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>指气味、味道或个人习惯令人很不舒服的、令人恶心的、使人厌恶的</chn></und></li></ul><h3 e_id="13cbabce420.-65a6" e_inline="y" eid="disgusting_h3_2" status="1" tranid="33">Patterns</h3><ul class="bullet" e_id="13cbabce420.-65a5" eid="disgusting_ul_4"><li e_id="13cbabce420.-65a4" e_inline="y" eid="disgusting_li_12"><und margined="n">disgusting/repulsive/offensive  <eb>to</eb>  sb</und></li><li e_id="13cbabce420.-65a2" e_inline="y" eid="disgusting_li_13"><und margined="n">to  <eb>find sb/sth</eb>  disgusting/revolting/repulsive/offensive</und></li><li e_id="13cbabce420.-65a0" e_inline="y" eid="disgusting_li_14"><und margined="n">to  <eb>smell/taste</eb>  disgusting/foul/gross</und></li><li e_id="13cbabce420.-659e" e_inline="y" eid="disgusting_li_15"><und margined="n">a(n) disgusting/foul/revolting/offensive/gross  <eb>smell</eb> </und></li><li e_id="13cbabce420.-659c" e_inline="y" eid="disgusting_li_16"><und margined="n">a disgusting/revolting/gross  <eb>habit</eb> </und></li><li e_id="13cbabce420.-659a" e_inline="y" eid="disgusting_li_17"><und margined="n">disgusting/offensive/gross  <eb>behaviour</eb> </und></li><li e_id="13cbabce420.-6598" e_inline="y" eid="disgusting_li_18"><und margined="n">a disgusting/revolting/repulsive  <eb>man/woman/person</eb> </und></li></ul></body></unbox></sn-gs></idm-g><div class="seealso">See also <a href="entry://entry://dishwater">dishwater</a></div>
</>
(as) fit as a fiddle

e_id="u4cdebea65f7df6b4.-1c8fc68b.143959b3c10.-49e3" eid="" name="write" type="wordfinder"><body e_id="u4cdebea65f7df6b4.-1c8fc68b.143959b3c10.-49e2"><p e_id="13cbabe3564.-123a" e_inline="y" eid="glad_p_1"><und margined="n">These words all describe people feeling happy about sth that has happened or is going to happen.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>以上各词均形容人对已经发生或将要发生的事感到高兴、愉快。</chn></und></p><ul class="deflist" e_id="13cbabe3564.-1239" eid="glad_ul_2"><li e_id="13cbabe3564.-1238" e_inline="y" eid="glad_li_7"><unsyn>glad</unsyn> </chnsep><chn>指高兴、愉快、感激</chn>：</und><x-gs e_id="13cbabe3564.-1236" eid="glad_xgs_6"><x-g-blk eid="glad_xg_19"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x e_id="13cbabe3564.-1234" e_inline="y" eid="glad_x_19" status="6" eid="glad_xgs_7"><x-g-blk eid="glad_xg_21"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x e_id="13cbabe3564.-122d" e_inline="y" eid="glad_x_21" status="6" tranid="9">We are happy to announce the engagement of our daughter.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>我们高兴地宣布，我们的女儿订婚了。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li e_id="13cbabe3564.-122c" e_inline="y" eid="glad_li_9"><unsyn>pleased</unsyn> <und margined="n"><gram-g><gram-blk> [<gram e_id=""><xhtml:a href="helpgr:nbn">not before noun</xhtml:a></gram>] </gram-blk></gram-g> happy about sth that has happened or sth that you have to do<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>指对已经发生或必须做的事感到高兴、愉快、满意</chn>：</und><x-gs e_id="13cbabe3564.-122a" eid="glad_xgs_8"><x-g-blk eid="glad_xg_22"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x e_id="13cbabe3564.-1228" e_inline="y" eid="glad_x_22" status="6" tranid="11">She was very pleased with her exam results.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>她对考试成绩非常满意。</chn></x></x-g-blk><x-g-blk eid="glad_xg_"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x e_id="13cbabe3564.-1226" e_inline="y" eid="glad_x_" status="6" tranid="13">You're coming? I'm so pleased.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>你要来呀？我太高兴了。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li></ul><h3 e_id="13cbabe3564.-1225" e_inline="y" eid="glad_h3_1" status="6" tranid="14">glad, happy or pleased?<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>用 glad、happy 还是 pleased？</chn></h3><p e_id="13cbabe3564.-1224" e_inline="y" eid="glad_p_2"><und margined="n">Feeling  <eb>pleased</eb>  can suggest that you have judged sb/sth and approve of them. Feeling  <eb>glad</eb>  can be more about feeling grateful for sth. You cannot be 'glad with sb'.<chnsep> * </chnsep><chn>pleased 意味着对人或事作出评判并表示赞同，glad 多指对所发生的事情心怀感激，不能说 glad with sb</chn>：</und><x-gs e_id="13cbabe3564.-1221" eid="glad_xgs_9"><x-g-blk eid="glad_xg_24"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><wx e_id="13cbabe3564.-121f" eid="glad_wx_1">The boss should be glad with you.</wx></x-g-blk></x-gs><und margined="y"> <eb>Happy</eb>  can mean glad, pleased or satisfied.<chnsep> * </chnsep><chn>happy 表示高兴、愉快、满意。</chn></und></p><ul class="deflist" e_id="13cbabe3564.-121d" eid="glad_ul_3"><li e_id="13cbabe3564.-121c" e_inline="y" eid="glad_li_10"><unsyn>delighted</unsyn> <und margined="n">very pleased about sth; very happy to do sth; showing your delight<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>指高兴的、乐意的、愉快的</chn>：</und><x-gs e_id="13cbabe3564.-121a" eid="glad_xgs_10"><x-g-blk eid="glad_xg_25"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x e_id="13cbabe3564.-1218" e_inline="y" eid="glad_x_24" status="6" tranid="18">I'm delighted at your news.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>听到你的消息我非常高兴。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs><un e_id="13cbabe3564.-1217" un="note"> <boxtag>NOTE</boxtag> <und margined="n"> <eb>Delighted</eb>  is often used to accept an invitation.<chnsep> * </chnsep><chn>delighted 常用于接受邀请</chn>：</und><x-gs e_id="13cbabe3564.-1215" eid="glad_xgs_11"><x-g-blk eid="glad_xg_26"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x e_id="13cbabe3564.-1213" e_inline="y" eid="glad_x_25" status="6" tranid="20">'Can you stay for dinner?' 'I'd be delighted (to).'<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>“留下来吃晚饭好吗？” “我非常乐意。”</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></un></li><li e_id="13cbabe3564.-1212" e_inline="y" eid="glad_li_11"><unsyn>proud</unsyn> <und margined="n">pleased and satisfied about sth that you own or have done, or are connected with<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>指骄傲的、自豪的、得意的、满足的</chn>：</und><x-gs e_id="13cbabe3564.-1210" eid="glad_xgs_12"><x-g-blk eid="glad_xg_27"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x e_id="13cbabe3564.-120e" e_inline="y" eid="glad_x_26" status="6" tranid="31">proud parents<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>自豪的父母</chn></x></x-g-blk><x-g-blk eid="glad_xg_28"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x e_id="13cbabe3564.-120c" e_inline="y" eid="glad_x_27" status="6" tranid="33">He was <ebi>proud of</ebi> himself for not giving up.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>他为自己没有放弃而自豪。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li e_id="13cbabe3564.-120a" e_inline="y" eid="glad_li_12"><unsyn>relieved</unsyn> <und margined="n">feeling happy because sth unpleasant has stopped or has not happened; showing this<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>指感到宽慰的、放心的、显得开心的</chn>：</und><x-gs e_id="13cbabe3564.-1208" eid="glad_xgs_13"><x-g-blk eid="glad_xg_29"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x e_id="13cbabe3564.-1206" e_inline="y" eid="glad_x_28" status="6" tranid="35">You'll be relieved to know your jobs are safe.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>现在你们知道工作保住了，可以放心了。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li e_id="13cbabe3564.-1205" e_inline="y" eid="glad_li_13"><unsyn>thrilled</unsyn> <und margined="n"><gram-g><gram-blk> [<gram e_id=""><xhtml:a href="helpgr:nbn">not before noun</xhtml:a></gram>] </gram-blk></gram-g><label-g-blk>(<label-g><reg-blk><q>rather</q> <reg reg="infml"><xhtml:a href="helpr:infml">informal</xhtml:a></reg></reg-blk></label-g>) </label-g-blk> extremely pleased and excited about sth<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>指非常兴奋、极为激动</chn>：</und><x-gs e_id="13cbabe3564.-1202" eid="glad_xgs_14"><x-g-blk eid="glad_xg_30"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x e_id="13cbabe3564.-1200" e_inline="y" eid="glad_x_29" status="6" tranid="22">I was thrilled to be invited.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>我获得邀请，感到非常兴奋。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li></ul><h3 e_id="13cbabe3564.-11ff" e_inline="y" eid="glad_h3_2" status="6" tranid="41">delighted or thrilled?<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>用 delighted 还是 thrilled？</chn></h3><ul class="bullet" e_id="13cbabe3564.-11fe" eid="glad_ul_4"><li e_id="13cbabe3564.-11fd" e_inline="y" eid="glad_li_14"><und margined="n"> <eb>Thrilled</eb>  may express a stronger feeling than  <eb>delighted</eb>, but  <eb>delighted</eb>  can be made stronger with <ei e_id="13cbabe3564.-11f9" eid="glad_ei_2">absolutely</ei>, <ei e_id="13cbabe3564.-11f8" eid="glad_ei_3">more than</ei> or <ei e_id="13cbabe3564.-11f7" eid="glad_ei_4">only too</ei>.  <eb>Thrilled</eb>  can be made negative and ironic with <ei e_id="13cbabe3564.-11f5" eid="glad_ei_5">not exactly</ei> or <ei e_id="13cbabe3564.-11f4" eid="glad_ei_6">less than</ei>.<chnsep> * </chnsep><chn>thrilled 比 delighted 的情感更强烈，但 delighted 可与 absolutely、more than 或 only too 连用以增强语气。thrilled 与 not exactly 或 less than 连用可变为否定或含讽刺意味</chn>：</und><x-gs e_id="13cbabe3564.-11f3" eid="glad_xgs_15"><x-g-blk eid="glad_xg_31"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x e_id="13cbabe3564.-11f1" e_inline="y" eid="glad_x_30" status="6" tranid="38">She was <ebi>not exactly thrilled</ebi> at the prospect of looking after her niece.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>想到要照料她的侄女，她就高兴不起来了。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li></ul><h3 e_id="13cbabe3564.-11ef" e_inline="y" eid="glad_h3_3" status="1" tranid="60">Patterns</h3><ul class="bullet" e_id="13cbabe3564.-11ee" eid="glad_ul_5"><li e_id="13cbabe3564.-11ed" e_inline="y" eid="glad_li_15"><und margined="n">glad/happy/pleased/delighted/relieved/thrilled  <eb>about</eb>  sth<chnsep> </chnsep><chn></chn></und></li><li e_id="13cbabe3564.-11eb" e_inline="y" eid="glad_li_16"><und margined="n">pleased/delighted/relieved/thrilled  <eb>at</eb>  sth</und></li><li e_id="13cbabe3564.-11e9" e_inline="y" eid="glad_li_17"><und margined="n">glad/happy/pleased/delighted/thrilled  <eb>for</eb>  sb</und></li><li e_id="13cbabe3564.-11e7" e_inline="y" eid="glad_li_18"><und margined="n">glad/happy/pleased/delighted/proud/relieved/thrilled  <eb>that…/to see/hear/find/know…</eb> </und></li><li e_id="13cbabe3564.-11e5" e_inline="y" eid="glad_li_19"><und margined="n"> <eb>very</eb>  glad/happy/pleased/proud/relieved</und></li><li e_id="13cbabe3564.-11e3" e_inline="y" eid="glad_li_20"><und margined="n"> <eb>absolutely</eb>  delighted/thrilled</und></li></ul></body></unbox></sn-gs></idm-g><div class="seealso">See also <a href="entry://entry://pleased">pleased</a></div>
</>
(as) quick as a flash

improvement<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>自己动手；房屋改造</chn></h2><ul class="bullet" e_id="13cbabc708f.-c68" eid="decorate_ul_3"><li e_id="13cbabc708f.-c67" e_inline="y" eid="decorate_li_15"><und margined="n"> <eb>do</eb> <label-g-blk>(<label-g><geo-blk><geo geo="br"><xhtml:a href="helpg:br"><brelabel>BrE</brelabel></xhtml:a></geo></geo-blk></label-g>) </label-g-blk> DIY/carpentry/the plumbing/the wiring<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>自己动手做；做木匠活；铺设管道；铺设线路</chn></und></li><li e_id="13cbabc708f.-c63" e_inline="y" eid="decorate_li_16"><und margined="n"> <eb>make</eb>  home improvements<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>改造房屋</chn></und></li><li e_id="13cbabc708f.-c61" e_inline="y" eid="decorate_li_17"><und margined="n"> <eb>add/install</eb>  central heating/underfloor heating/insulation<chnsep> tanks/<label-g-blk>(<label-g><geo-blk><geo geo="br"><q>especially</q> <xhtml:a href="helpg:br"><brelabel>BrE</brelabel></xhtml:a></geo></geo-blk></label-g>) </label-g-blk> the loft<chnsep> tap/<label-g-blk>(<label-g><geo-blk><geo geo="n_am"><xhtml:a href="helpg:am"><namelabel>NAmE</namelabel></xhtml:a></geo> <q>usually</q></geo-blk></label-g>) </label-g-blk> faucet<chnsep> (as) regular as clockwork

every day, regular as clockwork." itemid="u4cdebea65f7df6b4.1f34c209.141c1473114.-535d" type="x" word="day"></ftindex><xhtml:a href="x:day">day</xhtml:a>, <ftindex context="He is home by six every regular as clockwork." itemid="u4cdebea65f7df6b4.1f34c209.141c1473114.-535d" type="x" word="clockwork"></ftindex><xhtml:a href="x:clockwork">clockwork</xhtml:a>.  <xhtml:br></xhtml:br><chn><fthzindex contents="他每天 6 点前必定准时回到家。" encontext="He is home by six every day, regular as clockwork." type="x"></fthzindex>他每天 6 点前必定准时回到家。</chn></x><a href="snd://_regular__gbs_14.spx"><audio-gb-liju>🔊</audio-gb-liju></a><xaudio eid="regular_xaudio_36" geo="n_am" name="_regular__ams_14"></xaudio></rx-g></x-g-blk></x-gs></sn-g></sn-blk><unbox e_id="13cbac5155c.5cb5" eid="toilet_unbox_1" name="toilet / bathroom" type="british_american"><body e_id="13cbac5155c.5cb6" eid="toilet_body_1"><title e_id="13cbac5155c.5cb7" e_inline="y" eid="toilet_h1_1"><titled status="1" tranid="4">toilet / bathroom</titled></title><ul class="bullet" e_id="13cbac5155c.5cb8" eid="toilet_ul_1"><li e_id="13cbac5155c.5cb9" e_inline="y" eid="toilet_li_1"><und margined="n">In <label-g-blk><label-g><geo-blk><geo geo="br"><xhtml:a href="helpg:br"><brelabel>BrE</brelabel></xhtml:a></geo></geo-blk></label-g></label-g-blk>, but not in <label-g-blk><label-g><geo-blk><geo geo="n_am"><xhtml:a href="helpg:am"><namelabel>NAmE</namelabel></xhtml:a></geo></geo-blk></label-g></label-g-blk>, the room that has a toilet in it is usually referred to as a  <eb>toilet</eb>. This room in people's houses can also be called the  <eb>lavatory</eb>, or informally, the  <eb>loo</eb>. An extra downstairs toilet in a house can be called the  <eb>cloakroom</eb>. In public places, especially on signs, the words  <eb>toilets</eb>,  <eb>Gents</eb>  (for men's toilets) or  <eb>Ladies</eb>  (for women's toilets) are used for a room or small building containing several toilets. You might also see  <eb>WC</eb>  or  <eb>Public Conveniences</eb>  on some signs.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>在英式英语而非美式英语中，厕所一般称为 toilet，住宅中的厕所亦可称为 lavatory 或（非正式用法）loo。住宅楼下附加的厕所可叫做 cloakroom。在公共场所，尤其在指示牌上，toilets、Gents（男厕所）或 Ladies（女厕所）指有几个小间的厕所。有的指示牌亦可能用 WC 或 Public Conveniences。</chn></und></li><li e_id="13cbac5155c.5cc7" e_inline="y" eid="toilet_li_2"><und margined="n">In <label-g-blk><label-g><geo-blk><geo geo="n_am"><xhtml:a href="helpg:am"><namelabel>NAmE</namelabel></xhtml:a></geo></geo-blk></label-g> </label-g-blk> the room that contains a toilet is usually called the  <eb>bathroom</eb>, never the  <eb>toilet</eb>. A room with a toilet in a public place can also be called a  <eb>restroom</eb>,  <eb>ladies' room</eb>,  <eb>women's room</eb>  or  <eb>men's room</eb>.  <eb>Washroom</eb>  is also used, especially in Canada.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>在美式英语中，厕所一般称为 bathroom，从不叫 toilet。公共厕所亦可称为 restroom、ladies' room、women's room 或 men's room，还可用 washroom，尤其是在加拿大。</chn></und></li></ul></body></unbox></sn-gs></idm-g><div class="seealso">See also <a href="entry://entry://clockwork">clockwork</a></div>
</>
(as) right as rain

(as) safe as houses

improvement<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>自己动手；房屋改造</chn></h2><ul class="bullet" e_id="13cbabc708f.-c68" eid="decorate_ul_3"><li e_id="13cbabc708f.-c67" e_inline="y" eid="decorate_li_15"><und margined="n"> <eb>do</eb> <label-g-blk>(<label-g><geo-blk><geo geo="br"><xhtml:a href="helpg:br"><brelabel>BrE</brelabel></xhtml:a></geo></geo-blk></label-g>) </label-g-blk> DIY/carpentry/the plumbing/the wiring<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>自己动手做；做木匠活；铺设管道；铺设线路</chn></und></li><li e_id="13cbabc708f.-c63" e_inline="y" eid="decorate_li_16"><und margined="n"> <eb>make</eb>  home improvements<chnsep> tanks/<label-g-blk>(<label-g><geo-blk><geo geo="br"><q>especially</q> <xhtml:a href="helpg:br"><brelabel>BrE</brelabel></xhtml:a></geo></geo-blk></label-g>) </label-g-blk> the loft<chnsep> (as) sick as a dog

(as) sound as a bell
<head><link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="oalecd9.css" /><script src="oalecd9.js" charset="utf-8" type="text/javascript" language="javascript"></script></head><idm-g e_id="13cbac43f7b.1ebc" e_id="13cbac43f7b.1ec2" reg="infml"><xhtml:a href="helpr:infml">informal</xhtml:a></reg></reg-blk></label-g>) </label-g-blk><def neh="n" noblk="y"><xhtml:a href="d:in">in</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a type="d"></fthzindex>状况极佳；十分健康</chn></def></sn-g></sn-blk><unbox e_id="13cbac587f0.-2b91" eid="trust_unbox_1" name="trust" type="synonyms"><body e_id="13cbac587f0.-2b90" eid="trust_body_1"><title e_id="13cbac587f0.-2b8f" e_inline="y" eid="trust_h1_1"><titled status="1" tranid="28">trust</titled></title><inlinelist><und margined="n">depend on sb/sth</und> ◇ <und margined="n">rely on sb/sth</und> ◇ <und margined="n">count on sb/sth</und> ◇ <und margined="n">believe in sb</und></inlinelist><p e_id="13cbac587f0.-2b89" e_inline="y" eid="trust_p_1"><und margined="n">These words all mean to believe that sb/sth will do what you hope or expect of them or that what they tell you is correct or true.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>以上各词均含相信、信任、信赖之义。</chn></und></p><ul class="deflist" e_id="13cbac587f0.-2b88" eid="trust_ul_2"><li e_id="13cbac587f0.-2b87" e_inline="y" eid="trust_li_5"><unsyn>trust</unsyn> <und margined="n"> to believe that sb is good, honest, sincere, etc. and that they will do what you expect of them or do the right thing; to believe that sth is true or correct<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>指相信、信任、信赖</chn>：</und><x-gs e_id="13cbac587f0.-2b85" eid="trust_xgs_14"><x-g-blk eid="trust_xg_25"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x e_id="13cbac587f0.-2b83" e_inline="y" eid="trust_x_25" status="6" tranid="5">You can trust me not to tell anyone.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>你可以相信我不会跟任何人讲。</chn></x></x-g-blk><x-g-blk eid="trust_xg_26"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x e_id="13cbac587f0.-2b81" e_inline="y" eid="trust_x_26" status="6" tranid="7">Don't trust what you read in the newspapers!<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>别相信你在报纸上读到的！</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li e_id="13cbac587f0.-2b80" e_inline="y" eid="trust_li_6"><unsyn>depend on/upon sb/sth</unsyn> <und margined="n"> (often used with <ei e_id="13cbac587f0.-2b7e" eid="trust_ei_1">can/cannot/could/could not</ei>) to trust sb/sth to do what you expect or want, to do the right thing, or to be true or correct<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>（常与 can/cannot/could/could not 连用）指相信、信赖、指望</chn>：</und><x-gs e_id="13cbac587f0.-2b7d" eid="trust_xgs_15"><x-g-blk eid="trust_xg_27"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x e_id="13cbac587f0.-2b7b" e_inline="y" eid="trust_x_27" status="6" tranid="9">He was the sort of person you could depend on.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>他是你可以信赖的人。</chn></x></x-g-blk><x-g-blk eid="trust_xg_28"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x e_id="13cbac587f0.-2b79" e_inline="y" eid="trust_x_28" status="6" tranid="11">Can you depend on her version of what happened?<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>你相信她对所发生事情的描述吗？</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li e_id="13cbac587f0.-2b78" e_inline="y" eid="trust_li_7"><unsyn>rely on/upon sb/sth</unsyn> <und margined="n"> (used especially with <ei e_id="13cbac587f0.-2b76" eid="trust_ei_2">can/cannot/could/could not</ei> and <ei e_id="13cbac587f0.-2b75" eid="trust_ei_3">should/should not</ei>) to trust sb/sth to do what you expect or want, or to be honest, correct or good enough<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>（尤与 can/cannot/could/could not 和 should/should not 连用）指信任、信赖</chn>：</und><x-gs e_id="13cbac587f0.-2b74" eid="trust_xgs_16"><x-g-blk eid="trust_xg_29"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x e_id="13cbac587f0.-2b72" e_inline="y" eid="trust_x_29" status="6" tranid="13">Can I rely on you to keep this secret?<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>我能相信你会保守这个秘密吗？</chn></x></x-g-blk><x-g-blk eid="trust_xg_30"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x e_id="13cbac587f0.-2b70" e_inline="y" eid="trust_x_30" status="6" tranid="15">You can't rely on any figures you get from them.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>你不能相信从他们那儿得到的任何数据。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li></ul><h3 e_id="13cbac587f0.-2b6f" e_inline="y" eid="trust_h3_1" status="6" tranid="16">trust, depend or rely on/upon sb/sth?<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>用 trust、depend 还是 rely on/upon sb/sth？</chn></h3><p e_id="13cbac587f0.-2b6e" e_inline="y" eid="trust_p_2"><und margined="n">You can  <eb>trust</eb>  a person but not a thing or system. You can  <eb>trust</eb>  sb's <ei e_id="13cbac587f0.-2b6b" eid="trust_ei_4">judgement</ei> or <ei e_id="13cbac587f0.-2b6a" eid="trust_ei_5">advice</ei>, but not their support. You can  <eb>depend on</eb>  sb's <ei e_id="13cbac587f0.-2b68" eid="trust_ei_6">support</ei>, but not their judgement or advice.  <eb>Rely on/upon sb/sth</eb>  is used especially with <ei e_id="13cbac587f0.-2b66" eid="trust_ei_7">you can/could</ei> or <ei e_id="13cbac587f0.-2b65" eid="trust_ei_8">you should</ei> to give advice or a promise.<chnsep> * </chnsep><chn>trust 的宾语可以是人，但不能是物或制度；trust 后还可接 sb's judgement 或 advice，但不能接 sb's support；depend on 后可跟 sb's support，但不能跟 sb's judgement 或 advice；rely on/upon sb/sth 尤与 you can/could 或 you should 连用，以给予建议或承诺</chn>：</und><x-gs e_id="13cbac587f0.-2b64" eid="trust_xgs_17"><x-g-blk eid="trust_xg_31"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><wx e_id="13cbac587f0.-2b62" eid="trust_wx_1">I don't really rely on his judgement.</wx></x-g-blk><x-g-blk eid="trust_xg_32"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x e_id="13cbac587f0.-2b60" e_inline="y" eid="trust_x_31" status="6" tranid="19">You can't really rely on his judgement.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>你不能真的相信他的判断。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></p><ul class="deflist" e_id="13cbac587f0.-2b5f" eid="trust_ul_3"><li e_id="13cbac587f0.-2b5e" e_inline="y" eid="trust_li_8"><unsyn>count on sb/sth</unsyn> <und margined="n"> (often used with <ei e_id="13cbac587f0.-2b5c" eid="trust_ei_9">can/cannot/could/could not</ei>) to be sure that sb will do what you need them to do, or that sth will happen as you want it to happen<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>（常与 can/cannot/could/could not 连用）指可信赖、依靠、指望（某人做某事）、确信（某事会发生）</chn>：</und><x-gs e_id="13cbac587f0.-2b5b" eid="trust_xgs_18"><x-g-blk eid="trust_xg_33"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x e_id="13cbac587f0.-2b59" e_inline="y" eid="trust_x_32" status="6" tranid="21">I'm counting on you to help me.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>我就靠你帮我啦。</chn></x></x-g-blk><x-g-blk eid="trust_xg_34"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x e_id="13cbac587f0.-2b57" e_inline="y" eid="trust_x_33" status="6" tranid="23">We can't count on the good weather lasting.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>我们不能指望这样好的天气会持久。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li e_id="13cbac587f0.-2b56" e_inline="y" eid="trust_li_9"><unsyn>believe in sb</unsyn> <und margined="n"> to feel that you can trust sb and/or that they will be successful<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>指信赖、信任、相信某人会成功</chn>：</und><x-gs e_id="13cbac587f0.-2b54" eid="trust_xgs_19"><x-g-blk eid="trust_xg_35"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x e_id="13cbac587f0.-2b52" e_inline="y" eid="trust_x_34" status="6" tranid="25">They need a leader they can believe in.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>他们需要一个可以信赖的领导。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li></ul><h3 e_id="13cbac587f0.-2b51" e_inline="y" eid="trust_h3_2" status="1" tranid="33">Patterns</h3><ul class="bullet" e_id="13cbac587f0.-2b50" eid="trust_ul_4"><li e_id="13cbac587f0.-2b4f" e_inline="y" eid="trust_li_10"><und margined="n">to trust/depend on/rely on/count on sb/sth  <eb>to do sth</eb> </und></li><li e_id="13cbac587f0.-2b4d" e_inline="y" eid="trust_li_11"><und margined="n">to trust/believe  <eb>in</eb>  sb/sth</und></li><li e_id="13cbac587f0.-2b4b" e_inline="y" eid="trust_li_12"><und margined="n">to trust/rely on  <eb>sb's advice/judgement</eb> </und></li><li e_id="13cbac587f0.-2b49" e_inline="y" eid="trust_li_13"><und margined="n">to depend on/rely on/count on  <eb>sb's support</eb> </und></li><li e_id="13cbac587f0.-2b47" e_inline="y" eid="trust_li_14"><und margined="n">to  <eb>completely</eb>  trust/depend on/rely on/believe in sb/sth</und></li></ul></body></unbox></sn-gs></idm-g><div class="seealso">See also <a href="entry://entry://bell">bell</a></div>
</>
(as) steady as a rock
<head><link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="oalecd9.css" /><script src="oalecd9.js" charset="utf-8" type="text/javascript" language="javascript"></script></head><idm-g e_id="13cbac4af93.-50a9" eid="steady_idmg_1"><top-g><idm-blk e_id="13cbac4af93.-50a7" eid="steady_idm_1"><xsymb><xhtml:a href="addid:13cbac4af93.-50a7">●</xhtml:a></xsymb><idm e_id="13cbac4af93.-50a7" eid="steady_sng_7" n=""><def neh="n" noblk="y"><xhtml:a href="d:extremely">extremely</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:steady">steady</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:and">and</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:calm">calm</xhtml:a>; <xhtml:a href="d:that">that</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:you">you</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:can">can</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:rely">rely</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a
