eid="crime_unbox_1" name="Crime" type="colloc"><body e_id="13cbabc0139.6b71" eid="crime_body_1"><title e_id="13cbabc0139.6b72" e_inline="y" eid="crime_h1_1"><titled status="2" tranid="34">Crime<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>犯罪</chn></titled></title><h2 e_id="13cbabc0139.6b73" e_inline="y" eid="crime_h2_1" status="6" tranid="1">Committing a crime<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>犯罪</chn></h2><ul class="bullet" e_id="13cbabc0139.6b74" eid="crime_ul_1"><li e_id="13cbabc0139.6b75" e_inline="y" eid="crime_li_1"><und margined="n"> <eb>commit</eb>  a crime/a murder/a violent assault/a brutal killing/an armed robbery/fraud<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>犯罪／谋杀罪／暴力侵犯他人身体罪／残杀罪／持械抢劫罪／诈骗罪</chn></und></li><li e_id="13cbabc0139.6b77" e_inline="y" eid="crime_li_2"><und margined="n"> <eb>be involved in</eb>  terrorism/a suspected arson attack/people smuggling/human trafficking<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>参与恐怖主义活动；涉嫌纵火袭击；参与人口走私／人口贩卖</chn></und></li><li e_id="13cbabc0139.6b79" e_inline="y" eid="crime_li_3"><und margined="n"> <eb>engage/participate in</eb>  criminal activity/illegal practices/acts of mindless vandalism<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>参与犯罪活动／非法活动／愚昧的故意毁坏他人财产的行为</chn></und></li><li e_id="13cbabc0139.6b7b" e_inline="y" eid="crime_li_4"><und margined="n"> <eb>steal</eb>  sb's wallet/purse/<label-g-blk>(<label-g><geo-blk><geo geo="br"><xhtml:a href="helpg:br"><brelabel>BrE</brelabel></xhtml:a></geo></geo-blk></label-g>) </label-g-blk> mobile phone/<label-g-blk>(<label-g><geo-blk><geo geo="n_am"><xhtml:a href="helpg:am"><namelabel>NAmE</namelabel></xhtml:a></geo></geo-blk></label-g>) </label-g-blk> cell phone<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>偷某人的钱包／手机</chn></und></li><li e_id="13cbabc0139.6b81" e_inline="y" eid="crime_li_5"><und margined="n"> <eb>rob</eb>  a bank/a person/a tourist<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>抢劫银行／他人／游客</chn></und></li><li e_id="13cbabc0139.6b83" e_inline="y" eid="crime_li_6"><und margined="n"> <eb>break into/</eb> <label-g-blk>(<label-g><geo-blk><geo geo="br"><xhtml:a href="helpg:br"><brelabel>BrE</brelabel></xhtml:a></geo></geo-blk></label-g>) </label-g-blk> <eb>burgle/</eb> <label-g-blk>(<label-g><geo-blk><geo geo="n_am"><xhtml:a href="helpg:am"><namelabel>NAmE</namelabel></xhtml:a></geo></geo-blk></label-g>) </label-g-blk> <eb>burglarize</eb>  a house/a home/an apartment<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>入室盗窃</chn></und></li><li e_id="13cbabc0139.6b8b" e_inline="y" eid="crime_li_7"><und margined="n"> <eb>hijack</eb>  a plane/ship/bus<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>劫持飞机／轮船／公共汽车</chn></und></li><li e_id="13cbabc0139.6b8d" e_inline="y" eid="crime_li_8"><und margined="n"> <eb>smuggle</eb>  drugs/weapons/arms/immigrants<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>走私毒品／武器／军火；偷运移民</chn></und></li><li e_id="13cbabc0139.6b8f" e_inline="y" eid="crime_li_9"><und margined="n"> <eb>launder</eb>  drug money (through sth)<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>（通过…）洗毒资</chn></und></li><li e_id="13cbabc0139.6b91" e_inline="y" eid="crime_li_10"><und margined="n"> <eb>forge </eb>  documents/certificates/passports<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>伪造文件／证件／护照</chn></und></li><li e_id="13cbabc0139.6b93" e_inline="y" eid="crime_li_11"><und margined="n"> <eb>take/accept/pay sb/offer (sb)</eb>  a bribe<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>索取／收受贿赂；向（某人）行贿</chn></und></li><li e_id="13cbabc0139.6b95" e_inline="y" eid="crime_li_12"><und margined="n"> <eb>run</eb>  a phishing/an email/an Internet scam<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>进行网络钓鱼／电子邮件／互联网诈骗</chn></und></li></ul><h2 e_id="13cbabc0139.6b97" e_inline="y" eid="crime_h2_2" status="6" tranid="14">Fighting crime<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>打击犯罪</chn></h2><ul class="bullet" e_id="13cbabc0139.6b98" eid="crime_ul_2"><li e_id="13cbabc0139.6b99" e_inline="y" eid="crime_li_13"><und margined="n"> <eb>combat/fight</eb>  crime/terrorism/corruption/drug trafficking<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>打击犯罪／恐怖主义／腐败／贩毒</chn></und></li><li e_id="13cbabc0139.6b9b" e_inline="y" eid="crime_li_14"><und margined="n"> <eb>prevent/stop</eb>  credit-card fraud/child abuse/software piracy<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>防止／阻止信用卡诈骗／虐待儿童／软件盗版</chn></und></li><li e_id="13cbabc0139.6b9d" e_inline="y" eid="crime_li_15"><und margined="n"> <eb>deter/stop</eb>  criminals/burglars/thieves/shoplifters/vandals<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>威慑／阻止犯罪分子／入室盗窃者／小偷／商店扒手／故意破坏公物者</chn></und></li><li e_id="13cbabc0139.6b9f" e_inline="y" eid="crime_li_16"><und margined="n"> <eb>reduce/tackle/crack down on</eb>  knife/gun/violent/street crime/<label-g-blk>(<label-g><geo-blk><geo geo="br"><q>especially</q> <xhtml:a e_id="13cbabc0139.6ba3" e_inline="y" eid="crime_li_17"><und margined="n"> <eb>foil</eb>  a bank raid/a terrorist plot<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>挫败一起银行抢劫案／一次恐怖分子的阴谋</chn></und></li><li e_id="13cbabc0139.6ba5" e_inline="y" eid="crime_li_18"><und margined="n"> <eb>help/support/protect </eb>  the victims of crime<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>帮助／支持／保护犯罪活动的受害者</chn></und></li></ul><h2 e_id="13cbabc0139.6ba7" e_inline="y" eid="crime_h2_3" status="6" tranid="21">Investigating crime<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>调查犯罪活动</chn></h2><ul class="bullet" e_id="13cbabc0139.6ba8" eid="crime_ul_3"><li e_id="13cbabc0139.6baf" e_inline="y" eid="crime_li_21"><und margined="n"> <eb>investigate</eb>  a murder/<label-g-blk>(<label-g><geo-blk><geo geo="n_am"><q>especially</q> <xhtml:a (into…)/<label-g-blk>(<label-g><geo-blk><geo geo="br"><q>especially</q> <xhtml:a href="helpg:br"><brelabel>BrE</brelabel></xhtml:a></geo></geo-blk></label-g>) </label-g-blk> a police/murder inquiry<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>进行／开始／继续（对…的）调查／警方调查／谋杀案调查</chn></und></li><li e_id="13cbabc0139.6bb7" e_inline="y" eid="crime_li_"><und margined="n"> <eb>investigate/reopen</eb>  a criminal/murder (as) thick as two short planks

e_id="13cbabce420.5df8" eid="economy_ul_1"><li e_id="13cbabce420.5df9" e_inline="y" eid="economy_li_1"><und margined="n"> <eb>handle/run/manage</eb>  the economy<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>管理经济</chn></und></li><li e_id="13cbabce420.5dfb" e_inline="y" eid="economy_li_2"><und margined="n"> <eb>boost</eb>  investment/spending/employment/growth<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>促进投资／支出／就业／增长速度</chn></und></li><li e_id="13cbabce420.5dfd" e_inline="y" eid="economy_li_3"><und margined="n"> <eb>stimulate</eb>  demand/the economy/industry<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>刺激需求／经济／工业</chn></und></li><li e_id="13cbabce420.5dff" e_inline="y" eid="economy_li_4"><und margined="n"> <eb>cut/reduce</eb>  investment/spending/borrowing<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>削减投资／支出／借贷</chn></und></li><li e_id="13cbabce420.5e01" e_inline="y" eid="economy_li_5"><und margined="n"> <eb>reduce/curb/control/keep down</eb>  inflation<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>减少／遏制通货膨胀</chn></und></li><li e_id="13cbabce420.5e03" e_inline="y" eid="economy_li_6"><und margined="n"> <eb> create/fuel</eb>  growth/demand/a boom/a bubble<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>创造／刺激增长／需求／繁荣／泡沫</chn></und></li><li e_id="13cbabce420.5e05" e_inline="y" eid="economy_li_7"><und margined="n"> <eb>encourage/foster/promote/stimulate/stifle</eb>  innovation/competition<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>鼓励／促进／刺激／抑制创新／竞争</chn></und></li><li e_id="13cbabce420.5e07" e_inline="y" eid="economy_li_8"><und margined="n"> <eb>encourage/work with/compete with</eb>  the private sector<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>鼓励私营部门；与私营部门合作／竞争</chn></und></li><li e_id="13cbabce420.5e09" e_inline="y" eid="economy_li_9"><und margined="n"> <eb>increase/boost/promote</eb>  US/agricultural exports<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>增加／促进美国／农业出口</chn></und></li><li e_id="13cbabce420.5e0b" e_inline="y" eid="economy_li_10"><und margined="n"> <eb>ban/restrict/block</eb>  cheap/foreign imports<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>禁止／限制／阻止廉价／国外进口产品</chn></und></li><li e_id="13cbabce420.5e0d" e_inline="y" eid="economy_li_11"><und margined="n">the economy  <eb>grows/expands/shrinks/contracts/slows (down)/recovers/improves/is booming</eb> <chnsep> </chnsep><chn>经济增长／扩张／收缩／萎缩／放缓／复苏／改善／繁荣</chn></und></li><li e_id="13cbabce420.5e0f" e_inline="y" eid="economy_li_12"><und margined="n"> <eb>enjoy</eb>  an economic/housing/property boom<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>享受经济／住房／房地产的繁荣期</chn></und></li></ul><h2 e_id="13cbabce420.5e11" e_inline="y" eid="economy_h2_2" status="6" tranid="14">Economic problems<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>经济问题</chn></h2><ul class="bullet" e_id="13cbabce420.5e12" eid="economy_ul_2"><li e_id="13cbabce420.5e13" e_inline="y" eid="economy_li_13"><und margined="n"> <eb>push up/drive up</eb>  prices/costs/inflation<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>抬高价格／成本；加剧通货膨胀</chn></und></li><li e_id="13cbabce420.5e15" e_inline="y" eid="economy_li_14"><und margined="n"> <eb>damage/hurt/destroy</eb>  industry/the economy<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>破坏工业／经济</chn></und></li><li e_id="13cbabce420.5e17" e_inline="y" eid="economy_li_15"><und margined="n"> <eb>cause/lead to/go into/avoid/escape</eb>  recession<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>引起／导致／进入／避开经济衰退</chn></und></li><li e_id="13cbabce420.5e19" e_inline="y" eid="economy_li_16"><und margined="n"> <eb>experience/suffer</eb>  a recession/downturn<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>经历／遭受经济衰退</chn></und></li><li e_id="13cbabce420.5e1b" e_inline="y" eid="economy_li_17"><und margined="n"> <eb>fight/combat</eb>  inflation/deflation/unemployment<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>抵抗通货膨胀／通货紧缩／失业</chn></und></li><li e_id="13cbabce420.5e1d" e_inline="y" eid="economy_li_18"><und margined="n"> <eb>cause/create</eb>  inflation/poverty/unemployment<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>导致／造成通货膨胀／贫穷／失业</chn></und></li><li e_id="13cbabce420.5e1f" e_inline="y" eid="economy_li_19"><und margined="n"> <eb>create/burst</eb>  a housing/stock market bubble<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>造成／引爆住房／股票市场泡沫</chn></und></li><li e_id="13cbabce420.5e21" e_inline="y" eid="economy_li_20"><und margined="n"> <eb>cause/trigger</eb>  a stock market crash/the collapse of the banking system<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>引起股市崩盘／银行系统崩溃</chn></und></li><li e_id="13cbabce420.5e23" e_inline="y" eid="economy_li_21"><und margined="n"> <eb>face/be plunged into</eb>  a financial/an economic crisis<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>面临／陷入财政／经济危机</chn></und></li><li e_id="13cbabce420.5e25" e_inline="y" eid="economy_li_22"><und margined="n"> <eb>be caught in/experience</eb>  cycles of boom and bust<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>陷入／经历周期性繁荣与萧条</chn></und></li></ul><h2 e_id="13cbabce420.5e27" e_inline="y" eid="economy_h2_3" status="6" tranid="25">Public finance<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>公共财政</chn></h2><ul class="bullet" e_id="13cbabce420.5e28" eid="economy_ul_3"><li e_id="13cbabce420.5e29" e_inline="y" eid="economy_li_"><und margined="n"> <eb>cut/reduce/slash/increase/double</eb>  the defence/<label-g-blk>(<label-g><geo-blk><geo geo="usa"><q>especially</q> <xhtml:a href="helpg:us"><em>US</em></xhtml:a></geo></geo-blk></label-g>) </label-g-blk> defense/education/aid budget<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>削减／大幅削减／增加／加倍国防／教育／援助预算</chn></und></li><li e_id="13cbabce420.5e2d" e_inline="y" eid="economy_li_24"><und margined="n"> <eb>increase/boost/slash/cut</eb>  public spending<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>增加／大幅削减／削减公共支出</chn></und></li><li e_id="13cbabce420.5e2f" e_inline="y" eid="economy_li_25"><und margined="n"> <eb>increase/put up/raise/cut/lower/reduce</eb>  taxes<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>提高／降低税收</chn></und></li><li e_id="13cbabce420.5e31" e_inline="y" eid="economy_li_26"><und margined="n"> <eb>raise/cut/lower/reduce</eb>  interest rates<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>提高／降低利率</chn></und></li><li e_id="13cbabce420.5e33" e_inline="y" eid="economy_li_27"><und margined="n"> <eb>ease/loosen/tighten</eb>  monetary policy<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>放宽／收紧货币政策</chn></und></li><li e_id="13cbabce420.5e35" e_inline="y" eid="economy_li_28"><und margined="n"> <eb>balance</eb>  the (state/federal) budget<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>平衡（州／联邦）预算</chn></und></li><li e_id="13cbabce420.5e37" e_inline="y" eid="economy_li_29"><und margined="n"> <eb>achieve/maintain</eb>  a balanced budget<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>达到／保持预算平衡</chn></und></li><li e_id="13cbabce420.5e39" e_inline="y" eid="economy_li_30"><und margined="n"> <eb>run</eb>  a ($4 trillion) budget deficit/surplus<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>有（4 万亿美元的）预算赤字／盈余</chn></und></li></ul><xr-gs xt="collocat"><xrhead> <arrow>➡</arrow> <xrbold><b>collocations</b></xrbold> at</xrhead><xr-g-blk><xr-g> <xh><xhtml:a (as) tough as old boots

</chnsep><chn><fthzindex contents="很强壮；坚韧不拔；雷打不动" encontext="" type="d"></fthzindex>很强壮；坚韧不拔；雷打不动</chn></def></sn-g></licontent></xhtml:li></xhtml:ol></sn-blk><sn-blk shcut="n"><xhtml:ol <xhtml:a href="d:showing">showing</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:any">any</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:emotion">emotion</xhtml:a><chnsep> </chnsep><chn><fthzindex contents="铁石心肠；不为所动" encontext="" type="d"></fthzindex>铁石心肠；不为所动</chn></def></sn-g></licontent></xhtml:li></xhtml:ol></sn-blk><unbox e_id="13cbabce420.5df4" eid="economy_unbox_1" name="The economy" type="colloc"><body e_id="13cbabce420.5df5" eid="economy_body_1"><title e_id="13cbabce420.5df6" e_inline="y" eid="economy_h1_1"><titled status="2" tranid="35">The economy<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>经济</chn></titled></title><h2 e_id="13cbabce420.5df7" e_inline="y" eid="economy_h2_1" status="6" tranid="1">Managing the economy<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>管理经济</chn></h2><ul class="bullet" e_id="13cbabce420.5df8" eid="economy_ul_1"><li e_id="13cbabce420.5df9" e_inline="y" eid="economy_li_1"><und margined="n"> <eb>handle/run/manage</eb>  the economy<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>管理经济</chn></und></li><li e_id="13cbabce420.5dfb" e_inline="y" eid="economy_li_2"><und margined="n"> <eb>boost</eb>  investment/spending/employment/growth<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>促进投资／支出／就业／增长速度</chn></und></li><li e_id="13cbabce420.5dfd" e_inline="y" eid="economy_li_3"><und margined="n"> <eb>stimulate</eb>  demand/the economy/industry<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>刺激需求／经济／工业</chn></und></li><li e_id="13cbabce420.5dff" e_inline="y" eid="economy_li_4"><und margined="n"> <eb>cut/reduce</eb>  investment/spending/borrowing<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>削减投资／支出／借贷</chn></und></li><li e_id="13cbabce420.5e01" e_inline="y" eid="economy_li_5"><und margined="n"> <eb>reduce/curb/control/keep down</eb>  inflation<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>减少／遏制通货膨胀</chn></und></li><li e_id="13cbabce420.5e03" e_inline="y" eid="economy_li_6"><und margined="n"> <eb> create/fuel</eb>  growth/demand/a boom/a bubble<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>创造／刺激增长／需求／繁荣／泡沫</chn></und></li><li e_id="13cbabce420.5e05" e_inline="y" eid="economy_li_7"><und margined="n"> <eb>encourage/foster/promote/stimulate/stifle</eb>  innovation/competition<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>鼓励／促进／刺激／抑制创新／竞争</chn></und></li><li e_id="13cbabce420.5e07" e_inline="y" eid="economy_li_8"><und margined="n"> <eb>encourage/work with/compete with</eb>  the private sector<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>鼓励私营部门；与私营部门合作／竞争</chn></und></li><li e_id="13cbabce420.5e09" e_inline="y" eid="economy_li_9"><und margined="n"> <eb>increase/boost/promote</eb>  US/agricultural exports<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>增加／促进美国／农业出口</chn></und></li><li e_id="13cbabce420.5e0b" e_inline="y" eid="economy_li_10"><und margined="n"> <eb>ban/restrict/block</eb>  cheap/foreign imports<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>禁止／限制／阻止廉价／国外进口产品</chn></und></li><li e_id="13cbabce420.5e0d" e_inline="y" eid="economy_li_11"><und margined="n">the economy  <eb>grows/expands/shrinks/contracts/slows (down)/recovers/improves/is booming</eb> <chnsep> </chnsep><chn>经济增长／扩张／收缩／萎缩／放缓／复苏／改善／繁荣</chn></und></li><li e_id="13cbabce420.5e0f" e_inline="y" eid="economy_li_12"><und margined="n"> <eb>enjoy</eb>  an economic/housing/property boom<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>享受经济／住房／房地产的繁荣期</chn></und></li></ul><h2 e_id="13cbabce420.5e11" e_inline="y" eid="economy_h2_2" status="6" tranid="14">Economic problems<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>经济问题</chn></h2><ul class="bullet" e_id="13cbabce420.5e12" eid="economy_ul_2"><li e_id="13cbabce420.5e13" e_inline="y" eid="economy_li_13"><und margined="n"> <eb>push up/drive up</eb>  prices/costs/inflation<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>抬高价格／成本；加剧通货膨胀</chn></und></li><li e_id="13cbabce420.5e15" e_inline="y" eid="economy_li_14"><und margined="n"> <eb>damage/hurt/destroy</eb>  industry/the economy<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>破坏工业／经济</chn></und></li><li e_id="13cbabce420.5e17" e_inline="y" eid="economy_li_15"><und margined="n"> <eb>cause/lead to/go into/avoid/escape</eb>  recession<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>引起／导致／进入／避开经济衰退</chn></und></li><li e_id="13cbabce420.5e19" e_inline="y" eid="economy_li_16"><und margined="n"> <eb>experience/suffer</eb>  a recession/downturn<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>经历／遭受经济衰退</chn></und></li><li e_id="13cbabce420.5e1b" e_inline="y" eid="economy_li_17"><und margined="n"> <eb>fight/combat</eb>  inflation/deflation/unemployment<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>抵抗通货膨胀／通货紧缩／失业</chn></und></li><li e_id="13cbabce420.5e1d" e_inline="y" eid="economy_li_18"><und margined="n"> <eb>cause/create</eb>  inflation/poverty/unemployment<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>导致／造成通货膨胀／贫穷／失业</chn></und></li><li e_id="13cbabce420.5e1f" e_inline="y" eid="economy_li_19"><und margined="n"> <eb>create/burst</eb>  a housing/stock market bubble<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>造成／引爆住房／股票市场泡沫</chn></und></li><li e_id="13cbabce420.5e21" e_inline="y" eid="economy_li_20"><und margined="n"> <eb>cause/trigger</eb>  a stock market crash/the collapse of the banking system<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>引起股市崩盘／银行系统崩溃</chn></und></li><li e_id="13cbabce420.5e23" e_inline="y" eid="economy_li_21"><und margined="n"> <eb>face/be plunged into</eb>  a financial/an economic crisis<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>面临／陷入财政／经济危机</chn></und></li><li e_id="13cbabce420.5e25" e_inline="y" eid="economy_li_22"><und margined="n"> <eb>be caught in/experience</eb>  cycles of boom and bust<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>陷入／经历周期性繁荣与萧条</chn></und></li></ul><h2 e_id="13cbabce420.5e27" e_inline="y" eid="economy_h2_3" status="6" tranid="25">Public finance<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>公共财政</chn></h2><ul class="bullet" e_id="13cbabce420.5e28" eid="economy_ul_3"><li e_id="13cbabce420.5e29" e_inline="y" eid="economy_li_"><und margined="n"> <eb>cut/reduce/slash/increase/double</eb>  the defence/<label-g-blk>(<label-g><geo-blk><geo geo="usa"><q>especially</q> <xhtml:a href="helpg:us"><em>US</em></xhtml:a></geo></geo-blk></label-g>) </label-g-blk> defense/education/aid budget<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>削减／大幅削减／增加／加倍国防／教育／援助预算</chn></und></li><li e_id="13cbabce420.5e2d" e_inline="y" eid="economy_li_24"><und margined="n"> <eb>increase/boost/slash/cut</eb>  public spending<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>增加／大幅削减／削减公共支出</chn></und></li><li e_id="13cbabce420.5e2f" e_inline="y" eid="economy_li_25"><und margined="n"> <eb>increase/put up/raise/cut/lower/reduce</eb>  taxes<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>提高／降低税收</chn></und></li><li e_id="13cbabce420.5e31" e_inline="y" eid="economy_li_26"><und margined="n"> <eb>raise/cut/lower/reduce</eb>  interest rates<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>提高／降低利率</chn></und></li><li e_id="13cbabce420.5e33" e_inline="y" eid="economy_li_27"><und margined="n"> <eb>ease/loosen/tighten</eb>  monetary policy<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>放宽／收紧货币政策</chn></und></li><li e_id="13cbabce420.5e35" e_inline="y" eid="economy_li_28"><und margined="n"> <eb>balance</eb>  the (state/federal) budget<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>平衡（州／联邦）预算</chn></und></li><li e_id="13cbabce420.5e37" e_inline="y" eid="economy_li_29"><und margined="n"> <eb>achieve/maintain</eb>  a balanced budget<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>达到／保持预算平衡</chn></und></li><li e_id="13cbabce420.5e39" e_inline="y" eid="economy_li_30"><und margined="n"> <eb>run</eb>  a ($4 trillion) budget deficit/surplus<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>有（4 万亿美元的）预算赤字／盈余</chn></und></li></ul><xr-gs xt="collocat"><xrhead> <arrow>➡</arrow> <xrbold><b>collocations</b></xrbold> at</xrhead><xr-g-blk><xr-g> <xh><xhtml:a (at) second, third, etc. hand

(beat sb) black and blue

的主语常为 rain、wind、hail、sea 或 waves。</chn></und></un></li><li e_id="13cbabaa0af.-2c2f" e_inline="y" eid="beat_li_9"><unsyn>hammer</unsyn> <und margined="n">to hit sb/sth hard a lot of times, in a way eid="beat_h3_1" status="6" tranid="22">pound or hammer?<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>用 pound 还是 hammer？</chn></h3><ul class="bullet" e_id="13cbabaa0af.-2c29" eid="beat_ul_3"><li e_id="13cbabaa0af.-2c28" e_inline="y" eid="beat_li_10"><und margined="n">There is not much difference in meaning between these two, but to  <eb>pound</eb>  is sometimes a steadier action. To  <eb>hammer</eb>  can be more violent and it is often used figuratively.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>这两个词意思差别不大，但 pound 有时指较匀速而稳定地击打；hammer 更猛烈，且常用作比喻。</chn></und></li></ul><h3 e_id="13cbabaa0af.-2c25" e_inline="y" eid="beat_h3_2" status="1" tranid="34">Patterns</h3><ul class="bullet" e_id="13cbabaa0af.-2c24" eid="beat_ul_4"><li e_id="13cbabaa0af.-2c23" e_inline="y" eid="beat_li_11"><und margined="n">to beat/batter/pound/lash/hammer sb/sth  <eb>with</eb>  sth</und></li><li e_id="13cbabaa0af.-2c21" e_inline="y" eid="beat_li_12"><und margined="n">to beat/batter/pound/lash/hammer  <eb>against</eb>  sth</und></li><li e_id="13cbabaa0af.-2c1f" e_inline="y" eid="beat_li_13"><und margined="n">to beat/batter/pound/hammer  <eb>on</eb>  sth</und></li><li e_id="13cbabaa0af.-2c1d" e_inline="y" eid="beat_li_14"><und margined="n">to beat/batter/hammer sth  <eb>down</eb> </und></li><li e_id="13cbabaa0af.-2c1b" e_inline="y" eid="beat_li_15"><und margined="n">the  <eb>rain/wind/sea</eb>  beats/batters/pounds/lashes (at) sth</und></li></ul></body></unbox></sn-gs></idm-g><div class="seealso">See also <a href="entry://entry://beat">beat</a></div>

(be/get called) on the carpet

tranid="23" wd="The new publicity manager is really on the ball."><xhtml:a href="x:The">The</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="x:new">new</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="x:publicity">publicity</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a (be) under the impression that…
<head><link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="oalecd9.css" /><script src="oalecd9.js" charset="utf-8" type="text/javascript" language="javascript"></script></head><idm-g href="xi:that…">that…</xhtml:a></idm></idm-blk></top-g><sn-gs eid="impression_sngs_8"><sn-blk><sn-g eid="impression_sng_8" n=""><def neh="n" noblk="y"><xhtml:a href="d:believing">believing</xhtml:a>, <xhtml:a href="d:usually">usually</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:wrongly">wrongly</xhtml:a>, <xhtml:a href="d:that">that</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="help:sth">sth</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:is">is</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:true">true</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:or">or</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:is">is</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:happening">happening</xhtml:a><chnsep> </chnsep><chn><fthzmark></fthzmark>以为…；（通常指）误认为…</chn></def><x-gs eid="impression_xgs_7"><x-g-blk e_id="13cbabf24c9.-3559" eid="impression_xg_17"><xsymb><xhtml:a e_id="u4cdebea65f7df6b4.1f34c209.141c12ef5c9.32c7" eid="impression_x_17" status="6" tranid="31" wd="I was under the impression that the work had already been completed."><xhtml:a href="x:I">I</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="x:was">was</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="x:under">under</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="x:the">the</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="x:impression">impression</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a e_id="13cbac5155c.1512" eid="think_unbox_1" name="think" type="synonyms"><body e_id="13cbac5155c.1513" eid="think_body_1"><title e_id="13cbac5155c.1514" e_inline="y" eid="think_h1_1"><titled status="1" tranid="22">think</titled></title><inlinelist><und margined="n">believe</und> ◇ <und margined="n">feel</und> ◇ <und margined="n">reckon</und> ◇ <und margined="n">be under the impression</und></inlinelist><p e_id="13cbac5155c.151a" e_inline="y" eid="think_p_1"><und margined="n">These words all mean to have an idea that sth is true or possible or to have a particular opinion about sb/sth.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>以上各词均含以为、认为之义。</chn></und></p><ul class="deflist" e_id="13cbac5155c.151b" eid="think_ul_2"><li e_id="13cbac5155c.151c" e_inline="y" eid="think_li_5"><unsyn>think</unsyn> <und margined="n"> to have an idea that sth is true or possible, although you are not completely certain; to have a particular opinion about sb/sth<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>指认为、以为某人／某事…但不肯定</chn>：</und><x-gs e_id="13cbac5155c.151e" eid="think_xgs_33"><x-g-blk eid="think_xg_76"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x e_id="13cbac5155c.1520" e_inline="y" eid="think_x_76" status="6" tranid="5">Do you think (that) they'll come?<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>你认为他们会来吗？</chn></x></x-g-blk><x-g-blk eid="think_xg_77"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x e_id="13cbac5155c.1522" e_inline="y" eid="think_x_77" status="6" tranid="7">Well, I like it. What do you think?<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>嗯，我喜欢这个。你认为怎么样？</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li e_id="13cbac5155c.1523" e_inline="y" eid="think_li_6"><unsyn>believe</unsyn> <und margined="n"> to have an idea that sth is true or possible, although you are not completely certain; to have a particular opinion about sb/sth<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>指认为、以为</chn>：</und><x-gs e_id="13cbac5155c.1525" eid="think_xgs_34"><x-g-blk eid="think_xg_78"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x e_id="13cbac5155c.1527" e_inline="y" eid="think_x_78" status="6" tranid="9">Police believe (that) the man may be armed.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>警方认为那个人可能携有武器。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li></ul><h3 e_id="13cbac5155c.1528" e_inline="y" eid="think_h3_1" status="6" tranid="10">think or believe?<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>用 think 还是 believe？</chn></h3><p e_id="13cbac5155c.1529" e_inline="y" eid="think_p_2"><und margined="n">When you are expressing an idea that you have or that sb has of what is true or possible,  <eb>believe</eb>  is more formal than  <eb>think</eb>. It is used especially for talking about ideas that other people have;  <eb>think</eb>  is used more often for talking about your own ideas.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>表达自己或别人认为真实或有可能的想法时，believe 较 think 正式。believe 尤用于别人的想法；think 较常用于自己的想法</chn>：</und><x-gs e_id="13cbac5155c.152d" eid="think_xgs_35"><x-g-blk eid="think_xg_79"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x e_id="13cbac5155c.152f" e_inline="y" eid="think_x_79" status="6" tranid="12">Police believe…<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>警方认为…</chn></x></x-g-blk><x-g-blk eid="think_xg_80"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x e_id="13cbac5155c.1531" e_inline="y" eid="think_x_80" status="6" tranid="14">I think…<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>我认为…</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs><und margined="y"> When you are expressing an opinion,  <eb>believe</eb>  is stronger than  <eb>think</eb>  and is used especially for matters of principle;  <eb>think</eb>  is used more for practical matters or matters of personal taste.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>表达意见时，believe 语气较 think 强烈，尤用于原则性事情；think 多用于实际事情或个人喜好。</chn></und></p><ul class="deflist" e_id="13cbac5155c.1535" eid="think_ul_3"><li e_id="13cbac5155c.1536" e_inline="y" eid="think_li_7"><unsyn>feel</unsyn> <und margined="n"> to have a particular opinion about sth that has happened or about what you/sb ought to do<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>指认为（已发生的事情…）、相信（应该…）</chn>：</und><x-gs e_id="13cbac5155c.1538" eid="think_xgs_36"><x-g-blk eid="think_xg_81"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x e_id="13cbac5155c.153a" e_inline="y" eid="think_x_81" status="6" tranid="17">We all felt (that) we were unlucky to lose.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>我们都认为我们输了是运气不好。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li e_id="13cbac5155c.153b" e_inline="y" eid="think_li_8"><unsyn>reckon</unsyn> <und margined="n"><label-g-blk>(<label-g><reg-blk><reg reg="infml"><xhtml:a href="helpr:infml">informal</xhtml:a></reg></reg-blk></label-g>) </label-g-blk> to think that sth is true or possible<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>指认为、以为</chn>：</und><x-gs e_id="13cbac5155c.153e" eid="think_xgs_37"><x-g-blk eid="think_xg_82"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x e_id="13cbac5155c.1540" e_inline="y" eid="think_x_82" status="6" tranid="19">I reckon (that) I'm going to get that job.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>我认为我会得到那份工作。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li e_id="13cbac5155c.1541" e_inline="y" eid="think_li_9"><unsyn>be under the impression that…</unsyn> <und margined="n"> to have an idea that sth is true<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>指以为某事…</chn>：</und><x-gs e_id="13cbac5155c.1543" eid="think_xgs_38"><x-g-blk eid="think_xg_83"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x e_id="13cbac5155c.1545" e_inline="y" eid="think_x_83" status="6" tranid="21">I was under the impression that the work had already been completed.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>我还以为已经完工了呢。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li></ul><h3 e_id="13cbac5155c.1546" e_inline="y" eid="think_h3_2" status="1" tranid="27">Patterns</h3><ul class="bullet" e_id="13cbac5155c.1547" eid="think_ul_4"><li e_id="13cbac5155c.1548" e_inline="y" eid="think_li_10"><und margined="n">to think/believe/feel/reckon/be under the impression  <eb>that…</eb> </und></li><li e_id="13cbac5155c.154a" e_inline="y" eid="think_li_11"><und margined="n"> <eb>It is</eb>  thought/believed/reckoned  <eb>that…</eb> </und></li><li e_id="13cbac5155c.154d" e_inline="y" eid="think_li_12"><und margined="n">to  <eb>be</eb>  thought/believed/felt/reckoned  <eb>to (catch/throw sb) off balance
<head><link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="oalecd9.css" /><script src="oalecd9.js" charset="utf-8" type="text/javascript" language="javascript"></script></head><idm-g e_id="13cbabaa0af.-71ef" eid="balance_idmg_3"><top-g><idm-blk e_id="13cbabaa0af.-71ed" eid="balance_idm_3"><xsymb><xhtml:a href="addid:13cbabaa0af.-71ed">●</xhtml:a></xsymb><idm e_id="13cbabaa0af.-71ed" (close/near) at hand

staff/workers/employees redundant<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>裁员</chn></und></li></ul><h2 eid="unemployment_h2_2" e_id="13cbac587f0.31f6" e_inline="y" tranID="11" status="6">Being unemployed<chnsep> <head><link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="oalecd9.css" /><script src="oalecd9.js" charset="utf-8" type="text/javascript" language="javascript"></script></head><h-g eid="ant_hg_2"><top-g> <h e_id="13cbaba1a9a.-23e1">-ant</h><hcomma>, </hcomma> <h e_id="13cbaba1a9a.-23de">-ent</h><pos-g eid="ant_posg_2"> <pos-blk><pos><xhtml:a eid="ant_sng_3" n=""><use-blk noblk="y"> (<use><xhtml:a href="d:in">in</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:adjectives">adjectives</xhtml:a><chnsep> </chnsep><chn>构成形容词</chn></use>) </use-blk><def neh="n" </chnsep><chn><fthzmark></fthzmark>是…的；做…的</chn></def><x-gs eid="ant_xgs_2"><x-g-blk e_id="13cbaba1a9a.-23d3" eid="ant_xg_3"><xsymb><xhtml:a href="addexample:13cbaba1a9a.-23d3">◆</xhtml:a></xsymb><x e_id="13cbaba1a9a.-23d2" e_inline="y" eid="ant_x_3" status="6" tranid="3"><xhtml:a href="x:significant">significant</xhtml:a><xhtml:br></xhtml:br><chn><fthzmark></fthzmark>有意义的</chn></x></x-g-blk><x-g-blk e_id="13cbaba1a9a.-23d1" eid="ant_xg_4"><xsymb><xhtml:a href="addexample:13cbaba1a9a.-23d1">◆</xhtml:a></xsymb><x e_id="13cbaba1a9a.-23d0" e_inline="y" eid="ant_x_4" status="3" tranid="4"><xhtml:a href="x:different">different</xhtml:a><xhtml:br></xhtml:br><chn><fthzmark></fthzmark>不同的</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></sn-g></licontent></xhtml:li></xhtml:ol></sn-blk><sn-blk shcut="n"><xhtml:ol start="2"><xhtml:li><licontent><sn-g eid="ant_sng_4" n=""><use-blk noblk="y"> (<use><xhtml:a href="d:in">in</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:nouns">nouns</xhtml:a><chnsep> </chnsep><chn>构成名词</chn></use>) </use-blk><def neh="n" noblk="n"><xhtml:a href="d:a">a</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:person">person</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:or">or</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:thing">thing</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:that">that</xhtml:a><chnsep> </chnsep><chn><fthzmark></fthzmark>…人；…事物</chn></def><x-gs eid="ant_xgs_3"><x-g-blk e_id="13cbaba1a9a.-23cb" eid="ant_xg_5"><xsymb><xhtml:a href="addexample:13cbaba1a9a.-23cb">◆</xhtml:a></xsymb><x e_id="13cbaba1a9a.-23ca" e_inline="y" eid="ant_x_5" status="6" tranid="7"><xhtml:a href="x:inhabitant">inhabitant</xhtml:a><xhtml:br></xhtml:br><chn><fthzmark></fthzmark>居民</chn></x></x-g-blk><x-g-blk e_id="13cbaba1a9a.-23c9" eid="ant_xg_6"><xsymb><xhtml:a href="addexample:13cbaba1a9a.-23c9">◆</xhtml:a></xsymb><x e_id="13cbaba1a9a.-23c8" e_inline="y" eid="ant_x_6" status="3" tranid="8"><xhtml:a href="x:deterrent">deterrent</xhtml:a><xhtml:br></xhtml:br><chn><fthzmark></fthzmark>威慑因素</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></sn-g></licontent></xhtml:li></xhtml:ol></sn-blk><unbox type="which_word" Name="answer / reply" eid="answer_unbox_1" e_id="13cbaba1a9a.-2497"><body eid="answer_body_1" e_id="13cbaba1a9a.-2496"><title eid="answer_h1_1" e_id="13cbaba1a9a.-2495" e_inline="y"><titled tranID="22" status="1">answer / reply</titled></title><h2 eid="answer_h2_1" e_id="13cbaba1a9a.-2494" e_inline="y" tranID="2" status="6">Verbs<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>动词</chn></h2><ul eid="answer_ul_1" class="bullet" e_id="13cbaba1a9a.-2493"><li eid="answer_li_1" e_id="13cbaba1a9a.-2492" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>Answer</eb>  and  <eb>reply</eb>  are the most common verbs used for speaking or writing as a reaction to a question, letter, etc.<chnsep> * </chnsep><chn>answer 和 reply 为口语或书面语中表示回答问题、复信等最通用的动词。</chn></und></li><li eid="answer_li_2" e_id="13cbaba1a9a.-248f" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">Note that you  <eb>answer</eb>  a person, question or letter, not <ei eid="answer_ei_1" e_id="13cbaba1a9a.-248d">answer to</ei> them, but you  <eb>reply to</eb>  somebody or something.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>表示回答或回复时，answer 后不用 to，宾语可以是人，也可以是问题或信，而 reply 后要用 to</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="answer_xgs_15" e_id="13cbaba1a9a.-248b"><x-g-blk eid="answer_xg_42"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="answer_x_42" e_id="13cbaba1a9a.-2489" e_inline="y" tranID="5" status="6">I'm writing to answer your questions.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>特此函复贵方提问。</chn></x></x-g-blk><x-g-blk eid="answer_xg_43"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="answer_x_43" e_id="13cbaba1a9a.-2487" e_inline="y" tranID="7" status="6">I'm writing to reply to your questions.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>特此函复贵方提问。</chn></x></x-g-blk><x-g-blk eid="answer_xg_44"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><wx eid="answer_wx_1" e_id="13cbaba1a9a.-2485">I'm writing to answer to your questions.</wx></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li eid="answer_li_3" e_id="13cbaba1a9a.-2484" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>Answer</eb>  can be used with or without an object.<chnsep> * </chnsep><chn>answer 既可带宾语，也可不带宾语</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="answer_xgs_16" e_id="13cbaba1a9a.-2482"><x-g-blk eid="answer_xg_45"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="answer_x_44" e_id="13cbaba1a9a.-2480" e_inline="y" tranID="10" status="6">I haven't answered her email yet.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>我还没有回复她的电邮。</chn></x></x-g-blk><x-g-blk eid="answer_xg_46"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="answer_x_45" e_id="13cbaba1a9a.-247e" e_inline="y" tranID="12" status="6">I knocked on the door but nobody answered.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>我敲了门，但无人应答。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs><und margined="y">  <eb>Reply</eb>  is often used with the actual words spoken.<chnsep> * </chnsep><chn>reply 常带直接引语</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="answer_xgs_17" e_id="13cbaba1a9a.-247c"><x-g-blk eid="answer_xg_47"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="answer_x_46" e_id="13cbaba1a9a.-247a" e_inline="y" tranID="14" status="6">'I won't let you down,' he replied.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>“我不会让你失望的。” 他回答说。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li eid="answer_li_4" e_id="13cbaba1a9a.-2479" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>Respond</eb>  is less common and more formal.<chnsep> * </chnsep><chn>respond 较少用，且较正式</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="answer_xgs_18" e_id="13cbaba1a9a.-2477"><x-g-blk eid="answer_xg_48"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="answer_x_47" e_id="13cbaba1a9a.-2475" e_inline="y" tranID="16" status="6">The directors were unwilling to <ebi>respond to</ebi> questions.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>董事们不愿意回答问题。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li eid="answer_li_5" e_id="13cbaba1a9a.-2473" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">You can only  <eb>answer</eb>  a door or a phone.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>应门或接电话只能用 answer。</chn></und></li></ul><xr-gs xt="see"><xrhead><xhtml:a href="helpxr:see"> <arrow>➡</arrow>  see also</xhtml:a></xrhead><xr-g-blk><xr-g> <xh><xhtml:a href="xid:13cbac3027d.4670">rejoin</xhtml:a></xh><xhm e_id="u4cdebea65f7df6b4.22e47478.145b5220125.72bb">2</xhm></xr-g></xr-g-blk><xr-g-blk>, <xr-g> <xh><xhtml:a href="xid:13cbac3647b.-61c2">retort</xhtml:a></xh></xr-g></xr-g-blk><xr-g-blk>, <xr-g> <xh><xhtml:a href="xid:13cbabe3564.-295b">get back to sb</xhtml:a></xh></xr-g></xr-g-blk></xr-gs><h2 eid="answer_h2_2" e_id="13cbaba1a9a.-246a" e_inline="y" tranID="19" status="6">Nouns<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>名词</chn></h2><ul eid="answer_ul_2" class="bullet" e_id="13cbaba1a9a.-2469"><li eid="answer_li_6" e_id="13cbaba1a9a.-2468" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">Note the phrases  <eb>in answer to</eb>  and  <eb>in reply to</eb>.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>注意 in answer to 和 in reply to 的用法</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="answer_xgs_19" e_id="13cbaba1a9a.-2465"><x-g-blk eid="answer_xg_49"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="answer_x_48" e_id="13cbaba1a9a.-2463" e_inline="y" tranID="21" status="6">I'm writing in answer to your letter.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>特此函复。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li></ul><xr-gs xt="see"><xrhead><xhtml:a href="helpxr:see"> <arrow>➡</arrow>  see also</xhtml:a></xrhead><xr-g-blk><xr-g> <xh><xhtml:a href="xid:13cbac3647b.-733b">response</xhtml:a></xh></xr-g></xr-g-blk><xr-g-blk>, <xr-g> <xh><xhtml:a mean to go with sb from one place to another.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>以上各词均含带去、引领之义。</chn></und></p><ul eid="take_ul_2" class="deflist" e_id="13cbac5155c.-5d66"><li eid="take_li_9" e_id="13cbac5155c.-5d65" e_inline="y"><unsyn>take</unsyn> <und margined="n"> to go with sb from one place to another, for example in order to show them sth or to show them the way to a place<chnsep> eid="take_li_12" e_id="13cbac5155c.-5d56" e_inline="y"><unsyn>drive</unsyn> <und margined="n"> to take sb somewhere in a car, taxi, etc.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>指驾车送（人）</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="take_xgs_117" e_id="13cbac5155c.-5d54"><x-g-blk eid="take_xg_228"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="take_x_228" e_id="13cbac5155c.-5d52" e_inline="y" tranID="11" status="6">My mother drove us to the airport.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>我母亲开车把我们送到了机场。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li eid="take_li_13" e_id="13cbac5155c.-5d51" e_inline="y"><unsyn>show</unsyn> <und margined="n"> to take sb to a particular place, in the right direction, or along the correct route<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>指引领、带领</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="take_xgs_118" e_id="13cbac5155c.-5d4f"><x-g-blk eid="take_xg_229"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="take_x_229" e_id="13cbac5155c.-5d4d" e_inline="y" tranID="13" status="6">The attendant showed us to our seats.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>服务员把我们带到我们的座位。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li eid="take_li_14" e_id="13cbac5155c.-5d4c" e_inline="y"><unsyn>walk</unsyn> <und margined="n"> to go somewhere with sb on foot, especially in order to make sure that they get there safely; to take an animal, especially a dog, for a walk or make an animal walk somewhere<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>指陪伴或护送（人）走、牵着或赶着（动物）走、遛（狗）</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="take_xgs_119" e_id="13cbac5155c.-5d4a"><x-g-blk eid="take_xg_0"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="take_x_0" e_id="13cbac5155c.-5d48" e_inline="y" tranID="25" status="6">He always walked her home.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>他经常护送她走回家。</chn></x></x-g-blk><x-g-blk eid="take_xg_1"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="take_x_1" e_id="13cbac5155c.-5d46" e_inline="y" tranID="26" status="6">Have you walked the dog yet today?<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>你今天遛狗了吗？</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li eid="take_li_15" e_id="13cbac5155c.-5d45" e_inline="y"><unsyn>guide</unsyn> <und margined="n"> to show sb the way to a place, often by going with them; to show sb a place that you know well<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>指给某人领路（或导游）、指引</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="take_xgs_120" e_id="13cbac5155c.-5d43"><x-g-blk eid="take_xg_2"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="take_x_2" e_id="13cbac5155c.-5d41" e_inline="y" tranID="15" status="6">She guided us through the busy streets.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>她带领我们穿过了繁忙的街道。</chn></x></x-g-blk><x-g-blk eid="take_xg_3"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="take_x_3" e_id="13cbac5155c.-5d3f" e_inline="y" tranID="17" status="6">We were guided around the museums.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>我们被领着参观了博物馆。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li eid="take_li_16" e_id="13cbac5155c.-5d3e" e_inline="y"><unsyn>usher</unsyn> <und margined="n"> <label-g-blk>(<label-g><reg-blk><q>rather</q> <reg reg="fml"><xhtml:a href="helpr:fml">formal</xhtml:a></reg></reg-blk></label-g>) </label-g-blk> to politely take or show sb where they should go, especially within a building<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>指礼貌地引往、引导、引领，尤指在建筑物内</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="take_xgs_121" e_id="13cbac5155c.-5d3b"><x-g-blk eid="take_xg_4"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="take_x_4" e_id="13cbac5155c.-5d39" e_inline="y" tranID="19" status="6">She ushered her guests to their seats.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>她把客人引领到座位上。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li eid="take_li_17" e_id="13cbac5155c.-5d38" e_inline="y"><unsyn>direct</unsyn> <und margined="n"> <label-g-blk>(<label-g><reg-blk><q>rather</q> <reg reg="fml"><xhtml:a href="helpr:fml">formal</xhtml:a></reg></reg-blk></label-g>) </label-g-blk> to tell or show sb how to get somewhere or where to go<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>指给某人指路、为某人领路</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="take_xgs_122" e_id="13cbac5155c.-5d35"><x-g-blk eid="take_xg_5"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="take_x_5" e_id="13cbac5155c.-5d33" e_inline="y" tranID="21" status="6">A young woman directed them to the station.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>一名年轻女子给他们指了去车站的路。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li></ul><h3 eid="take_h3_1" e_id="13cbac5155c.-5d32" e_inline="y" tranID="36" status="1">Patterns</h3><ul eid="take_ul_3" class="bullet" e_id="13cbac5155c.-5d31"><li eid="take_li_18" e_id="13cbac5155c.-5d30" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">to take/lead/escort/drive/show/walk/guide/usher/direct sb  <eb>to/out of/into</eb>  sth</und></li><li eid="take_li_19" e_id="13cbac5155c.-5d2e" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">to take/lead/escort/drive/show/walk/guide sb  <eb>around/round</eb> </und></li><li eid="take_li_20" e_id="13cbac5155c.-5d2c" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">to take/lead/escort/drive/walk sb  <eb>home</eb> </und></li><li eid="take_li_21" e_id="13cbac5155c.-5d2a" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">to take/lead/escort/guide sb  <eb>to safety</eb> </und></li><li eid="take_li_22" e_id="13cbac5155c.-5d28" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">to lead/show  <eb>the way</eb> </und></li></ul></body></unbox></sn-gs></h-g>
</>
-esque
<head><link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="oalecd9.css" /><script src="oalecd9.js" charset="utf-8" type="text/javascript" language="javascript"></script></head><h-g eid="esque_hg_1"><top-g> <h e_id="13cbabd5a4a.-20bb">-esque</h><pos-g eid="esque_posg_1"> <pos-blk><pos><xhtml:a href="helpp:suff">suffix</xhtml:a></pos></pos-blk></pos-g><res-g eid="esque_resg_1"></res-g></top-g><sn-gs eid="esque_sngs_1"><sn-blk-nolist><sn-g eid="esque_sng_1"><use-blk noblk="y"> (<use><xhtml:a href="d:in">in</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:adjectives">adjectives</xhtml:a><chnsep> </chnsep><chn>构成形容词</chn></use>) </use-blk><def neh="n" noblk="n"><xhtml:a href="d:in">in</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:the">the</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:style">style</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:of">of</xhtml:a><chnsep> </chnsep><chn><fthzmark></fthzmark>…风格（或样式）的</chn></def><x-gs eid="esque_xgs_1"><x-g-blk e_id="13cbabd5a4a.-20ae" eid="esque_xg_1"><xsymb><xhtml:a href="addexample:13cbabd5a4a.-20ae">◆</xhtml:a></xsymb><x e_id="13cbabd5a4a.-20ad" e_inline="y" eid="esque_x_1" status="6" tranid="3"><xhtml:a href="x:statuesque">statuesque</xhtml:a><xhtml:br></xhtml:br><chn><fthzmark></fthzmark>雕像般的</chn></x></x-g-blk><x-g-blk e_id="13cbabd5a4a.-20ac" eid="esque_xg_2"><xsymb><xhtml:a href="addexample:13cbabd5a4a.-20ac">◆</xhtml:a></xsymb><x e_id="13cbabd5a4a.-20ab" e_inline="y" eid="esque_x_2" status="6" tranid="4"><xhtml:a href="x:Kafkaesque">Kafkaesque</xhtml:a><xhtml:br></xhtml:br><chn><fthzmark></fthzmark>卡夫卡风格的</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></sn-g></sn-blk-nolist><unbox type="which_word" Name="especially / specially" eid="especially_unbox_1" e_id="13cbabd5a4a.-2209"><body eid="especially_body_1" e_id="13cbabd5a4a.-2208"><title eid="especially_h1_1" e_id="13cbabd5a4a.-2207" e_inline="y"><titled tranID="17" status="1">especially / specially</titled></title><ul eid="especially_ul_1" class="bullet" e_id="13cbabd5a4a.-2206"><li eid="especially_li_1" e_id="13cbabd5a4a.-2205" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>Especially</eb>  usually means 'particularly'.<chnsep> * </chnsep><chn>especially 通常表示尤其、特别</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="especially_xgs_4" e_id="13cbabd5a4a.-2203"><x-g-blk eid="especially_xg_7"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="especially_x_7" e_id="13cbabd5a4a.-2201" e_inline="y" tranID="3" status="6">She loves all sports, especially swimming.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>她喜爱各种运动，尤其是游泳。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs><und margined="y"> It is not placed first in a sentence.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>该词不用于句首</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="especially_xgs_5" e_id="13cbabd5a4a.-2200"><x-g-blk eid="especially_xg_8"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="especially_x_8" e_id="13cbabd5a4a.-21fe" e_inline="y" tranID="5" status="6">I especially like sweet things.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>我特别喜欢吃甜食。</chn></x></x-g-blk><x-g-blk eid="especially_xg_9"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><wx eid="especially_wx_1" e_id="13cbabd5a4a.-21fc">Especially I like sweet things.</wx></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li eid="especially_li_2" e_id="13cbabd5a4a.-21fb" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>Specially</eb>  usually means 'for a particular purpose' and is often followed by a past participle, such as <ei eid="especially_ei_1" e_id="13cbabd5a4a.-21f9">designed</ei>, <ei eid="especially_ei_2" e_id="13cbabd5a4a.-21f8">developed</ei> or <ei eid="especially_ei_3" e_id="13cbabd5a4a.-21f7">made</ei>.<chnsep> * </chnsep><chn>specially 通常表示特意地、专门地，其后常接 designed、developed 或 made 等过去分词</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="especially_xgs_6" e_id="13cbabd5a4a.-21f6"><x-g-blk eid="especially_xg_10"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="especially_x_9" e_id="13cbabd5a4a.-21f4" e_inline="y" tranID="8" status="6">a course specially designed to meet your needs<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>为满足你们的需要专门开设的课程</chn></x></x-g-blk><x-g-blk eid="especially_xg_11"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="especially_x_10" e_id="13cbabd5a4a.-21f2" e_inline="y" tranID="10" status="3">She has her clothes specially made in Paris.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>她的衣服是特意在巴黎定做的。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li eid="especially_li_3" e_id="13cbabd5a4a.-21f1" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">In <label-g-blk><label-g><geo-blk><geo geo="br"><xhtml:a href="helpg:br"><brelabel>BrE</brelabel></xhtml:a></geo></geo-blk></label-g></label-g-blk>,  <eb>especially</eb>  and  <eb>specially</eb>  are often used in the same way and it can be hard to hear the difference when people speak.  <eb>Specially</eb>  is less formal.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>在英式英语中，especially 和 specially 常具有相同的用法，说话时很难听出其区别。specially 较非正式</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="especially_xgs_7" e_id="13cbabd5a4a.-21eb"><x-g-blk eid="especially_xg_12"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="especially_x_11" e_id="13cbabd5a4a.-21e9" e_inline="y" tranID="12" status="6">I bought this especially/specially for you.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>这是我特意为你买的。</chn></x></x-g-blk><x-g-blk eid="especially_xg_13"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="especially_x_12" e_id="13cbabd5a4a.-21e7" e_inline="y" tranID="14" status="6">It is especially/specially important to remember this.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>记住这一点尤为重要。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li eid="especially_li_4" e_id="13cbabd5a4a.-21e6" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">The adjective for both  <eb>especially</eb>  and  <eb>specially</eb>  is usually  <eb>special</eb>.<chnsep> * </chnsep><chn>especially 和 specially 的形容词通常为 special。</chn></und></li></ul></body></unbox></sn-gs></h-g>
</>
-ess
<head><link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="oalecd9.css" /><script src="oalecd9.js" charset="utf-8" type="text/javascript" language="javascript"></script></head><h-g eid="ess_hg_1"><top-g> <h e_id="13cbabd5a4a.-20a7">-ess</h><pos-g eid="ess_posg_1"> <pos-blk><pos><xhtml:a href="helpp:suff">suffix</xhtml:a></pos></pos-blk></pos-g><res-g eid="ess_resg_1"></res-g></top-g><sn-gs eid="ess_sngs_1"><sn-blk-nolist><sn-g eid="ess_sng_1"><use-blk noblk="y"> (<use><xhtml:a href="d:in">in</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:nouns">nouns</xhtml:a><chnsep> </chnsep><chn>构成名词</chn></use>) </use-blk><def neh="n" noblk="n"><xhtml:a href="d:female">female</xhtml:a><chnsep> </chnsep><chn><fthzmark></fthzmark>女…；雌…；母…</chn></def><x-gs eid="ess_xgs_1"><x-g-blk e_id="13cbabd5a4a.-209a" eid="ess_xg_1"><xsymb><xhtml:a href="addexample:13cbabd5a4a.-209a">◆</xhtml:a></xsymb><x e_id="13cbabd5a4a.-2099" e_inline="y" eid="ess_x_1" status="6" tranid="3"><xhtml:a href="x:lioness">lioness</xhtml:a><xhtml:br></xhtml:br><chn><fthzmark></fthzmark>母狮子</chn></x></x-g-blk><x-g-blk e_id="13cbabd5a4a.-2098" eid="ess_xg_2"><xsymb><xhtml:a href="addexample:13cbabd5a4a.-2098">◆</xhtml:a></xsymb><x e_id="13cbabd5a4a.-2097" e_inline="y" eid="ess_x_2" status="6" tranid="4"><xhtml:a href="x:actress">actress</xhtml:a><xhtml:br></xhtml:br><chn><fthzmark></fthzmark>女演员</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs><unbox type="more_about" Name="gender" eid="gender_unbox_1" e_id="13cbabe3564.-3df0"><body eid="gender_body_1" e_id="13cbabe3564.-3def"><title eid="gender_h1_1" e_id="13cbabe3564.-3dee" e_inline="y"><titled tranID="36" status="2">gender<chnsep> </chnsep><chn/></titled></title><h2 eid="gender_h2_1" e_id="13cbabe3564.-3ded" e_inline="y" tranID="2" status="6">Ways of talking about men and women<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>表示男女的说法</chn></h2><ul eid="gender_ul_1" class="bullet" e_id="13cbabe3564.-3dec"><li eid="gender_li_1" e_id="13cbabe3564.-3deb" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">When you are writing or speaking English it is important to use language that includes both men and women equally. Some people may be very offended if you do not.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>说写英语时，重要的是用词要把男女都包括在内，否则可能会冒犯某些人。</chn></und></li></ul><h2 eid="gender_h2_2" e_id="13cbabe3564.-3dea" e_inline="y" tranID="4" status="6">The human race<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>人类</chn></h2><ul eid="gender_ul_2" class="bullet" e_id="13cbabe3564.-3de9"><li eid="gender_li_2" e_id="13cbabe3564.-3de8" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>Man</eb>  and  <eb>mankind</eb>  have traditionally been used to mean 'all men and women'. Many people now prefer to use  <eb>humanity</eb>,  <eb>the human race</eb>,  <eb>human beings</eb>  or  <eb>people</eb>.<chnsep> * </chnsep><chn>man 和 mankind 传统上用以指所有男性和女性，不过，现在许多人喜欢用 humanity、the human race、human beings 或 people。</chn></und></li></ul><h2 eid="gender_h2_3" e_id="13cbabe3564.-3de1" e_inline="y" tranID="6" status="6">Jobs<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>职业</chn></h2><ul eid="gender_ul_3" class="bullet" e_id="13cbabe3564.-3de0"><li eid="gender_li_3" e_id="13cbabe3564.-3ddf" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">The suffix  <eb>-ess</eb>  in names of occupations such as  <eb>actress</eb>,  <eb>hostess</eb>  and  <eb>waitress</eb>  shows that the person doing the job is a woman. Many people now avoid these. Instead you can use  <eb>actor</eb>  or  <eb>host</eb>  (although  <eb>actress</eb>  and  <eb>hostess</eb>  are still very common), or a neutral word, such as  <eb>server</eb>  for <ei eid="gender_ei_1" e_id="13cbabe3564.-3dd5">waiter</ei> and <ei eid="gender_ei_2" e_id="13cbabe3564.-3dd4">waitress</ei>.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>后缀 -ess 在职业的名称如 actress、hostess 和 waitress 中表明从事此职业的是女性。目前，许多人避免用这些词。取而代之的是 actor 或 host（尽管 actress 和 hostess 仍然很常见）或用中性词如 server 取代 waiter 和 waitress。</chn></und></li><li eid="gender_li_4" e_id="13cbabe3564.-3dd3" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">Neutral words like  <eb>assistant</eb>,  <eb>worker</eb>,  <eb>person</eb>  or  <eb>officer</eb>  are now often used instead of <ei eid="gender_ei_3" e_id="13cbabe3564.-3dce">-man</ei> or <ei eid="gender_ei_4" e_id="13cbabe3564.-3dcd">-woman</ei> in the names of jobs. For example, you can use  <eb>police officer</eb>  instead of <ei eid="gender_ei_5" e_id="13cbabe3564.-3dcb">policeman</ei> or <ei eid="gender_ei_6" e_id="13cbabe3564.-3dca">policewoman</ei>, and  <eb>spokesperson</eb>  instead of <ei eid="gender_ei_7" e_id="13cbabe3564.-3dc8">spokesman</ei> or <ei eid="gender_ei_8" e_id="13cbabe3564.-3dc7">spokeswoman</ei>. Neutral words are very common in newspapers, on television and radio and in official writing, in both <label-g-blk><label-g><geo-blk><geo geo="br"><xhtml:a href="helpg:br"><brelabel>BrE</brelabel></xhtml:a></geo></geo-blk></label-g> </label-g-blk> and <label-g-blk><label-g><geo-blk><geo geo="n_am"><xhtml:a href="helpg:am"><namelabel>NAmE</namelabel></xhtml:a></geo></geo-blk></label-g></label-g-blk>.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>现在职业名称常用中性词如 assistant、worker、person 或 officer 取代 -man 或 -woman。例如可用 police officer 代替 policeman 或 policewoman，用 spokesperson 代替 spokesman 或 spokeswoman。在报刊、电视、广播和公文中，英式英语和美式英语都常用中性词。</chn></und></li><li eid="gender_li_5" e_id="13cbabe3564.-3dc2" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">When talking about jobs that are traditionally done by the other sex, some people say:  <eb>a male secretary</eb> / <eb>nurse</eb> / <eb>model</eb>  (NOT  <eb>man</eb>) or  <eb>a woman</eb> / <eb>female</eb>   <eb>doctor</eb> / <eb>barrister</eb> / <eb>driver</eb>. However this is now not usually used unless you need to emphasize which sex the person is, or it is still unusual for the job to be done by a man/woman.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>谈及传统上由另一性别干的工作时，有人用 male secretary/nurse/model（不用 man）或 woman/female doctor/barrister/driver 表示。不过现在这种用法不常见，除非要强调此人的性别，或由某性别干此工作仍然少见</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="gender_xgs_3" e_id="13cbabe3564.-3db8"><x-g-blk eid="gender_xg_5"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="gender_x_5" e_id="13cbabe3564.-3db6" e_inline="y" tranID="10" status="6">My daughter prefers to see a woman doctor.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>我的女儿喜欢让女医生看病。</chn></x></x-g-blk><x-g-blk eid="gender_xg_6"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="gender_x_6" e_id="13cbabe3564.-3db4" e_inline="y" tranID="12" status="6">They have a male nanny for their kids.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>他们有个男保姆照料孩子。</chn></x></x-g-blk><x-g-blk eid="gender_xg_7"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="gender_x_7" e_id="13cbabe3564.-3db2" e_inline="y" tranID="14" status="6">a female racing driver<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>女赛车手</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li></ul><h2 eid="gender_h2_4" e_id="13cbabe3564.-3db1" e_inline="y" tranID="15" status="6">Pronouns<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>代词</chn></h2><ul eid="gender_ul_4" class="bullet" e_id="13cbabe3564.-3db0"><li eid="gender_li_6" e_id="13cbabe3564.-3daf" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>He</eb>  used to be considered to cover both men and women.<chnsep> * </chnsep><chn>he 过去被认为既指男性也指女性</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="gender_xgs_4" e_id="13cbabe3564.-3dad"><x-g-blk eid="gender_xg_8"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="gender_x_8" e_id="13cbabe3564.-3dab" e_inline="y" tranID="17" status="6">Everyone needs to feel he is loved.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>人人都需要有被爱的感觉。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs><und margined="y">This is not now acceptable. Instead, after  <eb>everybody</eb>,  <eb>everyone</eb>,  <eb>anybody</eb>,  <eb>anyone</eb>,  <eb>somebody</eb>,  <eb>someone</eb>, etc. one of the plural pronouns  <eb>they</eb>,  <eb>them</eb>, and  <eb>their</eb>  is often used.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>现在此用法不获认同。取而代之的是在 everybody、everyone、anybody、anyone、somebody、someone 等之后常用复数代词 they、them 和 their</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="gender_xgs_5" e_id="13cbabe3564.-3da1"><x-g-blk eid="gender_xg_9"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="gender_x_9" e_id="13cbabe3564.-3d9f" e_inline="y" tranID="19" status="6">Does everybody know what they want?<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>人人都知道自己需要什么吗？</chn></x></x-g-blk><x-g-blk eid="gender_xg_10"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="gender_x_10" e_id="13cbabe3564.-3d9d" e_inline="y" tranID="21" status="6">Somebody's left their coat here.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>有人把外衣落在这儿了。</chn></x></x-g-blk><x-g-blk eid="gender_xg_11"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="gender_x_11" e_id="13cbabe3564.-3d9b" e_inline="y" tranID="23" status="6">I hope nobody's forgotten to bring their passport with them.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>希望没人忘了随身带上护照。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li eid="gender_li_7" e_id="13cbabe3564.-3d9a" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">Some people prefer to use  <eb>he or she</eb>,  <eb>his or her</eb>, or  <eb>him or her</eb>  in speech and writing.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>有人在口语和书面语中喜欢用 he or she、his or her 或 him or her</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="gender_xgs_6" e_id="13cbabe3564.-3d96"><x-g-blk eid="gender_xg_12"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="gender_x_12" e_id="13cbabe3564.-3d94" e_inline="y" tranID="25" status="6">Everyone knows what's best for him- or herself.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>人人都知道对自己来说什么是最好的。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs><und margined="y"> <eb>He/she</eb>  or  <eb>(s)he</eb>  can also be used in writing.<chnsep> * </chnsep><chn>he/she 或 (s)he 亦可用于书面语中</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="gender_xgs_7" e_id="13cbabe3564.-3d91"><x-g-blk eid="gender_xg_13"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="gender_x_13" e_id="13cbabe3564.-3d8f" e_inline="y" tranID="27" status="6">If in doubt, ask your doctor. He/she can give you more information.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>如有疑问请向你的医生咨询，他／她会给你更多的信息。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs><und margined="y">(You may find that some writers just use 'she'.)<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>有些人只用 she。</chn>：</und><und margined="y">These uses can seem awkward when they are used a lot. It is better to try to change the sentence, using a plural noun.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>这种说法用得太多可能显得别扭。最好尽量改动句子，用复数名词。</chn>：</und><und margined="y">Instead of saying<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>避免说</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="gender_xgs_8" e_id="13cbabe3564.-3d8e"><x-g-blk eid="gender_xg_14"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="gender_x_14" e_id="13cbabe3564.-3d8c" e_inline="y" tranID="29" status="6">A baby cries when he or she is tired<chnsep> </chnsep><chn/></x></x-g-blk></x-gs><und margined="y">you can say<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>可以说</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="gender_xgs_9" e_id="13cbabe3564.-3d8b"><x-g-blk eid="gender_xg_15"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="gender_x_15" e_id="13cbabe3564.-3d89" e_inline="y" tranID="31" status="6">Babies cry when they are tired.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>婴儿疲倦时会哭。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li></ul></body></unbox></sn-g></sn-blk-nolist><unbox type="more_about" Name="gender" eid="gender_unbox_1" e_id="13cbabe3564.-3df0"><body eid="gender_body_1" e_id="13cbabe3564.-3def"><title eid="gender_h1_1" e_id="13cbabe3564.-3dee" e_inline="y"><titled tranID="36" status="2">gender<chnsep> </chnsep><chn/></titled></title><h2 eid="gender_h2_1" e_id="13cbabe3564.-3ded" e_inline="y" tranID="2" status="6">Ways of talking about men and women<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>表示男女的说法</chn></h2><ul eid="gender_ul_1" class="bullet" e_id="13cbabe3564.-3dec"><li eid="gender_li_1" e_id="13cbabe3564.-3deb" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">When you are writing or speaking English it is important to use language that includes both men and women equally. Some people may be very offended if you do not.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>说写英语时，重要的是用词要把男女都包括在内，否则可能会冒犯某些人。</chn></und></li></ul><h2 eid="gender_h2_2" e_id="13cbabe3564.-3dea" e_inline="y" tranID="4" status="6">The human race<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>人类</chn></h2><ul eid="gender_ul_2" class="bullet" e_id="13cbabe3564.-3de9"><li eid="gender_li_2" e_id="13cbabe3564.-3de8" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>Man</eb>  and  <eb>mankind</eb>  have traditionally been used to mean 'all men and women'. Many people now prefer to use  <eb>humanity</eb>,  <eb>the human race</eb>,  <eb>human beings</eb>  or  <eb>people</eb>.<chnsep> * </chnsep><chn>man 和 mankind 传统上用以指所有男性和女性，不过，现在许多人喜欢用 humanity、the human race、human beings 或 people。</chn></und></li></ul><h2 eid="gender_h2_3" e_id="13cbabe3564.-3de1" e_inline="y" tranID="6" status="6">Jobs<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>职业</chn></h2><ul eid="gender_ul_3" class="bullet" e_id="13cbabe3564.-3de0"><li eid="gender_li_3" e_id="13cbabe3564.-3ddf" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">The suffix  <eb>-ess</eb>  in names of occupations such as  <eb>actress</eb>,  <eb>hostess</eb>  and  <eb>waitress</eb>  shows that the person doing the job is a woman. Many people now avoid these. Instead you can use  <eb>actor</eb>  or  <eb>host</eb>  (although  <eb>actress</eb>  and  <eb>hostess</eb>  are still very common), or a neutral word, such as  <eb>server</eb>  for <ei eid="gender_ei_1" e_id="13cbabe3564.-3dd5">waiter</ei> and <ei eid="gender_ei_2" e_id="13cbabe3564.-3dd4">waitress</ei>.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>后缀 -ess 在职业的名称如 actress、hostess 和 waitress 中表明从事此职业的是女性。目前，许多人避免用这些词。取而代之的是 actor 或 host（尽管 actress 和 hostess 仍然很常见）或用中性词如 server 取代 waiter 和 waitress。</chn></und></li><li eid="gender_li_4" e_id="13cbabe3564.-3dd3" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">Neutral words like  <eb>assistant</eb>,  <eb>worker</eb>,  <eb>person</eb>  or  <eb>officer</eb>  are now often used instead of <ei eid="gender_ei_3" e_id="13cbabe3564.-3dce">-man</ei> or <ei eid="gender_ei_4" e_id="13cbabe3564.-3dcd">-woman</ei> in the names of jobs. For example, you can use  <eb>police officer</eb>  instead of <ei eid="gender_ei_5" e_id="13cbabe3564.-3dcb">policeman</ei> or <ei eid="gender_ei_6" e_id="13cbabe3564.-3dca">policewoman</ei>, and  <eb>spokesperson</eb>  instead of <ei eid="gender_ei_7" e_id="13cbabe3564.-3dc8">spokesman</ei> or <ei eid="gender_ei_8" e_id="13cbabe3564.-3dc7">spokeswoman</ei>. Neutral words are very common in newspapers, on television and radio and in official writing, in both <label-g-blk><label-g><geo-blk><geo geo="br"><xhtml:a href="helpg:br"><brelabel>BrE</brelabel></xhtml:a></geo></geo-blk></label-g> </label-g-blk> and <label-g-blk><label-g><geo-blk><geo geo="n_am"><xhtml:a href="helpg:am"><namelabel>NAmE</namelabel></xhtml:a></geo></geo-blk></label-g></label-g-blk>.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>现在职业名称常用中性词如 assistant、worker、person 或 officer 取代 -man 或 -woman。例如可用 police officer 代替 policeman 或 policewoman，用 spokesperson 代替 spokesman 或 spokeswoman。在报刊、电视、广播和公文中，英式英语和美式英语都常用中性词。</chn></und></li><li eid="gender_li_5" e_id="13cbabe3564.-3dc2" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">When talking about jobs that are traditionally done by the other sex, some people say:  <eb>a male secretary</eb> / <eb>nurse</eb> / <eb>model</eb>  (NOT  <eb>man</eb>) or  <eb>a woman</eb> / <eb>female</eb>   <eb>doctor</eb> / <eb>barrister</eb> / <eb>driver</eb>. However this is now not usually used unless you need to emphasize which sex the person is, or it is still unusual for the job to be done by a man/woman.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>谈及传统上由另一性别干的工作时，有人用 male secretary/nurse/model（不用 man）或 woman/female doctor/barrister/driver 表示。不过现在这种用法不常见，除非要强调此人的性别，或由某性别干此工作仍然少见</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="gender_xgs_3" e_id="13cbabe3564.-3db8"><x-g-blk eid="gender_xg_5"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="gender_x_5" e_id="13cbabe3564.-3db6" e_inline="y" tranID="10" status="6">My daughter prefers to see a woman doctor.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>我的女儿喜欢让女医生看病。</chn></x></x-g-blk><x-g-blk eid="gender_xg_6"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="gender_x_6" e_id="13cbabe3564.-3db4" e_inline="y" tranID="12" status="6">They have a male nanny for their kids.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>他们有个男保姆照料孩子。</chn></x></x-g-blk><x-g-blk eid="gender_xg_7"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="gender_x_7" e_id="13cbabe3564.-3db2" e_inline="y" tranID="14" status="6">a female racing driver<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>女赛车手</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li></ul><h2 eid="gender_h2_4" e_id="13cbabe3564.-3db1" e_inline="y" tranID="15" status="6">Pronouns<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>代词</chn></h2><ul eid="gender_ul_4" class="bullet" e_id="13cbabe3564.-3db0"><li eid="gender_li_6" e_id="13cbabe3564.-3daf" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>He</eb>  used to be considered to cover both men and women.<chnsep> * </chnsep><chn>he 过去被认为既指男性也指女性</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="gender_xgs_4" e_id="13cbabe3564.-3dad"><x-g-blk eid="gender_xg_8"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="gender_x_8" e_id="13cbabe3564.-3dab" e_inline="y" tranID="17" status="6">Everyone needs to feel he is loved.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>人人都需要有被爱的感觉。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs><und margined="y">This is not now acceptable. Instead, after  <eb>everybody</eb>,  <eb>everyone</eb>,  <eb>anybody</eb>,  <eb>anyone</eb>,  <eb>somebody</eb>,  <eb>someone</eb>, etc. one of the plural pronouns  <eb>they</eb>,  <eb>them</eb>, and  <eb>their</eb>  is often used.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>现在此用法不获认同。取而代之的是在 everybody、everyone、anybody、anyone、somebody、someone 等之后常用复数代词 they、them 和 their</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="gender_xgs_5" e_id="13cbabe3564.-3da1"><x-g-blk eid="gender_xg_9"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="gender_x_9" e_id="13cbabe3564.-3d9f" e_inline="y" tranID="19" status="6">Does everybody know what they want?<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>人人都知道自己需要什么吗？</chn></x></x-g-blk><x-g-blk eid="gender_xg_10"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="gender_x_10" e_id="13cbabe3564.-3d9d" e_inline="y" tranID="21" status="6">Somebody's left their coat here.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>有人把外衣落在这儿了。</chn></x></x-g-blk><x-g-blk eid="gender_xg_11"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="gender_x_11" e_id="13cbabe3564.-3d9b" e_inline="y" tranID="23" status="6">I hope nobody's forgotten to bring their passport with them.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>希望没人忘了随身带上护照。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li eid="gender_li_7" e_id="13cbabe3564.-3d9a" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">Some people prefer to use  <eb>he or she</eb>,  <eb>his or her</eb>, or  <eb>him or her</eb>  in speech and writing.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>有人在口语和书面语中喜欢用 he or she、his or her 或 him or her</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="gender_xgs_6" e_id="13cbabe3564.-3d96"><x-g-blk eid="gender_xg_12"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="gender_x_12" e_id="13cbabe3564.-3d94" e_inline="y" tranID="25" status="6">Everyone knows what's best for him- or herself.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>人人都知道对自己来说什么是最好的。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs><und margined="y"> <eb>He/she</eb>  or  <eb>(s)he</eb>  can also be used in writing.<chnsep> * </chnsep><chn>he/she 或 status="6">If in doubt, ask your doctor. He/she can give you more information.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>如有疑问请向你的医生咨询，他／她会给你更多的信息。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs><und margined="y">(You may find that some writers just use 'she'.)<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>有些人只用 she。</chn>：</und><und margined="y">These uses can seem awkward when they are used a lot. It is better to try to change the sentence, using a plural noun.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>这种说法用得太多可能显得别扭。最好尽量改动句子，用复数名词。</chn>：</und><und margined="y">Instead of saying<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>避免说</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="gender_xgs_8" e_id="13cbabe3564.-3d8e"><x-g-blk eid="gender_xg_14"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="gender_x_14" e_id="13cbabe3564.-3d8c" e_inline="y" tranID="29" status="6">A baby cries when he or she is tired<chnsep> </chnsep><chn/></x></x-g-blk></x-gs><und margined="y">you can say<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>可以说</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="gender_xgs_9" e_id="13cbabe3564.-3d8b"><x-g-blk eid="gender_xg_15"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="gender_x_15" e_id="13cbabe3564.-3d89" e_inline="y" tranID="31" status="6">Babies cry when they are tired.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>婴儿疲倦时会哭。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li></ul></body></unbox></sn-gs></h-g>

-est

-ette

(find, etc.) a/the middle way

-fold
<head><link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="oalecd9.css" /><script src="oalecd9.js" charset="utf-8" type="text/javascript" language="javascript"></script></head><h-g eid="fold_hg_2"><top-g> <h e_id="13cbac60ff3.1ba9"><body eid="weather_body_1" e_id="13cbac60ff3.1baa"><title eid="weather_h1_1" e_id="13cbac60ff3.1bab" e_inline="y"><titled tranID="39" status="2">The weather<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>天气</chn></titled></title><h2 eid="weather_h2_1" e_id="13cbac60ff3.1bac" e_inline="y" tranID="1" status="6">Good weather<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>好天气</chn></h2><ul eid="weather_ul_1" class="bullet" e_id="13cbac60ff3.1bad"><li eid="weather_li_1" e_id="13cbac60ff3.1bae" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>be bathed in/bask in/be blessed with/enjoy</eb>  bright/brilliant/glorious sunshine<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>沐浴着／享受着明媚的／灿烂的阳光</chn></und></li><li eid="weather_li_2" e_id="13cbac60ff3.1bb0" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">the sun  <eb>shines/warms sth/beats down (on sth)</eb> <chnsep> </chnsep><chn>太阳照耀着／温暖着／照射在…</chn></und></li><li eid="weather_li_3" e_id="13cbac60ff3.1bb2" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">the sunshine  <eb> breaks/streams through sth</eb> <chnsep> </chnsep><chn>阳光穿过…</chn></und></li><li eid="weather_li_4" e_id="13cbac60ff3.1bb4" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">fluffy/wispy clouds  <eb>drift across the sky</eb> <chnsep> </chnsep><chn>绒毛般的／一缕缕云彩在空中飘过</chn></und></li><li eid="weather_li_5" e_id="13cbac60ff3.1bb6" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">a gentle/light/stiff/cool/warm/sea breeze  <eb>blows in/comes in off the sea</eb> <chnsep> </chnsep><chn>微风／轻风／强风／凉爽的风／暖风／海风从海上吹来</chn></und></li><li eid="weather_li_6" e_id="13cbac60ff3.1bb8" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">the snow  <eb>crunches beneath/under sb's feet/boots</eb> <chnsep> </chnsep><chn>积雪在…脚下／靴子下嘎吱作响</chn></und></li></ul><h2 eid="weather_h2_2" e_id="13cbac60ff3.1bba" e_inline="y" tranID="8" status="6">Bad weather<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>坏天气</chn></h2><ul eid="weather_ul_2" class="bullet" e_id="13cbac60ff3.1bbb"><li eid="weather_li_7" e_id="13cbac60ff3.1bbc" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">thick/dark/storm clouds  <eb> margined="n">the sky  <eb>darkens/turns black</eb> <chnsep> </chnsep><chn>天空变暗／变黑</chn></und></li><li eid="weather_li_9" e_id="13cbac60ff3.1bc0" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">a fine mist  <eb> hangs in the air</eb> <chnsep> </chnsep><chn>一丝薄雾弥漫在空气中</chn></und></li><li eid="weather_li_10" e_id="13cbac60ff3.1bc2" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">a dense/heavy/thick fog  <eb>rolls in</eb> <chnsep> </chnsep><chn>浓雾滚滚而来</chn></und></li><li eid="weather_li_11" e_id="13cbac60ff3.1bc4" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">the rain  <eb>falls/comes down (in buckets/sheets)/pours down</eb> <chnsep> <eb>forecast/expect/predict</eb>  rain/snow/a category-four hurricane<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>预报有雨／雪／四级飓风</chn></und></li><li eid="weather_li_21" e_id="13cbac60ff3.1bd8" e_inline="y"><und <label-g-blk>(<label-g><geo-blk><geo geo="br"><xhtml:a href="helpg:br"><brelabel>BrE</brelabel></xhtml:a></geo></geo-blk></label-g>) </label-g-blk>  <eb>pour (down) with</eb>  rain<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>笼罩在雾霭之中／厚厚的一层雾中</chn></und></li><li eid="weather_li_24" e_id="13cbac60ff3.1be3" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>be in for/brave/shelter from</eb>  a/the storm<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>即将遇到／勇敢面对／躲避暴风雨</chn></und></li><li eid="weather_li_25" e_id="13cbac60ff3.1be5" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>hear</eb>  rolling/distant thunder<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>听到隆隆的／远处的雷声</chn></und></li><li eid="weather_li_26" e_id="13cbac60ff3.1be7" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>be battered/buffeted by</eb>  strong winds<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>遭受强风肆虐；被强风吹得左右摇摆</chn></und></li><li eid="weather_li_27" e_id="13cbac60ff3.1be9" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"><label-g-blk>(<label-g><geo-blk><geo geo="br"><xhtml:a href="helpg:br"><brelabel>BrE</brelabel></xhtml:a></geo></geo-blk></label-g>) </label-g-blk>  <eb>be blowing</eb>  a gale<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>在刮大风</chn></und></li><li eid="weather_li_28" e_id="13cbac60ff3.1bed" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>battle against/brave</eb>  the elements<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>与恶劣天气搏斗；冒着风雨</chn></und></li></ul><h2 eid="weather_h2_3" e_id="13cbac60ff3.1bef" e_inline="y" tranID="31" status="6">The weather improves<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>天气好转</chn></h2><ul eid="weather_ul_3" class="bullet" e_id="13cbac60ff3.1bf0"><li eid="weather_li_29" e_id="13cbac60ff3.1bf1" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">the sun  <eb>breaks through the clouds</eb> <chnsep> </chnsep><chn>太阳破云而出</chn></und></li><li eid="weather_li_30" e_id="13cbac60ff3.1bf3" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">the sky  <eb>clears/brightens (up)/lightens (up)</eb> <chnsep> </chnsep><chn>天放晴了</chn></und></li><li eid="weather_li_31" e_id="13cbac60ff3.1bf5" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">the clouds  <eb>part/clear</eb> <chnsep> </chnsep><chn>乌云散去</chn></und></li><li eid="weather_li_32" e_id="13cbac60ff3.1bf7" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">the rain  <eb>stops/lets up/holds off</eb> <chnsep> </chnsep><chn>雨停了／小了／延迟了</chn></und></li><li eid="weather_li_33" e_id="13cbac60ff3.1bf9" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">the wind  <eb>dies down</eb> <chnsep> </chnsep><chn>风逐渐平息</chn></und></li><li eid="weather_li_34" e_id="13cbac60ff3.1bfb" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">the storm  <eb>passes</eb> <chnsep> </chnsep><chn>暴风雨过去了</chn></und></li><li eid="weather_li_35" e_id="13cbac60ff3.1bfd" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">the mist/fog  <eb>lifts/clears</eb> <chnsep> </chnsep><chn>薄雾／雾消散了</chn></und></li></ul></body></unbox></sn-gs></h-g>
</>

<head><link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="oalecd9.css" /><script src="oalecd9.js" charset="utf-8" type="text/javascript" language="javascript"></script></head><h-g eid="ify_hg_1"><top-g> <h e_id="13cbabf24c9.-5ce2">-ify</h><hcomma>, </hcomma> <h e_id="13cbabf24c9.-5cdf">-fy</h><pos-g eid="ify_posg_1"> <pos-blk><pos><xhtml:a href="helpp:suff">suffix</xhtml:a></pos></pos-blk></pos-g></top-g><sn-gs eid="ify_sngs_1"><sn-blk-nolist><sn-g eid="ify_sng_1"><use-blk noblk="y"> (<use><xhtml:a href="d:in">in</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a eid="ify_xg_1"><xsymb><xhtml:a href="addexample:13cbabf24c9.-5cd7">◆</xhtml:a></xsymb><x e_id="13cbabf24c9.-5cd6" e_inline="y" eid="ify_x_1" status="6" tranid="3"><xhtml:a href="x:solidify">solidify</xhtml:a><xhtml:br></xhtml:br><chn><fthzmark></fthzmark>使凝固</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></sn-g></sn-blk-nolist><unbox type="grammar" Name="if / whether" eid="if_unbox_1" e_id="13cbabf24c9.-5d43"><body eid="if_body_1" e_id="13cbabf24c9.-5d42"><title eid="if_h1_1" e_id="13cbabf24c9.-5d41" e_inline="y"><titled tranID="8" status="1">if / whether</titled></title><ul eid="if_ul_1" class="bullet" e_id="13cbabf24c9.-5d40"><li eid="if_li_1" e_id="13cbabf24c9.-5d3f" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">Both  <eb>if</eb>  and  <eb>whether</eb>  are used in reporting questions which expect 'yes' or 'no' as the answer<chnsep> * </chnsep><chn>if 和 whether 均用于要求以 yes 或 no 作答的转述疑问句中</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="if_xgs_19" e_id="13cbabf24c9.-5d3c"><x-g-blk eid="if_xg_46"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="if_x_46" e_id="13cbabf24c9.-5d3a" e_inline="y" tranID="7" status="6">She asked if/whether I wanted a drink.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>她问我要不要喝点什么。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs><und margined="y"> although  <eb>whether</eb>  sounds more natural with particular verbs such as  <eb>discuss</eb>,  <eb>consider</eb>  and  <eb>decide</eb>. When a choice is offered between alternatives,  <eb>if</eb>  or  <eb>whether</eb>  can be used.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>不过 whether 与 discuss、consider 和 decide 等动词连用听起来更自然。提供选择时用 if 或 whether 均可</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="if_xgs_20" e_id="13cbabf24c9.-5d33"><x-g-blk eid="if_xg_47"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="if_x_47" e_id="13cbabf24c9.-5d31" e_inline="y" tranID="5" status="6">We didn't know if/whether we should write or phone.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>我们不知道是写信好还是打电话好。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs><und margined="y"> In this last type of sentence,  <eb>whether</eb>  is usually considered more formal and more suitable for written English.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>在最后这一句型中，一般认为 whether 较正式，更适用于书面语。</chn></und></li></ul></body></unbox></sn-gs></h-g>
</>
'gator
@@@LINK=gator
</>
'-gene
@@@LINK=gene
</>
'-genes
@@@LINK=gene
</>
'-genies
@@@LINK=genie
</>

(has the) cat got your tongue?

</>
-head

(he, she, etc. has) been and done sth

Name="pleasure" eid="pleasure_unbox_1" e_id="13cbac21463.7141"><body eid="pleasure_body_1" e_id="13cbac21463.7142"><title eid="pleasure_h1_1" e_id="13cbac21463.7143" e_inline="y"><titled tranID="22" status="1">pleasure</titled></title><inlinelist><und margined="n">delight</und> ◇ <und margined="n">joy</und> ◇ <und margined="n">privilege</und> ◇ <und margined="n">treat</und> ◇ <und margined="n">honour</und></inlinelist><p eid="pleasure_p_1" e_id="13cbac21463.714a" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">These are all words for things that make you happy or bring you enjoyment.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>以上各词均指令人愉快、高兴的事。</chn></und></p><ul eid="pleasure_ul_2" class="deflist" e_id="13cbac21463.714b"><li eid="pleasure_li_6" e_id="13cbac21463.714c" e_inline="y"><unsyn>pleasure</unsyn> <und margined="n"> a thing that brings you enjoyment or satisfaction<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>指乐事、快事</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="pleasure_xgs_6" e_id="13cbac21463.714e"><x-g-blk eid="pleasure_xg_17"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="pleasure_x_17" e_id="13cbac21463.7150" e_inline="y" tranID="5" status="6">the pleasures and pains of everyday life<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>日常生活的苦与乐</chn></x></x-g-blk><x-g-blk eid="pleasure_xg_18"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="pleasure_x_18" e_id="13cbac21463.7152" e_inline="y" tranID="7" status="6"> <ebi>It's been a pleasure</ebi> meeting you.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>很高兴认识您。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li eid="pleasure_li_7" e_id="13cbac21463.7154" e_inline="y"><unsyn>delight</unsyn> <und margined="n"> a thing or person that brings you great enjoyment or satisfaction<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>指令人高兴的事或人、乐事、乐趣</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="pleasure_xgs_7" e_id="13cbac21463.7156"><x-g-blk eid="pleasure_xg_19"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="pleasure_x_19" e_id="13cbac21463.7158" e_inline="y" tranID="9" status="6">the delights of living in the country<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>生活在乡村的乐趣</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li eid="pleasure_li_8" e_id="13cbac21463.7159" e_inline="y"><unsyn>joy</unsyn> <und margined="n"> a thing or person that brings you great enjoyment or happiness<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>指令人高兴的事或人、乐事、乐趣</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="pleasure_xgs_8" e_id="13cbac21463.715b"><x-g-blk eid="pleasure_xg_20"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="pleasure_x_20" e_id="13cbac21463.715d" e_inline="y" tranID="11" status="6">the joys and sorrows of childhood<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>童年的欢乐与悲伤</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li></ul><h3 eid="pleasure_h3_1" e_id="13cbac21463.715e" e_inline="y" tranID="12" status="6">pleasure, delight or joy?<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>用 pleasure、delight 还是 joy？</chn></h3><p eid="pleasure_p_2" e_id="13cbac21463.715f" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">A  <eb>delight</eb>  or  <eb>joy</eb>  is greater than a  <eb>pleasure</eb>; a person, especially a child, can be a  <eb>delight</eb>  or  <eb>joy</eb>, but not a  <eb>pleasure</eb>;  <eb>joys</eb>  are often contrasted with  <eb>sorrows</eb>, but  <eb>delights</eb>  are not.<chnsep> * </chnsep><chn>delight 和 joy 语气较 pleasure 强。令人高兴的人，尤其是孩子，可以是一种 delight 或 joy，但不能是一种 pleasure。joys 常与 sorrows 形成对比，但 delights 无这种对比。</chn></und></p><ul eid="pleasure_ul_3" class="deflist" e_id="13cbac21463.7169"><li eid="pleasure_li_9" e_id="13cbac21463.716a" e_inline="y"><unsyn>privilege</unsyn> <und margined="n"> <label-g-blk>(<label-g><reg-blk><q>rather</q> <reg reg="fml"><xhtml:a href="helpr:fml">formal</xhtml:a></reg></reg-blk></label-g>) </label-g-blk> something that you are proud and lucky to have the opportunity to do<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>指荣幸、荣耀、光荣</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="pleasure_xgs_9" e_id="13cbac21463.716d"><x-g-blk eid="pleasure_xg_21"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="pleasure_x_21" e_id="13cbac21463.716f" e_inline="y" tranID="19" status="6">It was a great privilege to hear her sing.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>听她唱歌是莫大的荣幸。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li eid="pleasure_li_10" e_id="13cbac21463.7170" e_inline="y"><unsyn>treat</unsyn> <und margined="n"><label-g-blk>(<label-g><reg-blk><reg reg="infml"><xhtml:a href="helpr:infml">informal</xhtml:a></reg></reg-blk></label-g>) </label-g-blk> a thing that sb enjoyed or is likely to enjoy very much<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>指乐事、乐趣</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="pleasure_xgs_10" e_id="13cbac21463.7173"><x-g-blk eid="pleasure_xg_22"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="pleasure_x_22" e_id="13cbac21463.7175" e_inline="y" tranID="15" status="6">You've never been to this area before? Then you're <ebi>in for a </ebi> real <ebi>treat</ebi>.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>你以前从来没有到过这一地区？那么你一定会喜之不尽。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li eid="pleasure_li_11" e_id="13cbac21463.7178" e_inline="y"><unsyn>honour/honor</unsyn> <und margined="n"><label-g-blk>(<label-g><reg-blk><reg reg="fml"><xhtml:a href="helpr:fml">formal</xhtml:a></reg></reg-blk></label-g>) </label-g-blk> something that you are very pleased or proud to do because people are showing you great respect<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>指荣幸、光荣</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="pleasure_xgs_11" e_id="13cbac21463.717b"><x-g-blk eid="pleasure_xg_"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="pleasure_x_" e_id="13cbac21463.717d" e_inline="y" tranID="21" status="6">It was a great honour to be invited here today.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>今天承蒙邀请到此，深感荣幸。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li></ul><h3 eid="pleasure_h3_2" e_id="13cbac21463.717e" e_inline="y" tranID="28" status="1">Patterns</h3><ul eid="pleasure_ul_4" class="bullet" e_id="13cbac21463.717f"><li eid="pleasure_li_12" e_id="13cbac21463.7180" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">the pleasures/delights/joys  <eb>of</eb>  sth</und></li><li eid="pleasure_li_13"
