manage" eid="can_hm1_unbox_2" e_id="13cbabb1a08.41ba"><body eid="can_hm1_body_2" e_id="13cbabb1a08.41bb"><title eid="can_hm1_h1_2" e_id="13cbabb1a08.41bc" e_inline="y"><titled tranID="28" status="1">can / could / be able to / manage</titled></title><ul eid="can_hm1_ul_2" class="bullet" e_id="13cbabb1a08.41bd"><li eid="can_hm1_li_3" e_id="13cbabb1a08.41be" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>Can</eb>  is used to say that somebody knows how to do something.<chnsep> * </chnsep><chn>can 表示懂得做</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="can_hm1_xgs_17" e_id="13cbabb1a08.41c0"><x-g-blk eid="can_hm1_xg_38"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="can_hm1_x_38" e_id="13cbabb1a08.41c2" e_inline="y" tranID="3" status="6">Can you play the piano?<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>你会弹钢琴吗？</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs><und margined="y"> It is also used with verbs of seeing, noticing, etc.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>该词亦与表示看见、注意到等的动词连用</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="can_hm1_xgs_18" e_id="13cbabb1a08.41c3"><x-g-blk eid="can_hm1_xg_39"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="can_hm1_x_39" e_id="13cbabb1a08.41c5" e_inline="y" tranID="5" status="6">I can hear someone calling.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>我听见有人在呼叫。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs><und margined="y">and with passive infinitives.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>并与不定式的被动形式连用</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="can_hm1_xgs_19" e_id="13cbabb1a08.41c6"><x-g-blk eid="can_hm1_xg_40"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="can_hm1_x_40" e_id="13cbabb1a08.41c8" e_inline="y" tranID="29" status="3">The podcast can be downloaded here.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>播客可在此下载。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li eid="can_hm1_li_4" e_id="13cbabb1a08.41c9" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>Can</eb>  or  <eb>be able to</eb>  are used to say that something is possible or that somebody has the opportunity to do something.<chnsep> * </chnsep><chn>can 或 be able to 表示某事情有可能或某人有机会做某事</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="can_hm1_xgs_20" e_id="13cbabb1a08.41cc"><x-g-blk eid="can_hm1_xg_41"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="can_hm1_x_41" e_id="13cbabb1a08.41ce" e_inline="y" tranID="9" status="6">Can you/are you able to come on Saturday?<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>你星期六能来吗？</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li eid="can_hm1_li_5" e_id="13cbabb1a08.41cf" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">You use  <eb>be able to</eb>  to form the future and perfect tenses and the infinitive.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>用 be able to 构成将来时、完成时和动词不定式</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="can_hm1_xgs_21" e_id="13cbabb1a08.41d1"><x-g-blk eid="can_hm1_xg_42"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="can_hm1_x_42" e_id="13cbabb1a08.41d3" e_inline="y" tranID="11" status="6">You'll be able to get a taxi outside the station.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>在车站外可搭乘出租车。</chn></x></x-g-blk><x-g-blk eid="can_hm1_xg_43"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="can_hm1_x_43" e_id="13cbabb1a08.41d5" e_inline="y" tranID="13" status="6">I haven't been able to get much work done today.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>我今天未能干多少工作。</chn></x></x-g-blk><x-g-blk eid="can_hm1_xg_44"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="can_hm1_x_44" e_id="13cbabb1a08.41d7" e_inline="y" tranID="15" status="6">She'd love to be able to play the piano.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>她很希望能弹钢琴。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li eid="can_hm1_li_6" e_id="13cbabb1a08.41d8" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>Could</eb>  is used to talk about what someone was generally able to do in the past.<chnsep> * </chnsep><chn>could 表示过去通常能做</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="can_hm1_xgs_22" e_id="13cbabb1a08.41da"><x-g-blk eid="can_hm1_xg_45"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="can_hm1_x_45" e_id="13cbabb1a08.41dc" e_inline="y" tranID="17" status="6">Our daughter could walk when she was nine months old.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>我们的女儿九个月大就会走路了。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li eid="can_hm1_li_7" e_id="13cbabb1a08.41dd" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">You use  <eb>was/were able to</eb>  or  <eb>manage</eb>  (but not  <eb>could</eb>) when you are saying that something was possible on a particular occasion in the past.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>关于在过去特定情况下可能的事用 was/were able to 或 manage，但不用 could</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="can_hm1_xgs_" e_id="13cbabb1a08.41e1"><x-g-blk eid="can_hm1_xg_46"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="can_hm1_x_46" e_id="13cbabb1a08.41e3" e_inline="y" tranID="19" status="6">I was able to/managed to find some useful books in the library.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>我总算在图书馆找到了一些有用的书。</chn></x></x-g-blk><x-g-blk eid="can_hm1_xg_47"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><wx eid="can_hm1_wx_1" e_id="13cbabb1a08.41e5">I could find some useful books in the library.</wx></x-g-blk></x-gs><und margined="y"> In negative sentences,  <eb>could not</eb>  can also be used.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>否定句也可用 could not</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="can_hm1_xgs_24" e_id="13cbabb1a08.41e7"><x-g-blk eid="can_hm1_xg_48"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="can_hm1_x_47" e_id="13cbabb1a08.41e9" e_inline="y" tranID="22" status="6">We weren't able to/didn't manage to/couldn't get there in time.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>我们未能及时赶到那儿。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs><und margined="y">  <eb>Could</eb>  is also used with this meaning with verbs of seeing, noticing, understanding, etc.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>亦可用 could 加表示看见、注意到、明白等的动词表示此义</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="can_hm1_xgs_25" e_id="13cbabb1a08.41eb"><x-g-blk eid="can_hm1_xg_49"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="can_hm1_x_48" e_id="13cbabb1a08.41ed" e_inline="y" tranID="24" status="6">I could see there was something wrong.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>我发觉出事了。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li eid="can_hm1_li_8" e_id="13cbabb1a08.41ee" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>Could have</eb>  is used when you are saying that it was possible for somebody to do something in the past but they did not try.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>表示过去有可能做某事但没有做，用 could have</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="can_hm1_xgs_26" e_id="13cbabb1a08.41f0"><x-g-blk eid="can_hm1_xg_50"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="can_hm1_x_49" e_id="13cbabb1a08.41f2" e_inline="y" tranID="26" status="6">I could have won the game but decided to let her win.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>我本可以赢得那场比赛，但还是决定让她赢了。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li></ul></body></unbox></sn-gs></dr-g></dr-g-blk></dr-gs></h-g>
</>
-ible
<head><link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="oalecd9.css" /><script src="oalecd9.js" charset="utf-8" type="text/javascript" language="javascript"></script></head><h-g eid="ible_hg_1"><top-g> <h e_id="13cbabf24c9.-6ca1">-ible</h><hcomma>, </hcomma> <h e_id="13cbabf24c9.-6c9e">-ibly</h></top-g><sn-gs eid="ible_sngs_1"></sn-gs></h-g>

<head><link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="oalecd9.css" /><script src="oalecd9.js" charset="utf-8" type="text/javascript" language="javascript"></script></head><h-g eid="ible_hg_1"><top-g> <h e_id="13cbabf24c9.-6ca1">-ible</h><hcomma>, </hcomma> <h e_id="13cbabf24c9.-6c9e">-ibly</h></top-g><sn-gs eid="ible_sngs_1"></sn-gs></h-g>

-ic

e_id="13cbabf24c9.-6c6e">-ic</h><pos-g eid="ic_posg_1"> <pos-blk><pos><xhtml:a href="helpp:suff">suffix</xhtml:a></pos></pos-blk></pos-g><res-g eid="ic_resg_1"></res-g></top-g><sn-gs eid="ic_sngs_1"><sn-blk shcut="n"><xhtml:ol start="1"><xhtml:li><licontent><sn-g eid="ic_sng_1" n=""><use-blk noblk="y"> (<use><xhtml:a href="d:in">in</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a <head><link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="oalecd9.css" /><script src="oalecd9.js" charset="utf-8" type="text/javascript" language="javascript"></script></head><h-g eid="ics_hg_1"><top-g> <h e_id="13cbabf24c9.-6782">-ics</h><pos-g eid="ics_posg_1"> <pos-blk><pos><xhtml:a href="helpp:suff">suffix</xhtml:a></pos></pos-blk></pos-g><res-g eid="ics_resg_1"></res-g></top-g><sn-gs eid="ics_sngs_1"><sn-blk-nolist><sn-g eid="ics_sng_1"><use-blk noblk="y"> (<use><xhtml:a href="d:in">in</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:nouns">nouns</xhtml:a><chnsep> </chnsep><chn>构成名词</chn></use>) </use-blk><def neh="n" noblk="n"><xhtml:a href="d:the">the</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:science">science</xhtml:a>, <xhtml:a href="d:art">art</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:or">or</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:activity">activity</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:of">of</xhtml:a><chnsep> </chnsep><chn><fthzmark></fthzmark>…的科学（或艺术、活动）</chn></def><x-gs eid="ics_xgs_1"><x-g-blk e_id="13cbabf24c9.-6775" eid="ics_xg_1"><xsymb><xhtml:a href="addexample:13cbabf24c9.-6775">◆</xhtml:a></xsymb><x e_id="13cbabf24c9.-6774" e_inline="y" eid="ics_x_1" status="6" tranid="3"><xhtml:a href="x:physics">physics</xhtml:a><xhtml:br></xhtml:br><chn><fthzmark></fthzmark>物理学</chn></x></x-g-blk><x-g-blk e_id="13cbabf24c9.-6773" eid="ics_xg_2"><xsymb><xhtml:a href="addexample:13cbabf24c9.-6773">◆</xhtml:a></xsymb><x e_id="13cbabf24c9.-6772" e_inline="y" eid="ics_x_2" status="3" tranid="4"><xhtml:a href="x:poetics">poetics</xhtml:a><xhtml:br></xhtml:br><chn><fthzmark></fthzmark>诗学</chn></x></x-g-blk><x-g-blk e_id="13cbabf24c9.-6771" eid="ics_xg_3"><xsymb><xhtml:a href="addexample:13cbabf24c9.-6771">◆</xhtml:a></xsymb><x e_id="13cbabf24c9.-6770" e_inline="y" eid="ics_x_3" status="6" tranid="5"><xhtml:a href="x:athletics">athletics</xhtml:a><xhtml:br></xhtml:br><chn><fthzmark></fthzmark>田径运动</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></sn-g></sn-blk-nolist></sn-gs></h-g>

-ide
<head><link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="oalecd9.css" /><script src="oalecd9.js" charset="utf-8" type="text/javascript" language="javascript"></script></head><h-g eid="ide_hg_1"><top-g> <h e_id="13cbabf24c9.-6657">-ide</h><pos-g eid="ide_posg_1"> <pos-blk><pos><xhtml:a href="helpp:suff">suffix</xhtml:a></pos></pos-blk></pos-g><res-g eid="ide_resg_1"></res-g><label-g-blk> (<label-g><subj-blk><subj e_id="13cbabf24c9.-664e" subj="chem">chemistry<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>化学</chn></subj></subj-blk></label-g>) </label-g-blk></top-g><sn-gs eid="ide_sngs_1"><sn-blk-nolist><sn-g eid="ide_sng_1"><use-blk noblk="y"> (<use><xhtml:a href="d:in">in</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:nouns">nouns</xhtml:a><chnsep> </chnsep><chn>构成名词</chn></use>) </use-blk><def neh="n" noblk="n"><xhtml:a href="d:a">a</xhtml:a> <xr-gs firstinblock="n" xt="ndv"><xrlabel> </xrlabel><xr-g-blk><xr-g e_targeteltid="13cbabc0139.-5b2a"><xh-blk><xh><a href="entry://entry://compound">compound</a></xh></xh-blk></xr-g></xr-g-blk> </xr-gs> <xhtml:a href="d:of">of</xhtml:a><chnsep> </chnsep><chn><fthzmark></fthzmark>…化合物</chn></def><x-gs eid="ide_xgs_1"><x-g-blk e_id="13cbabf24c9.-6645" eid="ide_xg_1"><xsymb><xhtml:a href="addexample:13cbabf24c9.-6645">◆</xhtml:a></xsymb><x e_id="13cbabf24c9.-6644" e_inline="y" eid="ide_x_1" status="6" tranid="3"><xhtml:a href="x:chloride">chloride</xhtml:a><xhtml:br></xhtml:br><chn><fthzmark></fthzmark>氯化物</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></sn-g></sn-blk-nolist></sn-gs></h-g>

-ie
<head><link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="oalecd9.css" /><script src="oalecd9.js" charset="utf-8" type="text/javascript" language="javascript"></script></head><h-g eid="ie_hg_2"><top-g> <h e_id="13cbabf24c9.-5e44">-ie</h></top-g><sn-gs eid="ie_sngs_2"><sn-blk-nolist><sn-g eid="ie_sng_2"><xr-gs firstinblock="y" xt="defat"><xrlabel>  <arrow>➡</arrow>  </xrlabel><xr-g-blk><xr-g e_targeteltid="13cbac68492.-4a89"><xh-blk><xh><a href="entry://entry://-y">-y</a></xh></xh-blk></xr-g></xr-g-blk> </xr-gs></sn-g></sn-blk-nolist></sn-gs></h-g>

-ify
<head><link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="oalecd9.css" /><script src="oalecd9.js" charset="utf-8" type="text/javascript" language="javascript"></script></head><h-g eid="ify_hg_1"><top-g> <h e_id="13cbabf24c9.-5ce2">-ify</h><hcomma>, </hcomma> <h e_id="13cbabf24c9.-5cdf">-fy</h><pos-g eid="ify_posg_1"> <pos-blk><pos><xhtml:a href="helpp:suff">suffix</xhtml:a></pos></pos-blk></pos-g></top-g><sn-gs eid="ify_sngs_1"><sn-blk-nolist><sn-g eid="ify_sng_1"><use-blk noblk="y"> (<use><xhtml:a href="d:in">in</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:verbs">verbs</xhtml:a><chnsep> </chnsep><chn>构成动词</chn></use>) </use-blk><def neh="n" noblk="n"><xhtml:a href="d:to">to</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:make">make</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:or">or</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:become">become</xhtml:a><chnsep> </chnsep><chn><fthzmark></fthzmark>使得；变成</chn></def><x-gs eid="ify_xgs_1"><x-g-blk e_id="13cbabf24c9.-5cd7" eid="ify_xg_1"><xsymb><xhtml:a href="addexample:13cbabf24c9.-5cd7">◆</xhtml:a></xsymb><x e_id="13cbabf24c9.-5cd6" e_inline="y" eid="ify_x_1" status="6" tranid="3"><xhtml:a href="x:purify">purify</xhtml:a><xhtml:br></xhtml:br><chn><fthzmark></fthzmark>净化</chn></x></x-g-blk><x-g-blk e_id="13cbabf24c9.-5cd5" eid="ify_xg_2"><xsymb><xhtml:a href="addexample:13cbabf24c9.-5cd5">◆</xhtml:a></xsymb><x e_id="13cbabf24c9.-5cd4" e_inline="y" eid="ify_x_2" status="6" tranid="4"><xhtml:a href="x:solidify">solidify</xhtml:a><xhtml:br></xhtml:br><chn><fthzmark></fthzmark>使凝固</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></sn-g></sn-blk-nolist><unbox type="grammar" Name="if / whether" eid="if_unbox_1" e_id="13cbabf24c9.-5d43"><body eid="if_body_1" e_id="13cbabf24c9.-5d42"><title eid="if_h1_1" e_id="13cbabf24c9.-5d41" e_inline="y"><titled tranID="8" status="1">if / whether</titled></title><ul eid="if_ul_1" class="bullet" e_id="13cbabf24c9.-5d40"><li eid="if_li_1" e_id="13cbabf24c9.-5d3f" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">Both  <eb>if</eb>  and  <eb>whether</eb>  are used in reporting questions which expect 'yes' or 'no' as the answer<chnsep> * </chnsep><chn>if 和 whether 均用于要求以 yes 或 no 作答的转述疑问句中</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="if_xgs_19" e_id="13cbabf24c9.-5d3c"><x-g-blk eid="if_xg_46"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="if_x_46" e_id="13cbabf24c9.-5d3a" e_inline="y" tranID="7" status="6">She asked if/whether I wanted a drink.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>她问我要不要喝点什么。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs><und margined="y"> although  <eb>whether</eb>  sounds more natural with particular verbs such as  <eb>discuss</eb>,  <eb>consider</eb>  and  <eb>decide</eb>. When a choice is offered between alternatives,  <eb>if</eb>  or  <eb>whether</eb>  can be used.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>不过 whether 与 discuss、consider 和 decide 等动词连用听起来更自然。提供选择时用 if 或 whether 均可</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="if_xgs_20" e_id="13cbabf24c9.-5d33"><x-g-blk eid="if_xg_47"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="if_x_47" e_id="13cbabf24c9.-5d31" e_inline="y" tranID="5" status="6">We didn't know if/whether we should write or phone.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>我们不知道是写信好还是打电话好。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs><und margined="y"> In this last type of sentence,  <eb>whether</eb>  is usually considered more formal and more suitable for written English.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>在最后这一句型中，一般认为 whether 较正式，更适用于书面语。</chn></und></li></ul></body></unbox></sn-gs></h-g>
</>
(I'll) be seeing you

-ing
<head><link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="oalecd9.css" /><script src="oalecd9.js" charset="utf-8" type="text/javascript" language="javascript"></script></head><h-g eid="ing_hg_1"><top-g> <h e_id="13cbabf24c9.f2d">-ing</h><pos-g eid="ing_posg_1"> <pos-blk><pos><xhtml:a href="helpp:suff">suffix</xhtml:a></pos></pos-blk></pos-g></top-g><sn-gs eid="ing_sngs_1"><sn-blk-nolist><sn-g eid="ing_sng_1"><def neh="n" noblk="y"><xhtml:a href="d:used">used</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:to">to</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:make">make</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:the">the</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:present">present</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:participle">participle</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:of">of</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:regular">regular</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:verbs">verbs</xhtml:a><chnsep> </chnsep><chn><fthzmark></fthzmark>（用以构成规则动词的现在分词）</chn></def><x-gs eid="ing_xgs_1"><x-g-blk e_id="13cbabf24c9.f36" eid="ing_xg_1"><xsymb><xhtml:a href="addexample:13cbabf24c9.f36">◆</xhtml:a></xsymb><x e_id="13cbabf24c9.f37" eid="ing_x_1" status="6" tranid="2"><xhtml:a href="x:hating">hating</xhtml:a><xhtml:br></xhtml:br><chn><fthzmark></fthzmark>憎恨</chn></x></x-g-blk><x-g-blk e_id="13cbabf24c9.f38" eid="ing_xg_2"><xsymb><xhtml:a href="addexample:13cbabf24c9.f38">◆</xhtml:a></xsymb><x e_id="13cbabf24c9.f39" eid="ing_x_2" status="6" tranid="3"><xhtml:a href="x:walking">walking</xhtml:a><xhtml:br></xhtml:br><chn><fthzmark></fthzmark>步行</chn></x></x-g-blk><x-g-blk e_id="13cbabf24c9.f3a" eid="ing_xg_3"><xsymb><xhtml:a href="addexample:13cbabf24c9.f3a">◆</xhtml:a></xsymb><x e_id="13cbabf24c9.f3b" eid="ing_x_3" status="6" tranid="4"><xhtml:a href="x:loving">loving</xhtml:a><xhtml:br></xhtml:br><chn><fthzmark></fthzmark>爱</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></sn-g></sn-blk-nolist></sn-gs></h-g>

(in) midstream

-isation

(it) does (exactly) what it says on the tin

red and painful, for example because of an infection or because the skin has been damaged<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>指（身体部位）红肿疼痛的、破损的、擦伤的</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="painful_xgs_6" e_id="13cbac16e46.721e"><x-g-blk eid="painful_xg_13"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="painful_x_13" e_id="13cbac16e46.7220" e_inline="y" tranID="15" status="6">The skin on her feet had been rubbed raw.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>她脚上的皮磨破了。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li eid="painful_li_10" e_id="13cbac16e46.7221" e_inline="y"><unsyn>inflamed</unsyn> <und margined="n"> (of a part of the body) painful, red and hot because of an infection or injury<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>指（身体部位）发炎的、红肿的</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="painful_xgs_7" e_id="13cbac16e46.7223"><x-g-blk eid="painful_xg_14"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="painful_x_14" e_id="13cbac16e46.7225" e_inline="y" tranID="23" status="6">The wound had become inflamed.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>伤口发炎了。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li eid="painful_li_11" e_id="13cbac16e46.7226" e_inline="y"><unsyn>excruciating</unsyn> <und margined="n"> extremely painful<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>指极痛苦的、极苦恼的</chn></und><un un="note" e_id="13cbac16e46.7228"> <boxtag>NOTE</boxtag> <und margined="n"> <eb>Excruciating</eb>  can describe feelings, treatments or death but not parts of the body.<chnsep> * </chnsep><chn>excruciating 可用于描述情感、治疗或死亡，而非身体部位</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="painful_xgs_8" e_id="13cbac16e46.722a"><x-g-blk eid="painful_xg_15"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><wx eid="painful_wx_1" e_id="13cbac16e46.722c">an excruciating throat/back/knee</wx></x-g-blk></x-gs><und margined="y"/></un></li><li eid="painful_li_12" e_id="13cbac16e46.722d" e_inline="y"><unsyn>burning</unsyn> <und margined="n"> painful and giving a feeling of being very hot<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>指火辣辣地痛的</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="painful_xgs_9" e_id="13cbac16e46.722f"><x-g-blk eid="painful_xg_16"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="painful_x_15" e_id="13cbac16e46.7231" e_inline="y" tranID="19" status="6">She felt a burning sensation in her throat.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>她感到咽喉火辣辣的疼。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li eid="painful_li_13" e_id="13cbac16e46.7232" e_inline="y"><unsyn>itchy</unsyn> <und margined="n"> giving an uncomfortable feeling on your skin that makes you want to scratch; having this feeling<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>指发痒的</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="painful_xgs_10" e_id="13cbac16e46.7234"><x-g-blk eid="painful_xg_17"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="painful_x_16" e_id="13cbac16e46.7236" e_inline="y" tranID="26" status="6">an itchy rash<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>发痒的皮疹</chn></x></x-g-blk><x-g-blk eid="painful_xg_18"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="painful_x_17" e_id="13cbac16e46.7238" e_inline="y" tranID="28" status="6">I feel itchy all over.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>我觉得浑身发痒。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li></ul><h3 eid="painful_h3_1" e_id="13cbac16e46.7239" e_inline="y" tranID="40" status="1">Patterns</h3><ul eid="painful_ul_3" class="bullet" e_id="13cbac16e46.723a"><li eid="painful_li_14" e_id="13cbac16e46.723b" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">sore/inflamed/itchy  <eb>eyes</eb> </und></li><li eid="painful_li_15" e_id="13cbac16e46.723d" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">raw/inflamed/itchy  <eb>skin</eb> </und></li><li eid="painful_li_16" e_id="13cbac16e46.723f" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">a painful/an excruciating  <eb>death</eb> </und></li><li eid="painful_li_17" e_id="13cbac16e46.7241" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">a painful/burning  <eb>sensation</eb> </und></li><li eid="painful_li_18" e_id="13cbac16e46.7243" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">excruciating/burning  <eb>pain</eb> </und></li></ul></body></unbox></sn-gs></h-g>
</>
-ition
<head><link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="oalecd9.css" /><script src="oalecd9.js" charset="utf-8" type="text/javascript" language="javascript"></script></head><h-g eid="ition_hg_1"><top-g> <h e_id="13cbabf24c9.7bcc">-ition</h></top-g><sn-gs eid="ition_sngs_1"><sn-blk-nolist><sn-g eid="ition_sng_1"><xr-gs firstinblock="y" xt="defat"><xrlabel>  <arrow>➡</arrow>  </xrlabel><xr-g-blk><xr-g e_targeteltid="13cbabf24c9.687e"><xh-blk><xh><a href="entry://entry://-ion">-ion</a></xh></xh-blk></xr-g></xr-g-blk> </xr-gs></sn-g></sn-blk-nolist></sn-gs></h-g>
</>
-itis

airlines<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>由廉价航空公司提供服务；与廉价航空公司竞争</chn></und></li><li eid="travel_li_33" e_id="13cbac587f0.-55c9" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>book sth through/make a booking through/use</eb>  a travel agent<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>通过旅行社预订；经旅行社代办</chn></und></li><li eid="travel_li_34" e_id="13cbac587f0.-55c7" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>contact/check with</eb>  your travel agent/tour operator<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>联系旅行社；向旅行社咨询</chn></und></li><li eid="travel_li_35" e_id="13cbac587f0.-55c5" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>book/be on/go on</eb>  a package deal/holiday/tour<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>预订／进行／去包价旅游</chn></und></li><li eid="travel_li_36" e_id="13cbac587f0.-55c3" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>buy/bring back</eb>  (tacky/overpriced) souvenirs<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>购买／带回（低劣的／定价过高的）纪念品</chn></und></li></ul></body></unbox></sn-gs></h-g>
</>

status="6">Holidays/vacations<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>假期</chn></h2><ul eid="travel_ul_1" class="bullet" e_id="13cbac587f0.-562b"><li eid="travel_li_1" e_id="13cbac587f0.-562a" e_inline="y"><und holiday/<label-g-blk>(<label-g><geo-blk><geo geo="n_am"><xhtml:a href="helpg:am"><namelabel>NAmE</namelabel></xhtml:a></geo></geo-blk></label-g>) </label-g-blk> a vacation/a break/a day off/<label-g-blk>(<label-g><geo-blk><geo geo="br"><xhtml:a href="helpg:br"><brelabel>BrE</brelabel></xhtml:a></geo></geo-blk></label-g>) </label-g-blk> a gap year<chnsep> (jolly) good show!

(just) around/round the corner

-let

(like rats) deserting/leaving a sinking ship

-ness

e_id="13cbac08c92.6bfe" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">These words all describe people who are easily frightened or are behaving in a frightened way.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>以上各词均形容人神经质、易紧张焦虑、胆怯。</chn></und></p><ul eid="nervous_ul_2" class="deflist" e_id="13cbac08c92.6bff"><li eid="nervous_li_4" e_id="13cbac08c92.6c00" e_inline="y"><unsyn>nervous</unsyn> e_inline="y"><unsyn>neurotic</unsyn> <und margined="n"> not behaving in a reasonable, calm way, because you are worried about sth<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>指神经质的、神经过敏的</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="nervous_xgs_7" e_id="13cbac08c92.6c0a"><x-g-blk eid="nervous_xg_15"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="nervous_x_15" e_id="13cbac08c92.6c0c" e_inline="y" tranID="8" status="6">She became neurotic about keeping the house clean.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>她变得对保持房屋清洁有点神经质。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li eid="nervous_li_6" e_id="13cbac08c92.6c0d" e_inline="y"><unsyn>on edge</unsyn> <und margined="n"> (not) cut it

href="snd://_cut__gbs_42.spx"><audio-gb-liju>🔊</audio-gb-liju></a><xaudio eid="cut_xaudio_72" geo="n_am" name="_cut__ams_42"></xaudio></rx-g></x-g-blk></x-gs></sn-g></sn-blk></sn-gs></idm-g><div class="seealso">See also <a href="entry://entry://cut">cut</a></div>
</>

(not) get/have a look-in

'nother
<head><link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="oalecd9.css" /><script src="oalecd9.js" charset="utf-8" type="text/javascript" language="javascript"></script></head><h-g eid="nother_hg_1"><top-g> <h e_id="13cbac16e46.-57ce">'nother</h><pron e eid="nother_prongs_1" gs href="nother_prongs_1" psg="ald8_nother_prongs_1" resource="phonetics" source="ald8" targeteltid="u4cdebea65f7df6b4.65a4283b.1430b37eb0f.-7418" wd="'nother"><pron-g-blk><brelabel><xhtml:a href="help:bre">BrE</xhtml:a></brelabel> <pron-g><xhtml:a href="help:phonetics"><phon-blk>/<phon>ˈnʌðə(r)</phon>/</phon-blk><audio eid="nother_audio_1" name="_nother#1_gb_1"></audio></xhtml:a></pron-g> <a href="snd://_nother_1_gb_1.spx"><audio-gb>🔊</audio-gb></a></pron-g-blk><pron-g-blk><xhtml:br></xhtml:br><namelabel><xhtml:a href="help:name">NAmE</xhtml:a></namelabel> <pron-g><xhtml:a href="help:phonetics"><phon-blk>/<phon>ˈnʌðər</phon>/</phon-blk><audio eid="nother_audio_2" name="_nother#1_us_1"></audio></xhtml:a></pron-g> <a href="snd://_nother_1_us_1.spx"><audio-us>🔊</audio-us></a></pron-g-blk></pron-gs><pos-g eid="nother_posg_1"> <pos-blk><pos><xhtml:a href="helpp:adj">adjective</xhtml:a></pos></pos-blk></pos-g><label-g-blk> (<label-g><reg-blk><reg e_id="13cbac16e46.-57c8" reg="nonstand"><xhtml:a href="helpr:nonstand">non-standard</xhtml:a></reg></reg-blk></label-g>) </label-g-blk></top-g><sn-gs eid="nother_sngs_1"><sn-blk-nolist><sn-g e_id="13cbac16e46.-57c6" eid="nother_sng_1"><xr-gs firstinblock="y" xt="eq"><xrlabel>  =  </xrlabel><xr-g-blk><xr-g e_targeteltid="13cbaba1a9a.-25e9"><xh-blk><xh><a href="entry://entry://another">another</a></xh></xh-blk></xr-g></xr-g-blk><chnsep> </chnsep><chn></chn> </xr-gs><x-gs eid="nother_xgs_1"><x-g-blk e_id="13cbac16e46.-57c1" eid="nother_xg_1"><xsymb><xhtml:a href="addexample:13cbac16e46.-57c1">◆</xhtml:a></xsymb><rx e eid="nother_rxg_1" g href="nother_rxg_1" resource="recx" source="ald9" targeteltid="13cba896198.-57fe"><x e_id="u4cdebea65f7df6b4.-37641f80.142d74281a8.1b70" eid="nother_x_1" status="2" tranid="2" wd="Now that's a whole 'nother question."><xhtml:a href="x:Now">Now</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="x:that's">that's</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="x:a">a</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="x:whole">whole</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="x:'nother">'nother</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="x:question">question</xhtml:a>.  <xhtml:br></xhtml:br><chn><fthzmark></fthzmark>但那完全是另一个问题。</chn></x><a href="snd://__nother__gbs_1.spx"><audio-gbs-liju>🔊</audio-gbs-liju></a><a href="snd://__nother__uss_1.spx"><audio-uss-liju>🔊</audio-uss-liju></a></rx-g></x-g-blk></x-gs><unbox type="langbank" Name="argue" eid="argue_unbox_1" e_id="13cbaba1a9a.e70"><body eid="argue_body_1" e_id="13cbaba1a9a.e71"><title eid="argue_h1_1" e_id="13cbaba1a9a.e72" e_inline="y"><titled tranID="10" status="1">argue</titled></title><h2 eid="argue_h2_1" e_id="13cbaba1a9a.e73" e_inline="y" tranID="1" status="6">Verbs for reporting an opinion<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>陈述观点的动词</chn></h2><ul eid="argue_ul_1" class="bullet" e_id="13cbaba1a9a.e74"><li nobullet="y"><x-gs eid="argue_xgs_6" e_id="13cbaba1a9a.e76"><x-g-blk eid="argue_xg_14"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="argue_x_14" e_id="13cbaba1a9a.e78" e_inline="y" tranID="2" status="6">Some critics <eb>argue</eb> that Picasso remained a great master all his life.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>一些评论家认为毕加索毕生都是一位大师。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li nobullet="y"><x-gs eid="argue_xgs_7" e_id="13cbaba1a9a.e7b"><x-g-blk eid="argue_xg_15"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="argue_x_15" e_id="13cbaba1a9a.e7d" e_inline="y" tranID="3" status="6">Others <eb>maintain</eb> that there is a significant deterioration in quality in his post-war work.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>其他人坚称他战后的作品质量明显下降。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li nobullet="y"><x-gs eid="argue_xgs_8" e_id="13cbaba1a9a.e80"><x-g-blk eid="argue_xg_16"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="argue_x_16" e_id="13cbaba1a9a.e82" e_inline="y" tranID="4" status="6">Picasso himself <eb>claimed</eb> that good art is created, but great art is stolen.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>毕加索自己声称，好的艺术是创造出来的，伟大的艺术却是偷来的。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li nobullet="y"><x-gs eid="argue_xgs_9" e_id="13cbaba1a9a.e85"><x-g-blk eid="argue_xg_17"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="argue_x_17" e_id="13cbaba1a9a.e87" e_inline="y" tranID="5" status="6"> <eb>As</eb> Smith <eb>has noted</eb>, Picasso borrowed imagery from African art.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>正如史密斯所述，毕加索借用了非洲艺术的意象。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li nobullet="y"><x-gs eid="argue_xgs_10" e_id="13cbaba1a9a.e8b"><x-g-blk eid="argue_xg_18"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="argue_x_18" e_id="13cbaba1a9a.e8d" e_inline="y" tranID="6" status="6"> <eb>As</eb> the author <eb>points out</eb>, Picasso borrowed imagery from African art.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>正如作者指出的那样，毕加索借用了非洲艺术的意象。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li nobullet="y"><x-gs eid="argue_xgs_11" e_id="13cbaba1a9a.e91"><x-g-blk eid="argue_xg_19"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="argue_x_19" e_id="13cbaba1a9a.e93" e_inline="y" tranID="7" status="6">The writer <eb>challenges the notion that</eb> Picasso's sculpture was secondary to his painting.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>作者对这种观点表示质疑，即毕加索的雕塑不及他的绘画。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li nobullet="y"><x-gs eid="argue_xgs_12" e_id="13cbaba1a9a.e96"><x-g-blk eid="argue_xg_20"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="argue_x_20" e_id="13cbaba1a9a.e98" e_inline="y" tranID="8" status="6"> <eb>It has been suggested that</eb> Picasso's painting was influenced by jazz music.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>据说毕加索的绘画受到爵士乐的影响。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li></ul><xr-gs xt="langbankat"><xrhead> <arrow>➡</arrow> <b>language bank</b> at</xrhead><xr-g-blk><xr-g> <xh><xhtml:a href="xid:13cbab9c8f4.1a0d">about</xhtml:a></xh></xr-g></xr-g-blk><xr-g-blk>, <xr-g> <xh><xhtml:a href="xid:13cbab9c8f4.3127">according to</xhtml:a></xh></xr-g></xr-g-blk></xr-gs></body></unbox></sn-g></sn-blk-nolist></sn-gs></h-g>
</>
(nothing but/all/only) skin and bone

(not) in your right mind
<head><link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="oalecd9.css" /><script src="oalecd9.js" charset="utf-8" type="text/javascript" language="javascript"></script></head><idm-g e_id="13cbac3647b.-3ab4" eid="right_idmg_2"><top-g><idm-blk e_id="13cbac3647b.-3ab2" eid="right_idm_2"><xsymb><xhtml:a href="addid:13cbac3647b.-3ab2">●</xhtml:a></xsymb><idm e_id="13cbac3647b.-3ab2" eid="right_idm_2">(<ftindex context="(not) in your right ˈmind" itemid="13cbac3647b.-3ab2" type="id" word="not"></ftindex><xhtml:a href="xi:not">not</xhtml:a>) <ftindex context="(not) in your right ˈmind" itemid="13cbac3647b.-3ab2" type="id" word="in"></ftindex><xhtml:a href="xi:in">in</xhtml:a> <ftindex context="(not) in your right ˈmind" itemid="13cbac3647b.-3ab2" type="id" word="your"></ftindex><xhtml:a href="xi:your">your</xhtml:a> <ftindex context="(not) in your right ˈmind" itemid="13cbac3647b.-3ab2" type="id" word="right"></ftindex><xhtml:a href="xi:right">right</xhtml:a> <ftindex context="(not) in your right ˈmind" itemid="13cbac3647b.-3ab2" type="id" word="ˈmind"></ftindex><xhtml:a href="xi:mind">ˈmind</xhtml:a></idm></idm-blk></top-g><sn-gs eid="right_sngs_8"><sn-blk><sn-g eid="right_sng_10" n=""><def neh="n" noblk="y">(<xhtml:a href="d:not">not</xhtml:a>) <xhtml:a href="d:mentally">mentally</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:normal">normal</xhtml:a><chnsep> </chnsep><chn><fthzindex contents="精神正常（或不正常）" encontext="" type="d"></fthzindex>精神正常（或不正常）</chn></def><unbox e_id="13cbac01393.-1086" eid="mad_unbox_1" name="mad" type="synonyms"><body e_id="13cbac01393.-1085" eid="mad_body_1"><title e_id="13cbac01393.-1084" e_inline="y" eid="mad_h1_1"><titled status="1" tranid="33">mad</titled></title><inlinelist><und margined="n">crazy</und> ◇ <und margined="n">nuts</und> ◇ <und margined="n">batty</und> ◇ <und margined="n">out of your mind</und> ◇ <und margined="n">(not) in your right mind</und></inlinelist><p e_id="13cbac01393.-107d" e_inline="y" eid="mad_p_1"><und margined="n">These are all informal words that describe sb who has a mind that does not work normally.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>以上各词均为非正式用语，指人神经错乱、精神失常。</chn></und></p><ul class="deflist" e_id="13cbac01393.-107c" eid="mad_ul_2"><li e_id="13cbac01393.-107b" e_inline="y" eid="mad_li_6"><unsyn>mad</unsyn> <und margined="n"><label-g-blk>(<label-g><reg-blk><reg reg="infml"><xhtml:a href="helpr:infml">informal</xhtml:a></reg>, </reg-blk><geo-blk><geo geo="br"><q>especially</q> <xhtml:a href="helpg:br"><brelabel>BrE</brelabel></xhtml:a></geo></geo-blk></label-g>) </label-g-blk> having a mind that does not work normally<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>指疯的、神经错乱的、有精神病的</chn>：</und><x-gs e_id="13cbac01393.-1076" eid="mad_xgs_11"><x-g-blk eid="mad_xg_24"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x e_id="13cbac01393.-1074" e_inline="y" eid="mad_x_24" status="6" tranid="5">I thought I'd go mad if I stayed any longer.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>我觉得再待久一点我就会发疯。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs><un e_id="13cbac01393.-1073" un="note"> <boxtag>NOTE</boxtag> <eb>Mad</eb>  is an informal word used to suggest that sb's behaviour is very strange, often because of extreme emotional pressure. It is offensive if used to describe sb suffering from a real mental illness; use  <eb>mentally ill</eb>  instead.  <eb>Mad</eb>  is not usually used in this meaning in North American English; use  <eb>crazy</eb>  instead.<chnsep> * </chnsep><chn>mad 为非正式用语，暗指由于极度的精神压力而行为怪异，用于真正的精神病患者意含冒犯，故用 mentally ill 代之。在美式英语中，通常不用 mad 表示此义，而用 crazy。</chn></un></li><li e_id="13cbac01393.-106e" e_inline="y" eid="mad_li_7"><unsyn>crazy</unsyn> <und margined="n"><label-g-blk>(<label-g><reg-blk><reg reg="infml"><xhtml:a href="helpr:infml">informal</xhtml:a></reg></reg-blk></label-g>) </label-g-blk> having a mind that does not work normally<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>指疯的、神经错乱的、有精神病的</chn>：</und><x-gs e_id="13cbac01393.-1069" eid="mad_xgs_12"><x-g-blk eid="mad_xg_25"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x e_id="13cbac01393.-1067" e_inline="y" eid="mad_x_25" status="6" tranid="8">A crazy old woman rented the upstairs room.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>一个疯老太婆租了楼上那个房间。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs><un e_id="13cbac01393.-1066" un="note"> <boxtag>NOTE</boxtag> Like  <eb>mad</eb>,  <eb>crazy</eb>  is offensive if used to describe sb suffering from a real mental illness.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>与 mad 一样，crazy 用于真正的精神病患者具冒犯意。</chn></un></li><li e_id="13cbac01393.-1063" e_inline="y" eid="mad_li_8"><unsyn>nuts</unsyn> <und margined="n"><gram-g><gram-blk> [<gram e_id=""><xhtml:a href="helpgr:nbn">not before noun</xhtml:a></gram>] </gram-blk></gram-g><label-g-blk>(<label-g><reg-blk><reg reg="infml"><xhtml:a href="helpr:infml">informal</xhtml:a></reg></reg-blk></label-g>) </label-g-blk> mad<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>指发疯、神经错乱</chn>：</und><x-gs e_id="13cbac01393.-1060" eid="mad_xgs_13"><x-g-blk eid="mad_xg_26"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x e_id="13cbac01393.-105e" e_inline="y" eid="mad_x_26" status="6" tranid="11">That noise is driving me nuts!<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>那噪音吵得我要疯了！</chn></x></x-g-blk><x-g-blk eid="mad_xg_27"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x e_id="13cbac01393.-105c" e_inline="y" eid="mad_x_27" status="6" tranid="13">You guys are nuts!<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>你们这些家伙全疯了！</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li e_id="13cbac01393.-105b" e_inline="y" eid="mad_li_9"><unsyn>batty</unsyn> <und margined="n"><label-g-blk>(<label-g><reg-blk><reg reg="infml"><xhtml:a href="helpr:infml">informal</xhtml:a></reg>, </reg-blk><geo-blk><geo geo="br"><q>especially</q> <xhtml:a href="helpg:br"><brelabel>BrE</brelabel></xhtml:a></geo></geo-blk></label-g>) </label-g-blk> slightly mad, in a harmless way<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>指疯疯癫癫的、古怪的</chn>：</und><x-gs e_id="13cbac01393.-1056" eid="mad_xgs_14"><x-g-blk eid="mad_xg_28"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x e_id="13cbac01393.-1054" e_inline="y" eid="mad_x_28" status="6" tranid="15">Her mum's completely batty.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>她妈妈完全是疯疯癫癫的。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li e_id="13cbac01393.-1053" e_inline="y" eid="mad_li_10"><unsyn>out of your mind</unsyn> <und margined="n"><label-g-blk>(<label-g><reg-blk><reg reg="infml"><xhtml:a href="helpr:infml">informal</xhtml:a></reg></reg-blk></label-g>) </label-g-blk> unable to think or behave normally, especially because of extreme shock or anxiety<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>尤指因极度震惊或焦虑而心智失常、发疯</chn>：</und><x-gs e_id="13cbac01393.-1050" eid="mad_xgs_15"><x-g-blk eid="mad_xg_29"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x e_id="13cbac01393.-104e" e_inline="y" eid="mad_x_29" status="6" tranid="17">She was out of her mind with grief.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>她悲痛得精神失常了。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li e_id="13cbac01393.-104d" e_inline="y" eid="mad_li_11"><unsyn>(not) in your right mind</unsyn> <und margined="n"><label-g-blk>(<label-g><reg-blk><reg reg="infml"><xhtml:a href="helpr:infml">informal</xhtml:a></reg></reg-blk></label-g>) </label-g-blk> (not) mentally normal<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>指精神（不）正常</chn>：</und><x-gs e_id="13cbac01393.-104a" eid="mad_xgs_16"><x-g-blk eid="mad_xg_30"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x e_id="13cbac01393.-1048" e_inline="y" eid="mad_x_30" status="6" tranid="19"> <ebi>No one in their right mind</ebi> would choose to work there.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>任何一个精神正常的人都不会选择去那里工作。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li></ul><h3 e_id="13cbac01393.-1046" e_inline="y" eid="mad_h3_1" status="1" tranid="39">Patterns</h3><ul class="bullet" e_id="13cbac01393.-1045" eid="mad_ul_3"><li e_id="13cbac01393.-1044" e_inline="y" eid="mad_li_12"><und margined="n">to be mad/crazy/nuts/out of your mind/not in your right mind  <eb>to do sth</eb> (on the one hand…) on the other (hand)…

in which they use the Internet.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>参与了这项研究的女生和男生之间的主要差异之一在于他们使用互联网的方式。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li nobullet="y"><x-gs e_id="13cbabc0139.-a47" eid="contrast_xgs_9"><x-g-blk friends, the boys questioned in this survey tend to use the Internet for playing computer games.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>女生使用互联网主要是和朋友联系，这一点和男生不同，参与调查的男生往往是使用互联网来玩电脑游戏。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li nobullet="y"><x-gs e_id="13cbabc0139.-a42" eid="contrast_xgs_10"><x-g-blk boys, the girls spend much more time chatting to friends on the telephone.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>与男生相比，女生花在与朋友电话聊天上的时间要多得多。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li nobullet="y"><x-gs four hours a week chatting to friends on the phone. <eb>In contrast</eb>, very few of the boys spend more than five minutes a day talking to their friends in this way.<chnsep> (open) the door to sth

-or
<head><link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="oalecd9.css" /><script src="oalecd9.js" charset="utf-8" type="text/javascript" language="javascript"></script></head><h-g eid="or_hg_2"><top-g> <h e_id="13cbac16e46.14e4">-or</h><pos-g eid="or_posg_2"> <pos-blk><pos><xhtml:a href="helpp:suff">suffix</xhtml:a></pos></pos-blk></pos-g></top-g><sn-gs eid="or_sngs_4"><sn-blk-nolist><sn-g eid="or_sng_10"><use-blk noblk="y"> (<use><xhtml:a href="d:in">in</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:nouns">nouns</xhtml:a><chnsep> </chnsep><chn>构成名词</chn></use>) </use-blk><def neh="n" noblk="n"><xhtml:a href="d:a">a</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:person">person</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:or">or</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:thing">thing</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:that">that</xhtml:a><chnsep> </chnsep><chn><fthzmark></fthzmark>…的人（或物）</chn></def><x-gs eid="or_xgs_10"><x-g-blk e_id="13cbac16e46.14ee" eid="or_xg_16"><xsymb><xhtml:a href="addexample:13cbac16e46.14ee">◆</xhtml:a></xsymb><x e_id="13cbac16e46.14ef" e_inline="y" eid="or_x_16" status="6" tranid="3"><xhtml:a href="x:actor">actor</xhtml:a><xhtml:br></xhtml:br><chn><fthzmark></fthzmark>演员</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs><xr-gs firstinblock="n" xt="cp"><xrlabel> <xhtml:a href="helpxr:cp"> <arrow>➡</arrow>  compare</xhtml:a> </xrlabel><xr-g-blk><xr-g e_targeteltid="13cbabce420.6689"><xh-blk><xh><a href="entry://entry://-ee">-ee</a></xh></xh-blk><xs-blk> (<xs e_id=""><xhtml:a href="d:1">1</xhtml:a></xs>) </xs-blk></xr-g></xr-g-blk><xr-g-blk>, <xr-g e_targeteltid="13cbabd5a4a.-2cd1"><xh-blk><xh><a href="entry://entry://-er">-er</a></xh></xh-blk><xs-blk> (<xs e_id=""><xhtml:a href="d:1">1</xhtml:a></xs>) </xs-blk></xr-g></xr-g-blk> </xr-gs></sn-g></sn-blk-nolist><unbox type="synonyms" Name="option" eid="option_unbox_1" e_id="13cbac16e46.134f"><body eid="option_body_1" e_id="13cbac16e46.1350"><title eid="option_h1_1" e_id="13cbac16e46.1351" e_inline="y"><titled tranID="31" status="1">option</titled></title><inlinelist><und margined="n">choice</und> ◇ <und margined="n">alternative</und> ◇ <und margined="n">possibility</und></inlinelist><p eid="option_p_1" e_id="13cbac16e46.1356" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">These are all words for sth that you choose to do in a particular situation.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>以上各词均指某种情况下的选择。</chn></und></p><ul eid="option_ul_2" class="deflist" e_id="13cbac16e46.1357"><li eid="option_li_4" e_id="13cbac16e46.1358" e_inline="y"><unsyn>option</unsyn> <und margined="n"> something that you can choose to have or do; the freedom to choose what you do<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>指可选择的事物、选择、选择权、选择的自由</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="option_xgs_7" e_id="13cbac16e46.135a"><x-g-blk eid="option_xg_19"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="option_x_19" e_id="13cbac16e46.135c" e_inline="y" tranID="5" status="6">As I see it, we have two options…<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>据我看，我们有两种选择…</chn></x></x-g-blk><x-g-blk eid="option_xg_20"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="option_x_20" e_id="13cbac16e46.135e" e_inline="y" tranID="7" status="6">Students have the option of studying abroad in their second year.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>学生在二年级时可以选择出国学习。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs><un un="note" e_id="13cbac16e46.135f"> <boxtag>NOTE</boxtag> <und margined="n"> <eb>Option</eb>  is also the word used in computing for one of the choices you can make when using a computer program.<chnsep> * </chnsep><chn>option 亦指计算机程序里的选项、选择</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="option_xgs_8" e_id="13cbac16e46.1361"><x-g-blk eid="option_xg_21"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="option_x_21" e_id="13cbac16e46.1363" e_inline="y" tranID="9" status="6">Choose the 'Cut' option from the Edit menu.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>从编辑选单上选择 “剪切” 项。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></un></li><li eid="option_li_5" e_id="13cbac16e46.1364" e_inline="y"><unsyn>choice</unsyn> <und margined="n"> the freedom to choose what you do; something that you can choose to have or do<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>指选择权、选择的自由、选择、可选择的事物</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="option_xgs_9" e_id="13cbac16e46.1366"><x-g-blk eid="option_xg_22"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="option_x_22" e_id="13cbac16e46.1368" e_inline="y" tranID="11" status="6">If I had the choice, I would stop working tomorrow.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>如果让我选择，我明天就停止工作。</chn></x></x-g-blk><x-g-blk eid="option_xg_"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="option_x_" e_id="13cbac16e46.136a" e_inline="y" tranID="13" status="6">There is a wide range of choices open to you.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>你有很多选择。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li eid="option_li_6" e_id="13cbac16e46.136b" e_inline="y"><unsyn>alternative</unsyn> <und margined="n"> something that you can choose to have or do out of two or more possibilities<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>指可供选择的事物、其中一种选择</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="option_xgs_10" e_id="13cbac16e46.136d"><x-g-blk eid="option_xg_24"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="option_x_24" e_id="13cbac16e46.136f" e_inline="y" tranID="15" status="6">You can be paid in cash weekly or by cheque monthly: those are the two alternatives.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>你的工资可以按周以现金支取，或按月以支票支取。二者可选其一。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li></ul><h3 eid="option_h3_1" e_id="13cbac16e46.1370" e_inline="y" tranID="16" status="6">option, choice or alternative?<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>用 option、choice 还是 alternative？</chn></h3><p eid="option_p_2" e_id="13cbac16e46.1371" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>Choice</eb>  is slightly less formal than  <eb>option</eb>  and  <eb>alternative</eb>  is slightly more formal.  <eb>Choice</eb>  is most often used for 'the freedom to choose', although you can sometimes also use  <eb>option</eb>  (but not usually  <eb>alternative</eb>).<chnsep> * </chnsep><chn>choice 较 option 稍非正式，而 alternative 更正式些。表示选择权或选择的自由最常用 choice，不过有时也可用 option，但通常不用 alternative</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="option_xgs_11" e_id="13cbac16e46.1378"><x-g-blk eid="option_xg_25"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="option_x_25" e_id="13cbac16e46.137a" e_inline="y" tranID="18" status="6">If I had the choice/option, I would…<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>如果让我选择，我会…</chn></x></x-g-blk><x-g-blk eid="option_xg_26"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><wx eid="option_wx_1" e_id="13cbac16e46.137c">If I had the alternative, I would…</wx></x-g-blk><x-g-blk eid="option_xg_27"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="option_x_26" e_id="13cbac16e46.137e" e_inline="y" tranID="21" status="6">parental choice in education<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>父母在教育方面的选择权</chn></x></x-g-blk><x-g-blk eid="option_xg_28"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><wx eid="option_wx_2" e_id="13cbac16e46.1380">parental option/alternative in education</wx></x-g-blk></x-gs><und margined="y">Things that you can choose are  <eb>options</eb>,  <eb>choices</eb>  or  <eb>alternatives</eb>. However,  <eb>alternative</eb>  is more frequently used to talk about choosing between two things rather than several.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>表示可选择的事物用 option、choice 或 alternative 均可。不过，alternative 较常用以指两个而非多个可选项。</chn></und></p><ul eid="option_ul_3" class="deflist" e_id="13cbac16e46.1385"><li eid="option_li_7" e_id="13cbac16e46.1386" e_inline="y"><unsyn>possibility</unsyn> <und margined="n"> one of the different things that you can do in a particular situation<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>指某种情况下可选择的事物</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="option_xgs_12" e_id="13cbac16e46.1388"><x-g-blk eid="option_xg_29"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="option_x_27" e_id="13cbac16e46.138a" e_inline="y" tranID="25" status="6">We need to explore a wide range of possibilities.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>我们需要探究各种可能的情况。</chn></x></x-g-blk><x-g-blk eid="option_xg_30"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="option_x_28" e_id="13cbac16e46.138c" e_inline="y" tranID="27" status="6">The possibilities are endless.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>可想的办法是无穷的。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs><un un="note" e_id="13cbac16e46.138d"> <boxtag>NOTE</boxtag> <und margined="n"> <eb>Possibility</eb>  can be used in a similar way to  <eb>option</eb>,  <eb>choice</eb>  and  <eb>alternative</eb>, but the emphasis here is less on the need to make a choice, and more on what is available.<chnsep> * </chnsep><chn>possibility 的用法与 option、choice 和 alternative 相似，不过其重点主要在于可选择的事物而非需要作出选择。</chn></und></un></li></ul><h3 eid="option_h3_2" e_id="13cbac16e46.1392" e_inline="y" tranID="39" status="1">Patterns</h3><ul eid="option_ul_4" class="bullet" e_id="13cbac16e46.1393"><li eid="option_li_8" e_id="13cbac16e46.1394" e_inline="y"><und margined="n"> <eb>with/without</eb>  the option/choice/possibility  <eb>of </eb>  sth</und></li><li eid="option_li_9" e_id="13cbac16e46.1397" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">a(n)  <eb>good/acceptable/reasonable/possible</eb>  option/choice/alternative</und></li><li eid="option_li_10" e_id="13cbac16e46.1399" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">the  <eb>only</eb>  option/choice/alternative/possibility  <eb>open to</eb>  sb </und></li><li eid="option_li_11" e_id="13cbac16e46.139c" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">to  <eb>have</eb>  a/an/the option/choice  <eb>of doing sth</eb> </und></li><li eid="option_li_12" e_id="13cbac16e46.139f" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">to  <eb>have no</eb>  option/choice/alternative  <eb>but to</eb>  do sth</und></li><li eid="option_li_13" e_id="13cbac16e46.13a2" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">a  <eb>number/range of</eb>  options/choices/alternatives/possibilities</und></li></ul></body></unbox></sn-gs></h-g>
</>
-ory
<head><link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="oalecd9.css" /><script src="oalecd9.js" charset="utf-8" type="text/javascript" language="javascript"></script></head><h-g eid="ory_hg_1"><top-g> <h e_id="13cbac16e46.26d7">-ory</h><pos-g eid="ory_posg_1"> <pos-blk><pos><xhtml:a href="helpp:suff">suffix</xhtml:a></pos></pos-blk></pos-g></top-g><sn-gs eid="ory_sngs_1"><sn-blk shcut="n"><xhtml:ol start="1"><xhtml:li><licontent><sn-g eid="ory_sng_1" n=""><use-blk noblk="y"> (<use><xhtml:a href="d:in">in</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:adjectives">adjectives</xhtml:a><chnsep> </chnsep><chn>构成形容词</chn></use>) </use-blk><def neh="n" noblk="n"><xhtml:a href="d:that">that</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:does…">does…</xhtml:a>; <xhtml:a href="d:involving">involving</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:the">the</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:action">action</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:concerned">concerned</xhtml:a><chnsep> </chnsep><chn><fthzmark></fthzmark>起…作用的；包含相关动作的</chn></def><x-gs eid="ory_xgs_1"><x-g-blk e_id="13cbac16e46.26e1" eid="ory_xg_1"><xsymb><xhtml:a href="addexample:13cbac16e46.26e1">◆</xhtml:a></xsymb><x e_id="13cbac16e46.26e2" e_inline="y" eid="ory_x_1" status="6" tranid="3"><xhtml:a href="x:explanatory">explanatory</xhtml:a><xhtml:br></xhtml:br><chn><fthzmark></fthzmark>解释性的</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></sn-g></licontent></xhtml:li></xhtml:ol></sn-blk><sn-blk shcut="n"><xhtml:ol start="2"><xhtml:li><licontent><sn-g eid="ory_sng_2" n=""><use-blk noblk="y"> (<use><xhtml:a href="d:in">in</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:nouns">nouns</xhtml:a><chnsep> </chnsep><chn>构成名词</chn></use>) </use-blk><def neh="n" noblk="n"><xhtml:a href="d:a">a</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:place">place</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:for">for</xhtml:a><chnsep> </chnsep><chn><fthzmark></fthzmark>…的地方</chn></def><x-gs eid="ory_xgs_2"><x-g-blk e_id="13cbac16e46.26e7" eid="ory_xg_2"><xsymb><xhtml:a href="addexample:13cbac16e46.26e7">◆</xhtml:a></xsymb><x e_id="13cbac16e46.26e8" e_inline="y" eid="ory_x_2" status="6" tranid="6"><xhtml:a href="x:observatory">observatory</xhtml:a><xhtml:br></xhtml:br><chn><fthzmark></fthzmark>天文台</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></sn-g></licontent></xhtml:li></xhtml:ol></sn-blk></sn-gs></h-g>

-ous
<head><link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="oalecd9.css" /><script src="oalecd9.js" charset="utf-8" type="text/javascript" language="javascript"></script></head><h-g eid="ous_hg_1"><top-g> <h e_id="13cbac16e46.2c9b">-ous</h><pos-g eid="ous_posg_1"> <pos-blk><pos><xhtml:a href="helpp:suff">suffix</xhtml:a></pos></pos-blk></pos-g><res-g eid="ous_resg_1"></res-g></top-g><sn-gs eid="ous_sngs_1"><sn-blk-nolist><sn-g eid="ous_sng_1"><use-blk noblk="y"> (<use><xhtml:a href="d:in">in</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:adjectives">adjectives</xhtml:a><chnsep> </chnsep><chn>构成形容词</chn></use>) </use-blk><def neh="n" noblk="n"><xhtml:a href="d:having">having</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:the">the</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:nature">nature</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:or">or</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:quality">quality</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:of">of</xhtml:a><chnsep> </chnsep><chn><fthzmark></fthzmark>有…性质的</chn></def><x-gs eid="ous_xgs_1"><x-g-blk e_id="13cbac16e46.2ca8" eid="ous_xg_1"><xsymb><xhtml:a href="addexample:13cbac16e46.2ca8">◆</xhtml:a></xsymb><x e_id="13cbac16e46.2ca9" e_inline="y" eid="ous_x_1" status="6" tranid="3"><xhtml:a href="x:poisonous">poisonous</xhtml:a><xhtml:br></xhtml:br><chn><fthzmark></fthzmark>有毒的</chn></x></x-g-blk><x-g-blk e_id="13cbac16e46.2caa" eid="ous_xg_2"><xsymb><xhtml:a href="addexample:13cbac16e46.2caa">◆</xhtml:a></xsymb><x e_id="13cbac16e46.2cab" e_inline="y" eid="ous_x_2" status="6" tranid="4"><xhtml:a href="x:mountainous">mountainous</xhtml:a><xhtml:br></xhtml:br><chn><fthzmark></fthzmark>多山的</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></sn-g></sn-blk-nolist></sn-gs><unbox type="grammar" Name="modal verbs" eid="modal_unbox_1" e_id="13cbac08c92.-289f"><body eid="modal_body_1" e_id="13cbac08c92.-289e"><title eid="modal_h1_1" e_id="13cbac08c92.-289d" e_inline="y"><titled tranID="19" status="1">modal verbs</titled></title><ul eid="modal_ul_1" class="bullet" e_id="13cbac08c92.-289c"><li eid="modal_li_1" e_id="13cbac08c92.-289b" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">The  <eb>modal verbs</eb>  are  <eb>can</eb>,  <eb>could</eb>,  <eb>may</eb>,  <eb>might</eb>,  <eb>must</eb>,  <eb>ought to</eb>,  <eb>shall</eb>,  <eb>should</eb>,  <eb>will</eb>  and  <eb>would</eb>.  <eb>Dare</eb>,  <eb>need</eb>,  <eb>have to</eb>  and  <eb>used to</eb>  also share some of the features of modal verbs.<chnsep> * </chnsep><chn>can、could、may、might、must、ought to、shall、should、will 和 would 均为情态动词。dare、need、have to 和 used to 亦具有情态动词的某些特性。</chn></und></li><li eid="modal_li_2" e_id="13cbac08c92.-288b" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">Modal verbs have only one form. They have no <ei eid="modal_ei_4" e_id="13cbac08c92.-288a">-ing</ei> or <ei eid="modal_ei_5" e_id="13cbac08c92.-2889">-ed</ei> forms and do not add <ei eid="modal_ei_6" e_id="13cbac08c92.-2888">-s</ei> to the 3rd person singular form.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>情态动词只有一种形式，没有 -ing 或 -ed 形式，第三人称单数也不加 -s</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="modal_xgs_1" e_id="13cbac08c92.-2887"><x-g-blk eid="modal_xg_1"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="modal_x_1" e_id="13cbac08c92.-2885" e_inline="y" tranID="4" status="6">He can speak three languages.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>他会说三种语言。</chn></x></x-g-blk><x-g-blk eid="modal_xg_2"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="modal_x_2" e_id="13cbac08c92.-2883" e_inline="y" tranID="6" status="6">She will try and visit tomorrow.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>她明天将设法去参观。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li eid="modal_li_3" e_id="13cbac08c92.-2882" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">Modal verbs are followed by the infinitive of another verb without  <eb>to</eb>. The exceptions are  <eb>ought to</eb>,  <eb>have to</eb>  and  <eb>used to</eb>.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>情态动词后跟不带 to 的动词不定式，但 ought to、have to 和 used to 例外</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="modal_xgs_2" e_id="13cbac08c92.-287d"><x-g-blk eid="modal_xg_3"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="modal_x_3" e_id="13cbac08c92.-287b" e_inline="y" tranID="8" status="6">You must find a job.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>你必须找到一份工作。</chn></x></x-g-blk><x-g-blk eid="modal_xg_4"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="modal_x_4" e_id="13cbac08c92.-2879" e_inline="y" tranID="10" status="6">You ought to stop smoking.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>你应当戒烟。</chn></x></x-g-blk><x-g-blk eid="modal_xg_5"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="modal_x_5" e_id="13cbac08c92.-2877" e_inline="y" tranID="12" status="6">I used to smoke but I gave up two years ago.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>我过去抽烟，但两年前就戒了。</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li eid="modal_li_4" e_id="13cbac08c92.-2876" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">Questions are formed without  <eb>do</eb> / <eb>does</eb>  in the present, or  <eb>did</eb>  in the past.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>疑问句现在时不用 do/does，过去时不用 did</chn>：</und><x-gs eid="modal_xgs_3" e_id="13cbac08c92.-2872"><x-g-blk eid="modal_xg_6"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="modal_x_6" e_id="13cbac08c92.-2870" e_inline="y" tranID="14" status="6">Can I invite Mary?<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>我可以邀请玛丽吗？</chn></x></x-g-blk><x-g-blk eid="modal_xg_7"><xsymb>◆</xsymb><x eid="modal_x_7" e_id="13cbac08c92.-286e" e_inline="y" tranID="16" status="6">Should I have invited Mary?<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>我本该邀请玛丽吗？</chn></x></x-g-blk></x-gs></li><li eid="modal_li_5" e_id="13cbac08c92.-286d" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">Negative sentences are formed with  <eb>not</eb>  or the short form  <eb>-n't</eb>  and do not use  <eb>do</eb> / <eb>does</eb>  or  <eb>did</eb>.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>否定句用 not 或简约式 -n't，不用 do/does 或 did。</chn></und></li></ul><p eid="modal_p_1" e_id="13cbac08c92.-2867" e_inline="y"><und margined="n">You will find more help with how to use modal verbs at the dictionary entries for each verb.<chnsep> </chnsep><chn>情态动词的不同用法可参考本词典里各情态动词词条。</chn></und></p></body></unbox><dr-gs eid="ous_drgs_1"><dr-g-blk><dr-g e_id="13cbac16e46.2cad" eid="ous_drg_1"><drtri><xhtml:a href="adddr:13cbac16e46.2cad">▸</xhtml:a></drtri> <top-g><dr-blk><dr e_id="13cbac16e46.2caf" eid="ous_dr_1">-ously</dr> </dr-blk></top-g><sn-gs eid="ous_sngs_2"><sn-blk-nolist><sn-g eid="ous_sng_2"><use-blk noblk="y"> (<use><xhtml:a href="d:in">in</xhtml:a> <xhtml:a href="d:adverbs">adverbs</xhtml:a><chnsep> </chnsep><chn>构成副词</chn></use>) </use-blk><x-gs eid="ous_xgs_2"><x-g-blk e_id="13cbac16e46.2cb6" eid="ous_xg_3"><xsymb><xhtml:a href="addexample:13cbac16e46.2cb6">◆</xhtml:a></xsymb><x e_id="13cbac16e46.2cb7" e_inline="y" eid="ous_x_3" status="6" tranid="6"><xhtml:a -sion

(slip/be thrown) out of gear

(straight) from the horse's mouth

(take to sth) like a duck to water

(that's/it's) always the way

'-via
@@@LINK=via
</>
(waiting) in the wings

(with) arms akimbo

'zine

à la

à la carte

à la mode

émigré
